I drove up to the Chick-fil-A in Bolingbrook, where I was in and out of their drive-thru in under 2 minutes, happily gobbling my chicken nuggets.

I get that Steak n' Shake probably isn't recruiting from Stanford these days, but is it too much to expect even a modicum of competency here?  Chick-fil-A seems to think so.  Experiences like these sometimes leave me to wonder if the service sector we've constructed within this country to instantly satiate bourgeois desires isn't destined to crumble into a fiery abyss of cynicism, revulsion and revolution.

Service was good,  food was dreary and needs work. The fries look like the life has been sucked from them and are limp. 

The milkshake was alright,  however the cookie dough did not taste like cookie dough. What a disappointment. 

I would not go back to steak and shake with this kind of atmosphere and food.

The worst place ever. . How do you send out food like this . The cheese dip was sealed tight but it was like they then spooned it in the bag all over everything. Dirty looking outsides of the shakes. I would even take a dog there to eat .  Kicking myself for even thinking about stopping here

Went to the drive through last night waited at the speaker for over 5 minutes before someone took our order had it repeated to us. Upon arrival at the window they did not have the full order had to wait for the order taker to come back to the window to tell me I didn't order it. sERIOUSLY?? You repeated it to me and there were 2 of us in the car that heard it. Service was disappointing for fast food
This place has the worst service ever. It took 15 minutes to get a milk shake in the drive thru. Definitley not going back to this location.

As other reviewers, I have been here numerous times. I have dined in and carried out thru drive thru. All aspects completely stink. Drive thru has forgotten items ( i do not live close by) from my order, and taken over 25 minutes for an order. Dining in, tables are not clean, shakes come after food, service stinks, and food is cold. Save your money and avoid this place. Out of about 8 visits, none are stellar. I finally said that I am done going here. Typical bill for 2 adults and 3 kids is over $40.00. not worth it.

Absolutely TERRIBLE service!!!! Incredibly slow kitchen and wait staff.  Overall, they appear to lack any training.  The staff doesn't seem to care or know what they are supposed to be doing. I overheard an employee complain about how dirty the floor was and that there was garbage everywhere. This is not what a diner finishing her food wants to hear! One couple left after waiting over 20 minutes without food or drink.  They were smart, they didn't miss out on good food!  This was my first and last experience at Steak and Shake! Save your money, do not go here!

I love steaks and I love shakes...
Fries and cheese, large orange freeze...
Check your bag, check it twice...
The service here ain't real nice...

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. They took a very long time just to seat us and the wait for the food was even longer. It took about 50 minutes from when we walked in the door to finally get our food. The waitress was too lazy to even serve everyone water. I'm glad I do not live in the area because I will never be coming here again.
Great value. Super fast and courteous service. My burger was delicious and it resembled a photo. The fresh toppings were placed so meticulously. Our server was very kind.

I have never been so dissatisfied with a steak and shake in my life. They didn't give me silverware, their fries looked like they had the life sucked out of them, and their burger looked straight gross. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE, put them out of business place.

ZERO stars. I will never take my family here again. Not only did they not bring out a cup of chili that I ordered (I finally had to remind them) but my drink had a fruit fly IN the ice cube. DISGUSTING. We asked for the manager, he came out and said that he would take that one drink off our bill. Terrible service and it's obviously a dirty place. Look elsewhere to eat!
Avoid, I've never seen chunky creamer with a full set of crusty dishes.  Never got silverware.. I can't... I can't even talk about my burger... Horrid.

Worst customer service I've ever received! If you come here never go through the drive-thru. I placed an order for 3 milkshakes. Came up to the window and paid then the people working the drive-thru walked away. I was there for about 20 minutes waiting on my milkshakes when I looked through the window and there they were sitting inside. Seems as though they had made the milkshakes but forgot to hand them out. No idea how that can even happen. So I pried open the drive thru window and started asking for my milkshakes. I was finally given them but they were melted of course. So manager Jake went ahead and remade them. This will be the last time I come here.

I get seated. I have one waiter come up and just say hi did. Not even ask what I wanted to eat . It took 10 min for another competent waitress to come and ask if we had been helped and take our order. Talk about bad customer survive.

This place is filthy! I used to work at this restaurant and the back is disgusting. All the workers hate working there meaning the customer service is awful. While working there I made a family of two and a baby wait over an hour for the good because the kitchen lacks in organization and efficiency. I wouldn't let my worst enemy work there. However I know the blonde older woman who works the over night shifts is every hard working and deserves to be treated better by management. Maybe is the store got fixed up and got the right people to actually run and care about that store it would thrive more! But for now it's the last place you'll ever find me. However, I do love the stake n shake outside of town! Much better in all aspects!

Worst. Location. Ever.

I've been here twice (drive-thru)..both times my order was messed up when I only ordered 1 item. Last time I ordered a single cheeseburger with bacon. I got a double cheese, no bacon (that's what it said on the receipt & I was charged for that). I went back in, they said I could keep the double & they would put bacon on it. No thanks, I want what I ordered & a refund for the difference. They made me a new one...I left...I went to eat it..guess what...no bacon & half the bun was stale! I did not go back & never will. They need to get their act together!
What has happened here?  No guest service.  I use the drive thru now.  I just get a shake every now and then.

This may be the dirtiest restaurant I have ever visited. I thought maybe it was just a very busy Saturday. While waiting a long time to pay my bill, I noticed that even the cash register was very dirty. A plastic display cookie display case on the counter was covered with dust and dirt. I pointed this out to the manager, she said they were working on it, but no body was cleaning. This dirt accumulated over a long period of time. They are not working on it and I don't think they care. Disgusting ! I will never return. Stay away!

You know, it's not a fancy place.  I almost always have to ask the server for something that was forgotten (side of mayo, refill on pop), but who cares.  I'm not going here for fine dining.  I'm going here because the people are nice, the food is very good, and it's nice and cheap.  And that's what I get.  

Keep it up!

We've recently discovered Steak N Shake restaurants and find them to be an excellent value with really good food.  Three of us had lunch here for less than $22.00, including tip.  The portions are probably smaller than other sit down restaurants but it is enough for each of us to leave feeling full and satisfied.  Hamburgers were juicy and fries were hot.  Very good service from out waitperson, too.

I wouldnt normally post a negative review about a place that I don't typically have high expectations of in the first place, but this location of Steak and Shake has been horrendous. My wife loves one specific item from Steak and Shake, so we occasionally head to the drive thru. The last 3 times through now have all been absolutely terrible. I keep going back because I'm hopeful each time they can turn it around (and, to be fair, the service and food we have received dining in at this location has always been good. For some reason, this location treats its drive thru as second rate customers)

This most recent experience involved placing my order, paying for it, being given only 1 of the 2 drinks I ordered and then asked to pull forward to wait for my food. 15 minutes later (with no other cars ever appearing in the drive thru line) my food finally came out as I was getting out of my car to go in and find out what was taking so long. 

And then I got the food home and found out it was not even what I had ordered. (The wife eats a Chili Mac, they gave us a Chili 3 Way. I'm not familiar with these and cant tell the difference, but apparently there is quite a significant difference between the two.) 

Suffice to say, we'll never eat here again.
Ya know, its Steak 'n Shake. Can't say I got any les than expected.

I rarely ever eat their food, but I always go for happy hour shakes. I have gone thru the drive thru a few times and ordered my chocolate shake. It never fails that I have to go in and complain. The shake doesn't taste like it's supposed too and their whipped cream is always runny like it has been sitting there a while. This last time was the final straw for me. I usually go to the location on Larkin and I'm satisfied. If you want a good shake, go to that one. They might be slow (as they all are), but it's worth it.

STEAK & SHAKE SHITTERS

Jan14, 2012 6:53 pm We order 3 Shooter sandwiches and other items.  We received the WORST looking and tasteless burned phlegm (spit up) soaked with the slimmest flavoring of sauce on an areola size biscuit.  Nothing but burned pieces of burger left in the grease bucket.  One piece the size of a piece of Jerkey, two the size of a wheat chex which NEVER covered the biscuit/bun.  I went so far as to look up a picture of the Shooter(Shitter) on their website....SHOCKED  to see a photo of a tasty looking treat.  I then looked at the charred remains of the real thing!!!  Life does Not imitate Art.  Steak and Sharks recycles their burned garbage into $$$$$

The place was cool, The frisco sandwich I got was fairly good. I wasn't expecting it to be that good, but it was. The smores shake was probably the best thing I have ever had. The shake was amazing good. I almost finished it before my sandwich. The thing that got me to knock a star off was the staff looked very tired and when you're sitting at the stools you can see the whole back room and see foot scattered on the ground and everywhere. Other than that the food was still good.
Best Steak and Shake in the area.  Usually very nice and friendly crew.  We have been visiting this restaurant regularly for about 15 years.  Love the shakes and steak burgers.

Wow! Excellent food and service. Super reasonable prices by comparison to many "more northern burb" standards. 

Had a fantastic Denver omelet. The pancakes are to-die-for. So fluffy and just the right sweetness. 

Menu is truly expansive. So many choices that looked soooo good. 

Will definitely be back.

Good service
Typical breakfast menu. 
Chef used to be at another local breakfast place, so the menu is nearly the same - but aren't all breakfast menus?
Quick service. 
Good good.

So now I went into the restaurant at 2:15 with my wife and daughter, the lady with the gap in her teeth was EXTREMELY rude and informed us that we had better be quick because the restaurant closed at 3 PM. Seriously? Why would you tell somebody something like that? 

The place reeks of marijuana and cigarettes. I will never come back here again.

I was also surprised to see that they ripped off Mattina caf√©'s menu. The food was OK but mediocre at best. my toast was stale. 

It is a very small town, I am surprised that this place is still in business after the rude treatment, and I'm sure I'm not the first.

2nd time here for breakfast, both meals were great . Very good coffee compared to a couple other breakfast restaurants in the area ....IMO . 

Our waitress was the best and there were at least 2 other servers that would check on our coffee and remove our empty plates . 
My Omelet was great and my rye toast must of been homemade ... Amazing ! 
Great experience !

Homemade soups are delicious! If you are lucky enough to get the split pea soup get it! Ham in every spoonful. Generous portions and really tasty. Service was great an has a good atmosphere. Highly recommended.
Had a great turkey and avocado panini. Thick turkey and lots of bacon. Husband had a rueben and enjoyed it. Each sandwich came with fries and soup, lots of food. Good lunch.

Ordered the breakfast special with biscuits and gravy, eggs, hash browns, and sausage. The biscuits and gravy were sadly nothing to write home about, but other diners in my party enjoyed the pancakes. Would like to come back and try the crunchy French toast, and the skillets sounded tasty. Service was a bit slow but friendly. Prices are on par for the area.

My dad and I went to lunch here. My soup was cream of mushroom and it was very tasty. I ordered a rueben sandwich, it came with what I thought was thousands island dressing on the side. I put the dressing on and ate a few bites and my mouth was on fire! I thought it was strange because a rueben is not spicy. When our waitress came by I asked her what was the dressing? She said oh no you got the Chipotle sauce instead. 
      Really not too funny. One would think the two different sauces both orange would be widely separated from each other when being stored. My lunch was ruined. She offered to get me another sandwich, but my appetite was gone.
     Service was fine other than the mix up.!

Son had a concert in New Lenox yesterday and stumbled upon this charming Breakfast place in the hours between his Orchestra's rehearsal and the show.  Had the awesome Meat Lover's Skillet based upon a previous review and it did not disappoint.  Eggs, potatoes, cheese, sausage, bacon; really delicious.  Coffee was more than adequate and our waitress was charming and attentive. My 80+ year old Mother even complimented her beautiful tattoo.  After seeing some of the negative reviews here, I had to double check that I was reviewing the same place.  My experience was great, it met and even exceeded my expectations.  Cheers!

Stopped there with my wife on a Sunday at noon. Ordered a buffalo chicken wrap and a taco salad
 After 20 minutes was told it would be right up. By now at least 3-4  families had sit down. 20 minutes later still nothing. By now our waitress was avoiding us. All the newer arrivals were eating. Got up and left. Won't be back.

How in God's name is this dump still open?! Shame on us for giving it 3 tries, shame on us!  Ordered a veggie omelette and it was literally 90 percent spinach and the rest was grease. It's like they forgot the eggs!  Turkey sausage tasted like funk and the toast wasn't toasted enough. They did manage to get the packaged jelly to taste good, miracle! And to top it all off Gina's attitude sucks just like it did at Mattina cafe. Your pay is based on customer service and tips, figure it out! Or don't! We wont be back in any case. ..EVER!

Horrible food! We went there a few times, and they cook in so much butter or oil that the after taste coats your mouth! The omelette had no eggs, just runny vegetables. The turkey sausage had a weird flavor, the only decent thing was the toast, that I had to slather in jelly. Not good

Breakfast with the parents and the in-laws for the holidays! And we picked the right place! 

I had the Country fried steak breakfast and I rate place on their sausage gravy! This place has some GOOD gravy! The steak was well seasoned and the gravy was tasty! The eggs were a perfect over easy and my hasbrowns were that nice in between crisp yet soft potatoy!

The boy ordered the Steak and eggs. He said that this was probably the best breakfast steak he's had in a while! (wow!) He devour the whole plate!

Mom had the Breakfast sammich on rye. They gave her over easy eggs instead of over hard, but no worries. The rest of the sammich was tasty.

The Dad-in-law had the Irish skillet. He had never had hollandaise sauce before and now he loves it!

The Mom-in-law had the Denver omlet and she enjoy every tasty, eggy bite of it!

The service was great. Our waitress was very attentive and I'll be sure we get back here soon!

A friend and I came here for a quick lunch but unfortunately it turned into an hour of waiting. I am not sure why as the place is relatively small and they were not busy. 

Service was awful. Our waitress took 15 minutes to return to our table to take our orders after initially greeting us. She brought soup...no crackers or bread and it took a total of 10 more minutes to receive those items after asking.

We saw several individuals who had come in after us receive their food, but our waitress never stopped by to say anything to us concerning how we were or where our meals were. 

After almost an hour we asked to receive our food in to-go containers (from the hostess, because our waitress was not around, again) as lunch was over for us. Upon actually tasting my meal, it was terrible (soggy chicken Caesar wrap and cold fries) my friend also stated his simple breakfast was poorly put together.

I will not be returning. Horrible service and lackluster food.

No this is not a 5 star restaurant but it is an eatery that delivers everything one would desire for a neighborhood cafe - excellent, friendly service, nice atmopsphere, huge portions of food at great prices, and a varied and interesting menu executed perfectly.

In the 10 days that I was visiting family, we ate there three times.  On our first visit, it was three egg vegetable omelet, bacon, fruit and a turkey reuben.  Second time, was a breakfast burrito with onions, sausage, cheese and peppers and eggs benedict.  Lastly we sampled the belgian waffle and roast turkey panini with avocado, bacon, pepper jack cheese, spinach and chipoltle mayo.

The sides like the hash browns and fries were excellent.  Hot, not greasy, and nicely crisped.  The russian dressing on the reuben and the spicy mayo on the panini, were especially good.  It was nice that both came in separate containers so that you could control how much of the spread went on.  It just makes such a difference when you use fresh ingredients, and have a chef that cares about what he/she is serving even if it is your more basic comfort food items.

We had Emily as our server on our first and third visits.  Even though the place was full she never rushed us as there was a lot of catching up to do with my dining companion.  She was patient, friendly, accommodating and helped seal the deal push my rating to a five star experience.  Thanks Emily!
Unfortunately won't be coming back here again. Each time we've gone, we've gotten shells in our eggs - scrambled and poached. My French fries were also undercooked. Not a good experience overall.
Homemade everything!!! Everything on the menu is incredible, I had no clue a restaurant like this existed. These ladies know exactly how food should taste, Bravo !!!!

I will give Teardrop 2 stars because our server was a very nice person and the service was quick. However, the food was not good. My omelet was literally tasteless, more oily tasting than food tasting. The hash browns were totally unseasoned. I tried my husband's biscuits and gravy...they actually had a sort of chemical flavor....:-(.  We used to like it here but it seems to have gone downhill.

I really wanted to like this place. I drove twenty minutes to 826 W Laraway, only to find myself in front of a large dirt hill. I drove home in disgust. Through later intensive research, I found out the true address, which is 826 E Laraway. Now I have egg on my face, and none in my stomach.

8/10/2016

Oy.  I'm so done with this place. Silverware had caked up food on it.  

I had a tuna melt which was drowning in mayo..I couldn't even taste the tuna.

Good service..

The soups are very good, but not enough to make me come back.
 


**************************
Sigh...
Cooks still don't know what MEDIUM  RARE means..
STAY AWAY FROM THE PORK CHOPS, unless you like them flat, tough and chewy.

I traded them in for a chicken on pita..
Good soups. I had the tomato Rosa marina, and my husband had the  cream of vegetable.

********************************
Ugh.
The noise level in here is ridiculous , & it can be fixed, by simply putting felt tips on the bottom of the chairs!
GEEEEEEEEEEEZ! !

Our server took 7 minutes to approach our table.  She brought the soup,  but no crackers..when we were completely done with our soup, we had to ask a hostess to find her, as she had disappeared.  Server claims they ran out of rolls, and they just got some in...she cocked an attitude as well.

Don't get the fried chicken,  either. Bland, dry & overcooked.

I often go to Teardrop cafe for lunch. This is a great "breakfast all day" type of restaurant. Amazing crepes, really. The soup is almost always excellent and you get a huge bowl of it. Omelets are excellent and the choice of pancakes instead of toast with egg dishes is welcome. 

There really is nothing much on that stretch of Laraway Road, so this was a welcome addition. Friendly staff and a really cute atmosphere.

Excellent food.  Tasteful ambiance. Family friendly and inexpensive. Owners have 20 years experience in the business and it is evident.  

Will definitely come back again and again.
Very disappointed. Slow serves, many mistakes with our  orders. Obnoxious greeter when we first walked in.  Just overall bad. Don't Go, your wasting your time.

We went here for lunch and couldn't believe how amazing the food was.  It's nice to see a restaurant with quality food and service open in my hometown.  My wife and I both started with the Chicken and Rice soup with was out of this world.  They post their fresh soup of the day on their facebook page and boy was it fresh.  Each sandwich comes with soup and fries so you never leave hungry.  

My wife ordered the Monte Cristo and I ordered the Greek Chicken Pita.  Both sandwiches and seasoned fries were out of this world.  I can't wait to go back and try the breakfast.  New Lenox needed a cafe of this caliber.
Love this place!!  Food is delicious and the staff is wonderful.   So nice having a small business close by that is a pleasure to do business with!!

4th visit here. I ordered a Denver omlett to go.  Greatest omlett ever.  They give you alot of food too. One more thing.  The map on YELP is incorrect.  Someone needs to fox the map so ornery people can find this place. Highly recommended for breakfast.
The wait is about 10 to 15 min on a Sunday and the food takes a while to come to the table but WE'LL WORTH THE WAIT! EXCELLENT food and staff!

We went here for our first time on Sunday morning.  I was very pleased to see they had pumpkin pancakes.  The pancakes were amazing.  Huge portion and delicious.  It was very busy, but someone came to our table almost immediately to let us know our waitress would be right with us. 

The service was great and the food was awesome.  I can't wait to go again on Sunday.  It seems very family-centric and I like that since I have two small children.
Love this place! Always great service great food! I have never had anything I didn't like like here. It has became our go to for breakfast now!

I have been going there since they opened. Really good at first but has been gradually slipping. This morning I reluctantly went back with my daughter to give it one more chance. Ordered a Denver omelet. It was very undercooked and I had raw eggs running out of the inside. I will not return
Absolutely my favorite place to go for breakfast in New Lenox. The soup is always fantastic and the staff is incredibly friendly. The cream of chicken soup is my favorite!

Recently stopped in for breakfast. Both the service and the food sucked. Place was half empty yet I had to wait 15 minutes to get a cup of coffee from a waitress with an attitude. Ordered the eggs and pork chops, eggs weren't cooked to order and the pork chops we so tough and fatty couldn't eat them. Just a horrible restaurant.
Very friendly, clean atmosphere, great soup and a very well done menu!  Highly recommend.

How in the world have I missed this place all this time??? Went last week... Bfast was outstanding!!!! Loved the coffee in nice big mugs, I had bfast tacos with choirizo which was outstanding! Hash browns were great! Service was very attentive and very friendly... We'll be back soon and often!!!!

Nice place for a well prepared, hearty, fairly priced breakfast.  The owners are really nice people.  They were very busy.  Only tip the bus staff seemed like they could use a bit more training which would have helped to take some of the load off the servers, I felt bad asking her for more coffee.

I can't say enough good about this place! I've been here three days in row because it's so good! The coffee is spot on delicious, the biscuits and gravy is perfect, and the cream of asparagus soup....OMG! All the workers are super friendly and make it feel like home. Keep up the good work! I'll be back tomorrow! ;)

So glad I discovered this place. You can tell the food is made with fresh ingredients. I'm not really a breakfast person but I consistently find myself ordering breakfast because it's so good. Haven't found the time to try the lunch or dinner menu but I'm going to get there. The staff was very attentive  and took care of everything we needed. The atmosphere is clean and cozy and unrushed. I think I found my new regular place in town, my only fear is the rest of New Lenox will find this place and I won't be able to get in anymore. To conclude I have zero complaints about teardrop caf√© nothing but compliments and praise for the place.

Went last Sunday for breakfast. Food was very good! The Waitress was Awful! She was wearing a Blackhawks jersey Duncan Kieth.She forgot my toast then she brought the bill and remember about my toast, she said sorry I will bring it right away. Well she never came back with the toast or to check on us to see how everything was! The rest of the staff seemed to be very good!

Excellent casual dining establishment with a great family atmosphere.  I have visited for breakfast and lunch with my family on many occasions and tried many menu items.  The food is always fresh and the prices and service outstanding.  Highly recommend!

We went here for lunch based on all the positive Yelp reviews and were glad we did.  Our waitress was very friendly and accommodating to my low carb dietary needs.  I ordered the "stuffed tomato" with tuna salad, but asked for a stuffed avocado instead with veges on the plate instead of fruit.  Ate everything. Delicious!  Mother ordered the turkey and avocado panini and loved it.  Prices are very reasonable and loved the charming atmosphere.  We'll be back for sure.

This restaurant is gaining in popularity in New Lenox and for good reason.  I made my first visit recently and was pretty impressed.  The food and service was very good.  For coffee drinkers, the coffee was decent, with a fairly bold flavor.  The restaurant also provides flavored cream.  The portion sizes were also very good with plenty left over for a second meal.  Price-wise, they were average for this type of restaurant.  Overall, I would say that Teardrop is currently the best breakfast place in New Lenox.

I think I just found myself a new place to have breakfast at on the weekends.  The service was good for the occasion (the place was packed) but the food came out quick and was very tasty.  Teardrop is the best value for the buck in the New Lenox area hands down.  I just hope the owners don't get greedy like a most places and start sacrificing quality for a few extra pennies because I really like this place and I hope it sticks around.
The people are nice. The service is good.  The food is good. The soup is always excellent. If you're a soup lover, this place is a must.

I don't know how they came up with the name for this restaurant; eating there will not make you cry-unless it's tears of happiness. My husband and I stopped in for lunch after church yesterday. I had the chicken artichoke pannini, which came with a bowl of delicious cream of chicken and rice soup and seasoned waffle fries. Everything tasted great! Combined with the very reasonable prices and the attentive, friendly wait staff, we'll definitely be back! I've already made plans to meet a friend there for breakfast Saturday.  :)

first time being here. i just got basics eggs, toast, bacon, & hash browns. all delicious. i also ordered hot black tea which they brought out a little plate with a mini kettle, a cup, honey, & a lemon wedge :) i like that this place is kind of a hideout hidden in the strip mall. the lighting is nice and soft. the ceiling and tables are cool but id prefer a place with a more eclectic-y vibe with some art instead of the 'live laugh love' decals on the walls; but i'm kind of a hipster so yeah. overall i like it & i will be back. i choose this place over country charm. simple & comfortable & good service.

What a nice surprise!   My hubby got the turkey avocado sandwich.  The meat was so fresh!!!  Not that deli meat either. REAL meat.  I got the stuffed tomato and they subbed out the fruit for the kinds I prefer.  Soup was okay but nothing fantastic.  One waitress seemed pretty bothered.  However, our waitress was nice and friendly.  Owner was outgoing guy who made it a point to welcome us.  Strongly recommend going here.  Great portions with great prices.

Food was good. Gluten free pancakes were delicious. The Service could be better. There seemed to be two waitresses but our waitress was running around everywhere. We had to wait a while for refills, napkins, the bill... Maybe they were short on waitresses. We'll give this place another try.

Great little place tucked away on the south side of New Lenox...actually glad to have something other than Mattina's (which is yucky) and Country Charm (same old, same old) and Double Yolk (loud, overpriced) where we can get a great meal.  Great service, great food, cute little venue!  Hope they keep up the great job with fresh ingredients and good service...just what we need in New Lenox!  Nice job!

I went here on Sunday after church. I start off by saying it's cute inside. Me and family were sitting at a table which was really close to another table. So it is very uncomfortable in there. It could just be me but I like room when I eat. Well because we were so close to the other table we over heard them saying how bad there service was. Not off to a good start. Waitress came over and greeted us. Very loud lady. Almost awkward how loud and fast she was talking. Well we placed our order and as she left she told us she was also the owner so don't me mad if some else serves your food!! WTF!! While waiting for our food we were just people watching and we saw go to another table and tell them the same thing. Again maybe just me but weird. We got our food about 25 minutes later. So not the quickest place in town. Omlete had the wrong ingredients. Ugh!! Here we go. Never got our side of bacon we ordered. Just a mess.. Not very professional at all. We I asked about our kids juice which is suppose to come with the pancake. I got an attitude and a older lady with short hair placed it on the table and left. WTH!!! Is going on at this place. Not one employee looked like they wanted to be there... Food horrible, service even worse!! Suggested...... Don't go here . Owner lady... Instead of telling people you are the owner. You should respect your customers and not offend them. Knowbody cares who owns what. Just came there eat and leave. I hope read this and learn from it cause you are not doing a good job!!

This place is great!  I have been numerous times, and each time it is wonderful.  The food is fresh and tasty.  The service is excellent.  These ladies have experience and it shows.  They definitely know what they are doing over there.

I recently moved to Lockport with my girlfriend and heard amazing things about Godfathers. Decided to give it a try and HOLY CRAP. This place blows all other sandwich places out of the water. Got the Lieutenant and was amazed at not only the quality of meat and bread that they used but also at how delicious it was. They don't use mayo and mustard like other sandwich places and honestly I don't think it needed any of that anyway. Just meat, cheese, lettuce, tomato and a little oil to top it all off. If you're looking for a great sub at a reasonable price you should go in and try them out. I promise you won't regret it. Customer for life.

We ordered pizza on special buy one get one half off and the beef and cheese.  The pizza was okay but i found the crust really tasteless.  The sauce and cheese were just average.  I would order again for the value but I would not go out of my way to get this pizza.  The beef was terrible it was small bland and hardly any cheese.  We tried it after reading a great review on it.  Maybe this was an off day but our beef was terrible.  The sub sandwiches and calzones looked really good here.  I may try that next time.

Just had the best beef sandwich ever! Juicy, overflowing with meat and perfectly melted cheese....definitely the best in town. Always forget about this place when picking up lunch but after that beef sandwich....I will not forget!

I really really like this place,  so this review is based off my experience today.  The service I had was completely bs.  I usually pick up my food, but today I needed it delivered (which won't happen again), I call and get "Godfathers, hold on," and she sets the phone on the counter for 5 minutes until I hang up.  I call back at least three times and get the voicemail.  Wait about 20 minutes and finally she answers with the same crappy attitude.  My one sandwich gets here and my total comes to 8$ and some change,  I give the guy a 20$ and ask for 8$ back which is extremely generous since the place is less than 5 blocks from my house.  And he responds with I only have 6$.  Who delivers and doesn't keep change?  I just paid 14$ for an 8 inch sandwich.  And the sandwich was good, just not 14$ good.
Love this place, but they took out the the fountain soda. I miss it. The service is fast and they are always nice. Give them a tip when they prepare your food. They deserve it.

An old gas station converted in a great little Godfather themed sandwich shop. I've been back many times. I definitely recommend trying the meatball, the American, and the underboss. All great sandwiches. I'm giving 4 stars because the pizza is bland, and while my wife digs their french fries, they are not my favorite.

Stopped in for the first time today after passing by many times. So happy we did! Don't let the facade fool you! Great meatball and lieutenant sandwiches! Love that it is a small family owned business we need more of these and less chain restaurants around here!

This place could be great, but there are some things that just aren't on point like it needs to be in the food industry.  My garlic bread I got with my dish was burnt one time.  Another time I asked for pizza by the slice and they went to warm it up and left it in too long and burnt the crust.  The pizza sauce and the subs are pretty solid, but the lack of a little TLC for your orders is enough to make me go to Mangia much more often.
Good Calzone. They need to open past 9pm on a Saturday night, come on guys 9pm on a Saturday. Really?

Fantastic.

I came here expecting 8 Heads in a Duffel Bag Joe Pesci and got Casino De Niro.  I mean wow, just blown away.  You wouldn't think that this unassuming place (which despite their good effort still looks like a gas station) would have one of the best Italian subs this Yelper has had in quite some time.

I had the underboss, and it did not disappoint.  The sandwich was as perfectly crafted as the Sistine Chapel with the perfect ratio of meat to cheese to toppings to oil to I'm salivating now just thinking about it.  There were a minimum of six other sandwiches that I NEED to try and a few others that caught my interest.  They have hot sandwiches too, not just the awesome deli ones.

There are also some good looking sides/salads.  I had a broccoli pasta salad that was simple yet tasty.  But there were a couple others that looked just as good.  

There were a couple cannolis there, but literally a couple.  Two wrapped together in plastic wrap.  I didn't get one, but if they have better packaging next time I'm there I won't be stopped.

The only thing to note of this place is that you have to pull into the right side of the building when you pull into the parking lot.  You can't park in from and they don't have it blocked off.  Depending on the time of day it can be a pain to pull around to the other , Proper, side of the building as you can't pull through.  But that is a minor complaint once you get this food in your face.
Great sandwiches. Pizza is decent. Staff isn't that friendly but worth dealing with for the sandwiches

The subs are great because the meat is fresh and bread is great. The staff is super friendly and I love the family owned atmosphere. Small little place but big sized sandwiches at awesome price!

You have me as long as I live in Lockport!

Had the Chicken Parmigian and my husband had a italian beef.  If you are looking for food that lacks flavor this is the place to be.  My plate was a fried piece of chicken drowned in tomatoe sauce from a can.  The beef was nothing to go back for either.
Everything I had has been good so far. Call ahead because most of the stuff is made from scratch

Pie is good. Calzone good. Service is sub par, call in order for delivery, say delivery guy not show. Ok I'll pick it up.get there one guy cookin two people doin nothin delivery van parked outside. Ur service is crap. Anytime I go in there people workin want to be somewhere else. Put on gameface its not that hard. Get off ur ass stop reading an facebooking an do ur job. I dont think the owner knos whats goin on. Spend some time in ur restaurant fix whats wrong kick ur workers in the ass. This place has been sliding downhill.

Sandwiches are much better than stefannelis up the road, but service is awful. They rarely answer the phone, are often handling Uhaul transactions while you wait, and aren't always there when their schedule says they are. Like right now. Sign says open but no one is home. Could be doing way better if they'd commit. Sauce is a sour marinara, tastes from a can but meatballs are good.

The pizza is great. Nice and thin and a robust flavor to the sauce. They do not skimp on the cheese. The pepperoni is super thin and sausage is extremely flavorful. Sausage sandwiches are the same, home made, just like the big meatballs. Most dissapointing garlic bread from an Italian joint. And the pasta is from a box or bag, but the pizza and meat products are where it's at. The salad is just with ice berg so its blah, but their house dressing is good. I have not tried the cold subs, but I definately will eventually.

Been here many times they have never disappointed me. My son loves the huge calzone's, I love the chicken parm and the breaded steak sandwiches. Favorite sub is the Godfather and the Pepper and Egg sandwich is pretty dang good too. I remember when this place was called Genco Deli or something like that, must be the same owners because the menu didn't change much after the name change. Also had the mostaccoli dinner which was very good and an amazing value for only $20, it was enough food for at least 6 people, came with meatballs and salad and bread. Give this place a try if you're ever in Lockport on Rt. 171, you won't be disappointed.

Went there for a quick bit and was surprised at the quality of the food and the sauce!  Had the pork tenderloin sandwich, chicken parmigiana sandwich and a slice of pizza.  I would say the prices for the sandwiches were great and the taste was beyond good for the lockport/lemont/new lenox area.  The pizza slice was large and good tasting too, but I thought that was a little over-priced.

We are all definitively going back.  There is an area to eat in there with a tv to watch, but we carried out.

I have been here half a dozen times and I get the same thing every time. A roast beef and giardiniera calzone with garlic. It is awesome, the best calzone I have ever had. The deli sandwiches look really good and I will try them some time. The restaurant is a little bit out of the way but it is worth the trip.
I had lunch brought to me from this place. I had The Underboss sub. All I have to say is Holy Shit was it amazing. I will be back. This is the shortest review I've ever made!!

Wow! I love this place ! Best combo ever! I eat this every time I come though town. I have been getting the same combo for years very consistent. The staff is always very friendly. I highly recommend this place.

Love this place. The sandwiches are amazing and Gina is super nice the whole crew in fact are awesome. Always delicious food. I have yet to try something I didn't like. They will make just about anything for u. Love the prosciutto and roast beef subs.
Great food.  I couldn't decide so I ordered a six inch Italian beef and a six inch under father.  Both excellent .  Gina was friendly too!
Food is awesome, price is right & the selection vast. Best food in Lockport.

Sorry, but I don't get it. This place is a joke, & the food is just horrible. What's with the name? Wasn't it called something else? Anyway my stomach still hurts, & that was 2 weeks ago. Give it up, capiche!
I still keep coming here and I am still addicted!  I also tried the Italian grilled cheese and loved it!  Still need to try the pizza!

This place seems to be kinda off the beaten path for me so I tend to forget that they are in town. The pizza itself is good, but just doesn't stand out enough to visit just for that. The menu, and website both say that they deliver, however since they've been open I've called for delivery at least 4 different times months apart and have been told every time that they are not delivering. If they did deliver we'd probably order the pizza more often. I have to say I'm not sure if that is still the case since I no longer even attempt to place a delivery order. The subs are the real winner here. They are always fresh, amazing, and authentic. Definitely the best I've had. The subs themselves are worth the visit. The prices are very decent especially considering the portions are huge.

Their website needs to be a little bit more up to date but this is hands down the best place to get a bite to eat in Lockport. Servings are generous, the food quality is very high, and the owners are just down to earth nice people.
The food is alright - just make sure you call before you stop by. I've driven there more than once to discover it's closed on the middle of a Sunday or something.
The dishes I have had are great. It's convince and perfect when you don't want to cook!

Madeleine's is located in the same place as a previous "cook-and-carry" dinner, but in my opinion, much better! Madeleine ("Mad") is an enthusiastic experienced chef and focuses on fresh ingredients. While she has a featured menu (www.Madwhatsfordinner.com) she also has daily specials. We tried the Turkey Cutlets and the Cabernet Beef. The Turkey Cutlets were generous portions of turkey, sweet potatoes, thin stalks of asparagus and a sauce for the cutlets ($11) The Cabernet Beef, marinated chunks of beef (tasting like sauerbraten almost!) came with barley/mushrooms and asparagus ($11). I loved this dish and my hubby loved his turkey cutlets. The dishes quickly reheat in a microwave and are packaged in compostable containers. Some may get two meals out of one dish--but I ate every bit of the Beef! Each dish comes with a dessert of three French madeleines (cookies). 
I would definitely recommend Madeleine's. Call ahead and order or stop in. Mad is open to suggestions and also does catering. She is definitely an asset to Lisle's food scene!
Very good food. Recipes I would never take time make for myself. And convenient!!!

The beer selection is always awesome, but you need to come here for the food!

   I always look to the off menu items...the specials.  Sometimes they'll last a week, a month...or a few days.  I recommend getting the special soup and the special entree/sandwich.  What you'll find is properly made, well balanced meals by a respected chef.  My recommendation is to come for a number of soups, and a number of specials in order to get a feel for his cooking, his execution of proper technique and his interpretations of flavors on food (ie: choice of homemade buns, flavor in homemade sausage/protein).  Really, where else in the area are you going to find a properly made demi-glace!  I mean, really!  Come in...and give it a good chance

Never again

They're deceitful liars.


There was a special on a table tent for bourbon. $5-$10 on higher end bourbons. 

We ordered four $5 bourbon on the rocks, one draft beer and a N/A beer. The bill was $50. 

When questioned, the manager explains there's an extra charge for ice. And a significant one at that. 

I was mad, but embarrassed in front of my guests and just signed the bill. 

Don't go. They'll find a way to rip you off

Been wanting to stop here for awhile. They open at 4 which is fine but Im often seeking a beer and a bite at lunch and wished they opened for lunch. Loved the place. Great beer selection! Uncommon choices! Food was good , service was better. I even managed to strike up a conversation w/ two total strangers while watching the Cubs WS game. That is not easy to do these days. 
Karen was the bartender, very friendly and helpful. Smiling often. Good lady! Place had a good vibe. It was clean, tables spread out giving a feeling of roominess and it did get crowded when the game started. Washrooms were clean. I only had time for an appetizer. Had the 3 sliders. Tasty, well prepared and left me wanting more. I will return another day & you should too!

They had a decent amount of beers to choose from, I'd say above average selection. There were both drafts and bottles available and well organized on their respective menus. 

Not being packed on a Friday night, I was glad to easily get a seat. The bar had a really great seat to table height ratio; short women rejoice. I asked the barmaid for her favorite food choices, as I usually do for new places. Some just give me what everyone else likes, some actually tell me their personal favorites. She listed too many and I just settled on pizza. They have a huge window for half priced pizzas on Fridays; 4-10 PM. Which I also found out its for dining in only, unless you order a beer. 

I got my 14" pizza with mushrooms and bacon, as you have a choice from 12 or so toppings. Pay per topping. It was thin crust and pretty tasty. The only weird thing (to me) was they cut it in squares, which I'm not exactly a huge fan of doing. 

I would definitely return to this joint.
This place is awesome!!! Their cook in the back is awesome. The food is great. There are always 12 beers on tap.  They have an awesome variety of beer and food.  Come check it out!!!!

I usually love it here, great food and great spot for games, but my last experience here wasn't as great. We waited a while for a table, which was fine since this was a Cubs game night. We sat down, ordered our drinks. Drinks came before we ordered, waited 25 mins before getting our waiter to take our order, waited another 25 for our food , ok, but on top Of that from waiting in the first place. We were a table of 8 and one of us went to ask about our food, the owner told us about what time we ordered and what time we waited... like we didn't know? He came off and rude and made it sound like the waiting was out fault. I Love this place and wish the owner had a more understanding and compassion about customer service on a busy night.

This is a pub thats more about the food than the beer. Dont take that wrong ,they have a very nice beer and spirits menu but the food, Its a big notch above bar food. Chef has good vision. We shared dishes so we could try more. It just made us sure we'd come back to try what we hadnt tried on this visit. Price very reasonable. Portions generous. Pot roast sandwich....outstanding. Nacho's ....crazy good. Onion rings....very much worth up charge. Bar cost average for serving. We''ll be back. Menu changes and we want to check out what new chef has to offer.

I cant wait to try the food here! Everything looked and smelled so good. I pulled this place up on yelp and directed everyone here before the haunted house. I started to get really nervous when I could not find it. Its located at the end of strip mall. 

The service was amazing!!! Everyone was so friendly! I would love to come back here and hang out. Its not that far from my house. The prices are pretty good and they seem to always have at least 1 thing on special.

The beer list is not exactly the biggest I have ever seen, but its decent. They have a decent bottle selection too. For the area, I think its one of the better bars for sure!

I've been disappointed in all of the previous restaurants that formerly took up residence here so I was in no hurry to try this place. Finally my neighbors who have always raved about the place talked us into going. We were there early evening on a Sunday. 4 families with kids ranging in ages from 4-10. Thank goodness for most of the night it was mostly just us because we are a loud bunch. Our server never batted an eye. She may have very well hated out guts (I've served before and I probably would've been annoyed with us!) but she was nothing but awesome. The food was pretty awesome too. I tried one of my neighbors jalape√±o poppers and will definitely be ordering those next trip. We ordered the combo platter and everything on it was good! The mozzarella sticks were some of the best I ever had and the potato skins were a meal in them self! For dinner I had the pot roast sandwich with mashed potatoes and my husband had one of the spicy burgers. We both loved our choices. The kids all shared some pizza which was also great. 
All and all I'm sorry it took me so long to get to this place and I will definitely be back to try some more things I was eyeing on the menu!

Very good food and beer, priced affordable.
Clean and friendly.
We 1st tried this place with a Groupon and have been back a few more times. 
Great burgers and half priced pizza on Friday night.
Good place to go for all ages.

12 Handles? More like 8 and 4 broken mugs. How is this place still standing. I understand the drink specials and everything that surrounds the bar food. But honestly it smells in here. Bad. Like a grandma with too many cats. How do people return for business? I mean I see the manager or whoever it is doing shots with regulars. But is that the only way people will come back?

Went there tonight, on a Saturday, perfect atmosphere, place is under new management and ownership, and they are definitely paying attention to detail, super clean, huge selection of craft and regular beers. 
   I had the chicken wings and mozzarella sticks and chef Dean did not disappoint, Wonderful job on everything we had. 
The manager Casey, came by just enough to make sure we were happy, but not enough to be a pain in the ass. Matt the bartender was right on top of things even though it was a good crowd, kudos to him. 
I'd recommend everyone to give it a try and see the new awesomeness 12 Handles is passing out for yourselves, 
WILL definitely be back, keep up the good work guys.
Best lunch around!! Cannot wait to come back for dinner and drinks!! The wait staff and Casey are amazing!! Food is to die for! Chef Dean keep it coming :-)

We hit this place up after going to Statesville Haunted House. Holy crap, it was super loud. I'm all for bang-bang party mode, but for a sports bar you couldn't hear your neighbor. I talked to the waitress about it, but it's possible she couldn't hear me either. The beer selection was good, the food was not bad. I liked the fact that a lot of it seemed homemade (hand breaded stuffed mushrooms, real mashed potatoes.) But overall, the flavor wasn't there. If I were to come back, it would probably be to enjoy the beer selection enough where I would be shouting with glee over the loud music.

Love this place. Very cool open space inside. Service is very friendly. Have never felt pressured or out of place.  Very mellow crowd who attends. 

Great for a few craft beers and an appetizer.

12 Handles is definitely one of my favorite bars to visit when I am in town. The atmosphere is solid but it can be a little noisy at times. There are plenty of TV's to watch if you come during a sports event. Plenty of beers to choose from including both bottled and on draft. The only reason I'm knocking a star off is because the quality of the pizza changed in the last few months. I used to be a regular when they would have their pizza specials because they were so delicious, but more recently they have become somewhat tasteless. Besides that, the staff are very friendly and attentive and the restaurant itself is very clean and inviting.

Great new place we tried a few weeks ago. Very clean and tons of TV's. Can't believe this place has been open a year and we just found it. Come fall we will be regulars watching college football on Saturdays for sure. We did try the pizza and outstanding.

This is a really good tap house. They had a wide variety of interesting beers, and the burger I got was fantastic (Revolution). It's a simple place with sports on TV, but it has a pleasant feel and the service was great. It reminds me of Embers in Lockport, but with better food and more variety in the beer choices. Their house amber ale is really good.

Great selection of beers!!! The wings are worth trying with a variety of sauces that are awesome! The pot roast sandwich is what I will return for next week! The Bartender Matt and Jessica are very nice and knowledgable too

Since new management took over the menu is outstanding.  I have been through most of the food selections and have yet to find anything that has not been carefully prepared with quality ingredients. Their beer menu is extensive and changes frequently which keeps things interesting. The staff is very friendly and does a great job. This is a well above average gastro-pub that is quickly making a name for itself.
Worst wait staff ever! Good food, good beer selection, bad wait staff.  My recommendation, sit at the bar.

Excellent Bourbon and Craft Beer Bar. I went there in Feb. 15 and I tried a couple of beer flights and craft bourbon. I did not had a full meal, only an appetizer, but it was very good. I'll be back for sure.
We were here on Christmas Eve and had a great experience.  Service was excellent with knowledgeable, friendly server, good food (big portions), and great, clean restaurant.  We plan to go back soon.

The family and I have been here several times (before the new owners and now after), and what a treat.  The food is always a hit - good and flavorful.  My husband and kids usually have a burger of some sort, and I always get the Greek salad.  One of the best I've had, and no complaints at all with the burgers.  We've also had the pizza - awesome.  I've always encountered awesome, friendly waitstaff, and the new owner even came to our table to check on us and chat with us for a bit.  We've been on 'big game nights' (as they have several tv's on the walls around the place), and we've always found the service and food is still top notch!!  They have a great beer selection, and my husband and I have tried several different local beers that we might not have tried otherwise and we're always happy!!  Great place, keep up the good work!!!
When the there on a Monday, beer selection was ok, food was straight up tasteless. We order a ruben & fish sandwich with fries two simple sandwiches that had no flavor.

Well folks we gave it a try, beer was great, great ambiance, our server was super nice, our food came out in a decent time frame... the 20 piece wings me and my husband shared were so so.. however today we are paying for it. Me & my husband both are sick and burping up chicken.  Ewwwwwww!  I think this is a great concept with a bad location as well.

The burgers are fantastic. Great size and cooked well. Fries are nothing spectacular and neither is the pizza. It's nice that they have so many handles but honestly didn't have a great selection. I'm noticing the trend that places are installing many handles for impression sake, but true craft beer lovers know the difference between many handles of average beer and that of quality. They had Californian Laguanitas, and 3 Sheep from Wisconsin. They also had beer from a nearby brewery in Lemont. Other than these, nothing else very interesting. They did have a nice Whiskey selection. We went on a Tuesday night and it was semi-noisy. I would go back for a quick lunch for the burger but unless I see advertisements for some more stately brews, the ambiance is not enough for me to go back.

We stumbled on this place last May so were probably some of the first people to visit. We've been back maybe a dozen more times as we live about 5 minutes from here. The hours are a little odd because they don't open until 4PM. The same people own the Southern Belle breakfast place right next to it.

The food has always been consistent. The service has always been great with the exception of one server who gets confused pretty easily. The bartenders know what they're doing and are usually willing to give samples if there are any questions about certain taps. The beer selection started off really varied and interesting but has since devolved into a hop lovers paradise with not much in the way of lighter brews (pilsners, lagers, etc.). That's fine for me but my wife isn't a fan of bitter beer (her words) so she's hoping they come around.

There are about 15 seats at the bar, maybe 6 hi-tops that seat 4 each and 8 or 9 low tables that can be pushed together for groups. 22 large screen TVs mean everybody gets a view if they want to see whatever sports game is showing. Restrooms are clean and large. Like every other place in Joliet and Crest Hill there are 4 or 5 gaming machines along one wall.

The pizza here was a nice surprise as are the wings, stuffed jalepenos and mushrooms, and grinder sandwiches. all excellent. The burgers, wraps, salads,etc are all good. We haven't tried the pasta dishes.

We'll probably be somewhat regulars as long as they can make it with those limited hours...

Oh wow , this place did not honor the trader magazine coupon, 15 for 30 on food and beverages , this manager was rude and obnoxious and even threatened to call the cops, my issue beverages did not exclude alcohol , this coupon on trade magazine did not exclude alcohol. On another note the bartender was treated like crap, the manager/owner demanded her to update the menu NOW with aggressive authority I felt bad for her, maybe get it together before you open your doors, if you treat your servers like that I knew customer service was going to be an issue, I should've left then. Beware of the trader magazine coupon it's false advertisement
This place is awesome.   A huge selection of good craft beers.   Good burgers.  We'll be hitting this up more often.

Love this place! Good beer menu, full bar, well trained friendly staff and bar none THE BEST burgers anywhere. Lots of good stuff on the menu but I go back for the burgers. So good it's almost a crime to add condiments.
My wife and I have decided to make 12 Handles our "neighborhood bar". Great food and great service!  Our favorite bartender Matt makes it easy to keep coming back.
Great food!  Loved the grilled cheese with avocado, bacon & tomato. The clam chowder was the best ever!  Great place for pub food!!

YeahDefinitely one of my favorite spots in the Joliet area.  Good beer, food, and people... what more can you ask for? 

Drinks: come for the great beer and whiskey selection.  24 rotating mostly American microbrews and 100+ in bottles. Extensive collection of whiskey: at least 80 bottles of bourbon, rye, Scotch, Irish and the like. Tasty cocktails too if that's your thing. 

Food: the food is probably my favorite pub food in the area, but can lack consistency. The burgers are a generous 10oz with tons of choices for toppings. My favorites: Ring of Fire (spicy and delicious), Like a Rolling Stone (can't go wrong with bacon and a fried egg) and Revolution (cherry peppers, avocado and onion straws). Wings, apps and pizza are great too. 

People: staff is (mostly) great. Seen a few good and not so good ones come and go since the beginning, but overall I love these people. Especially the bartenders and manager/owner Nick. 

Overall: sit at the bar, ask for a sample or two and try a new craft brew, order some wings and a burger, and enjoy. 90% of the time, it works every time.
Under new management...and you can tell! Food was great, staff were great. Will definitely be back!
Great food and awesome atmosphere! Nice and friendly service.

The beer selection was very good. The service was very slow. I ordered a hamburger and it was terrible. It left a bad taste in my mouth until the next day. It had a burnt bitter taste. The fries were ok. For me the place is too open and it is loud inside even with very few people there on a Sunday night. Not going back. The beer selection didn't outweigh the service, atmosphere and food.
Awesome experience! Great burgers with quality meat ; fries most excellent.  Brad, our server, offered beer samples and made the dining experience a delight. We will be back.

Great place went for the first time as moved closer to the area. Disappointed  they did not have pizza. Went with my hubby and 2 girls and that is what the girls wanted but their oven was broken. No biggie ordered spinach artichoke  dip instead and they loved it. Our waiter was awesome he was very apologetic and even offered  us a free round of beers but we did not have room left. Loved the maple siracha wings. We will definitely visit this place again.

First time at 12 Handles this past Wednesday, and wondering why I haven't been here sooner!!!!  Only 10 minutes away from home and great beer selection great food and most of all great service!!!! Already planning another visit!!  Keep up the great work!!!
Burgers were awesome and Maritza our server was great. She wasn't overwhelming but she came to check on us the right amount of times. We will be back!

5 stars for BEER SELECTION ONLY!! Food was mediocre at best. I ordered the spicy garlic wings which were way too spicy and no garlic at all and the horseradish peppercorn wings. Good sauce but just doesn't pair well with chicken. My boyfriend ordered the pot roast sandwich and it was very dry.

Really enjoyed this place! Love the location & ambiance. Highly recommend the wings (all the flavors are great) and the pretzel log was awesome. Going back soon to try a burger. The flight was great to try sample different beer.

The food here is okay. Got a groupon for $10 for $20 worth of food. Now, when I went here in December of 2014 I was able to use the groupon on specials, then a couple weeks later into the new year, rules changed and I couldn't use the groupon on the friday special for half- priced pizza, which was very disappointing. If I don't have a groupon for this place I wouldn't go.

Went here after buying a Groupon for 2 burgers and 2 beer flights. First off, it's located right next to Southern Belles in Crest Hill. Wish we would have known that as our GPS took a backwards way of getting there. Their beer selection was great. They could probably use a not more description for those of us that are not beer officiandos. The sample sizes were decent. The burgers were awesome. Good size, yummy bun and lots of options to deal with. The environment was straight up sports bar. There were probably 10 large screen tvs. Definitely would be an awesome place to watch Sunday afternoon football. To top it all off the service was great from start to finish.

Great beer selection, actually the best in all of Joliet / Shorewood / Crest Hill area.  Food OK,  but this is a beer drinkers paradise. Over 120 different bottles and 24 rotating,  harder to find drafts.  Decent prices too, they always have a Groupon too.
Awesome  wings. The best fresh  jalape√±o poppers around.  Good service.  We will be back especially  for the $.50 wings on Sunday

We saw a Groupon and decided to check the place out. What a great find! Many beers to choose from (the flight of beer was great) and the burgers were good. We didn't have the wings but they looked like a good size and we will be ordering those the next time we go. The pricing of their menu and craft brews was very reasonable and not over priced. They have alot of TV 's and when we asked for a game on one of them they were quick to put it on for us. The owner was wonderful and took time to talk to us even though he was very busy helping out his staff due to a person calling off. We liked the fact he was right in there helping out, not afraid to work to try to make things easier for his staff. Can't wait to go back and bring some friends with us!

Actually have great food and brews, the first time I came, one of the waitresses was mediocre, but when I came to the bar itself the bartenders had good personality and made it fun. Overall a great experience overall, and not too crowded but not too empty. I'd definitely recommend trying them out as they are new and have very fair prices. Sam the bartender is awesome if you get her.

Loved this place. Went after getting the groupon for 2 burgers and 2 flights and love this place. All the menu items are great and the service is great also. We like going to try the different beers that they have for the season. Have gotten many different menu items and just cant pick a favorite they are all so yummy. You wont leave there hungry. We live a couple minutes away so its great to go watch a game or hang out. A must go to in my opinion!

Not bad a little pretenscious.  Bartenders ugly .but more importantly not impressed with service. Its cool to be hip. But dont forget the customers.  I am not gonna slander service.but cmon guys.not cool

Let me start off by saying awesome beer selection very friendly staff and overall good environment now for the bad I went there for the wings I like mine very spicy :^) I ordered 10 sweet habenero wings they were all sweet no spice so I told my waiter, she said she would make it right so she went to get a dipping cup of spicy sauce for my wings they really were not good and were still very sweet and I hated them but like I said awesome selection of beer and she was nice. I got over it and ended up having a good time  The hawks were playing and they had it cranked up so loud you couldn't hear your friends sitting next to you but not a big deal for me cause I was watching the game but everybody else I was with hated it. I had a good time but it was a bit pricey I spent $50 on 4 craft drafts, 10 wings and a salad for my gf I will probably be back maybe alone at the bar for the beer but if your trying to save money and eat and drink I would go somewhere else, but I could see coming here alone after work to unwind, next time I will sit at the bar and see what's good hope this helps you make a decision I would say try it out if you're Into good craft draft.

It was just ok. It was my first time here and probably my last as it definitely is not worth the drive from Aurora. Cool interior but the food was just average. Thought the meals were overpriced for what you get. The grilled cheese for $10 was a total joke and maybe worth half that. Very small and something out of a cafeteria. The steak sandwich was tasty and better. The half price pizza is a good deal but they screwed up our order. The fries are mediocre. Drinks are fine. This place definitely needs some help in the kitchen as the meals are very inconsistent. Service was good at times but also not good at others. It too was inconsistent.

Went into Flip's this past Monday (we had a gift card but also spent some extra money) and we must say, the service was A+.  Food was great (much of it is also reasonably priced compared to some of their competitors) and the employees were just extra friendly.

5 stars and thank you.

I really enjoyed this place. I got the gyro combo which comes with freshly cut onions, tomatoes, and tzatiki sauce. The gyros are typical Kronos but are cooked crispy. The fries were so so but could have been cooked longer. We also tried the saganaki bites which are fried. These are worth checking out as are the Greek fries which are fries drizzled with olive oil, oregano, and feta cheese. 

This place recently got a drive through which makes it convenient. They also have a large assortment of shakes to choose from, but I have not tried any of them.

Date of my visit: 21-August-2016
Time of my visit: Afternoon

I have been coming to this place for awhile.  I finally got around to review this place.

Today, I ordered Gyro Burger and a Hot Dog.  Let me start by saying, the Gyro Burger was to die for!!!  It was unbelievingly delicious!!!  It was just perfect!!!  The combo of gyro meat and beef was amazing!!!  A must try!!!

A+!

Two stars for the hot dog and fries.  I've had it four or five times now and not sure why I keep ordering it.  It's consistently mediocre.  A limp, skinless Vienna wiener nestled in a plain, tasteless bun.  "Everything" includes mustard, relish, onions, two tomato slices and a couple of sport peppers.  Of all of the mentioned accoutrements, the sport peppers have the most flavor.  This is just an average hot dog on its best day.
The fries are starch tablets with no flavor.
Other menu items at Flip's are actually pretty good like the gyros.  Steer clear of the hot dogs.

This a really good lunch option for the Glen Ellyn/ Wheaton area. My work buddies and I go there on lunch break, and we all order the gyro. Man, the meat is phenomenal. They keep thing simple by not overdoing the sauce or veggies, just a giant pile of meat!

Food tasted decent and the woman at the cash register was super friendly. I spent $15 on a gyro, fries, and a Greek salad. After I sat down I went back up to the middle aged guy that was preparing the food and asked for hot sauce. He told me it was 50 cents...really??? For some sauce??? After I spent $15 on lunch? I pulled out a $20 bill and had no change. The guy looked at me like I had a third eye and wanted me to break a 20 for some hot sauce. No thanx! The also charge for drink refills. No need to nickel and dime your customers!

The older man grabbed mail from the mailman and handled food right after without washing his hands.

Get rid of the silly charges for sauce and wash your hands!

I came here for the Gyros and was very pleased with what I got! I ordered the #6 meal, which comes with a large plate of gyros on a pita, along with a generous helping of fries and a drink.

The gyros were good and the fries were just how I like them (hot and fresh)! Very friendly staff as well. Will definitely have no problem coming back for the gyros here! 

Did try the saganaki squares, but was not overly impressed...I'm just used to flaming saganaki so I have overly high standards. Some people may love these, I'm just spoiled. They do taste good, but I like my cheese more melted, that's all. 

I found this place by typing in "best gyros" in Yelp as my boyfriend and I were driving around....this is the top place that came up! Definitely happy with the find :)

Read JPP review below and I will second that, he was just to generous.  Only difference is I got the combo and the Italian sausage was the only thing that saved the homemade beef to add any flavor.  I hadn't eaten here since the 70's.  I think going away from Scala's beef was a way to control food cost but it just doesn't taste how I remember it.

Food both fries and combo came out SUPER hot so little chance of any foodborne illness here.  I wanted to try the saganaki squares but wasn't that hungry.  Plus an abundance of salt on fries kept me from eating many as my sodium levels probably went through the roof.  The air conditioning is clearly failing as it was over 80 degrees inside on a 89 degree day.

Very nice people here and I want to like them more.  At least they are getting an award from Vienna next week.  Maybe I should have just gotten a dog.

So my area rankings still have Portillo's #1 and Little Joe's in Countryside a close second.

I was looking for a reasonably priced restaurant that wasn't going to cost me an arm and leg. I was tired of the nearby KFC and McDonalds. Of course I read the reviews online before I came. I was concerned because the restaurant was crowded and I only had 30 minutes to get my food. The line moved pretty fast, and the workers has their stuff together and in order. I ordered the gyros meal. I was pleasantly surprised when I checked in on Yelp with the 10% off order coupon. It's not much, but it helps. I was in and out in 10 minutes which is also good. I was anxious to see what the good reviews were about. The gyros was very good! Seasoned just right and not a lot of salt. It's rare that you find a gyros that's not salty. They used more seasonings and less salt. Very good and very smart move! The fries on the other hand was overcooked. I could barely eat them and had to pick off the overcooked pieces. They would've got 5 stars, but the overcooked fries ruined the potentially perfect rating.

This place really didn't impress me all that much. I was on my way home from visiting a friend and decided to stop here for lunch. It looked like a cool, divey burger joint and I thought there was no way the food could be bad. I was actually pretty excited. Perhaps my excitement is why this place is only getting three stars. It just didn't live up to my expectations. I got the burger and looked furiously for the burger. It wasn't easily seen and there was supposed to be 2 patties. When I bit in I was relieved to find they in fact did NOT forget my patty, but honestly it wasn't all that impressive. It was mostly just a big hunk of lettuce with mustard and ketchup and I've had a million better burgers at little burger joints like this. While I don't expect them to be Portillos, I do expect to be satisfied after ingesting those calories and I was not. The fries were tasty, but the burger is supposed to be the main attraction. 
The ambiance was pretty nice. The counter area was a little chaotic but the dining area was spacious and had tvs on the wall you could watch. Outside was very pretty with umbrellas and well kept trees. The staff was also pleasant, although I didn't have much interaction with them so I don't know how they would act given a problem, but still, I like a smile when I walk up to the counter and they delivered. Overall, it was just way below my expectations, but not so terrible that I wouldn't give them a second chance.

I knew this place when it used to Rock & Roll...a small beef shack with a focus on food and less emphasis on tables with sun umbrellas on a patio. The footprint has been enlarged with a new face lift. It actually has that "remodeled" look and less authentic.

I ordered a Beef "dipped" to test the waters. Upon delivery, the weight of the Beef was heavy as hell. The sandwich was jam-packed with beef and gravy to the point that the bread literally was screaming for help!

I needed a "Bib" for this one. A lot of gravy ended up on my sweatshirt.

The sandwich itself was a hefty representation by volume, however the gravy was the epitome of mediocrity. 

In my opinion, the gravy has no flavor. A 3 star rating is generous.

Reminds of the hole in the wall places that I used to go to in Chicago.. except that they have a patio and are clean. In Chicago (back in the black and white days) I would get my food and sit on the curb in between two parked cars. This is a pretty big upgrade.

Good beefs. I ordered mine with hot and Lisa's with hot and sweet.. also a couple of orders of fries. When I say good, I mean they taste good, but unlike Portillos.. they actually fill the bun with meat.  This is not my first rodeo at Flips so I've got some familiarity with the food. They forgot to put the hot peppers on Lisa's beef, she was a little disappointed, but I was already home. They have OK fries.. kind of your standard frozen fries, cooked crispy.

I've never tried their Gyros and thought their burgers were good, but not special.

I don't know what it is about that sign that flippin bugs the crap out of me. They've selectively covered over a part of the sign on Roosevelt... I dont know if used to say "Scala's" Beef.. or what. And if they used to use Scala... now what?**

Also.. it's tight when you get in the door.. the order window is right there and there is little space for a line.

Pretty good menu selection and I really need to go back and try other things.

They currently have a Yelp check in offer.. and I also get coupons from various locations.

I would really give a solid 3.5 stars, but I'm going to try some other things and see if that won't edge up a bit.

** The owner/Manager messaged me.. they used to use Scala beef, but went to making their own.. Having had it it I can say "Good Job" and please keep filling those sandwiches full like you do.

The outside could use a bit of a makeover because it looks rundown and cheap...but don't let that fool you. The inside is clean and friendly-warm. Value and service met the pricing. Greek salad was a good portion with a gre-ood vinaigrette dressing and an above average beef sandwich. I wish the plastic-wear and napkins were a grade or two above the cheapest thing they could find at restaurant depot but the big picture is painted with this being an above average beef stand that is on the front nine of the Dupage county beef stands.

The restaurant is a small place tucked to the side on Roosevelt Rd. In glen Ellyn. I had consulted yelp to go to a sandwich place instead of dreaded panera bread lol

The sandwiches were home made with similarly sliced cold cuts. The cold cut was a bit messy which to me indicates a well made sandwich haha imagine the meat and sauce and things exploding under the bread. Not too much but definelty a bit messy. It was plentiful and good.

I ordered the Ruben which came on not rye bread but that was ok. There was a ton of meat on the sandwich and the thousand island was nice n sweet but not over the top. The kraut was perfect. A great sandwich. The saganaki squares are also great! The owner said they're homemade. It looks like 'regulars' frequent this place but I'll have to cone back for the yelp off follow up. Busy lunch kind of left the restaurant a little dirty... But there were about 25 people eating... Hmmmm maybe cuz the food is so good!
So delicious. come here for a legit gyro, not to far from COD campus. Level of service isn't amazing but it's adequate. Unique place that I'm happy to support.
This place is great. Excellent food. Nice outdoor seating area. Pretty cheap. If you're considering anywhere else for fast food in the area, stop yourself now and give this place your business. Now.

Love this place! Food is delicious and stuff is very professional and friendly!
