Ordered a poor boy and cheese fries.  Nacho cheese was flavorless and bland.  Wouldn't order it again.  Quite possibly the worst, WORST poor boy I've ever had.  Tasted really chewy and grisly to me.  Was not offered onions or mushrooms (again, I should have asked, but it didn't cross my mind until afterwards)  

My entire order was about $16.  SIXTEEN DOLLARS for a poor boy, cheese fries, and a small pepsi.  What a joke.  I am very supportive of family-owned businesses so I decided to come here instead of going across the street to Potbelly.  What a huge mistake.  I won't be returning.  (The lady at the drive-up window was extremely friendly and nice though.  Shout out to you!  Good customer service)

GO DOWN THE STREET TO MR. SUBMARINE

I don't know why the bad reviews. This place is awesome. The homemade chili was delicious the half price jumbo hot dogs on Tuesday were so reasonable. 
I had a Italian beef that was really good. Can't tell you gave great this place is and I'm a regular at Jim's. 
Great prices and customer service. Huge menu. Everyone will find something. $1 pabst on Friday.

Wow. Babes has let me down again. I have tried 5 different things here and have been disappointed 5 different times. DO NOT order the poor boy. Supposed to be one of their top items. It was a joke. Looked like something off the $1 menu at burger king. Chicken tenders are gross. Fries are.......fries. The onion rings were breaded and out of a freezer. The chicken wrap i got was pretty good i will say and their double cheeseburger was tasty. But for the prices theyre charging here, id rather go down the street to Mooyas for a better burger/fries. 
I have no problem paying $15 for a meal for myself, but if it doesnt taste good and doesnt fill me up---no thanks!

I've been disappointed numerous times here, but hadn't gone in few years so tried again. Bad as always. 

It is almost humorous that a restaurant with the words "hot dogs" in their name has countless 1-star reviews about their 'hot dogs'....

Only reason I gave 2 stars instead of 1 is because service was very friendly.

Lured in for the first time by the half off jumbo hot dogs sign and how busy the parking lot was.

I wasn't at all impressed overall. The hotdog was ok at best, but the only thing jumbo was the diameter. When I think of a jumbo dog, I think longer. The fries had no seasoning, very little if any salt, thus barely any taste. There were a lot of older people, so maybe the taste catered to them. I also think they get a lot of residual business because some have been coming here for a while.

The only reason I have two stars and not one was the service. The cashier was friendly and the food ready extremely quick.

I normally do not give 1 star reviews to independent family owned businesses like Babe's, but I am making an exception to my rule. My friend from Lockport took me to Babe's for their   $1.50 hot dogs. What a mistake! The hot dogs were low quality generic type hot dogs that tasted terrible. Also it was so loaded with mustard that I got a big glop of mustard in my hand with every bite. I had to buy a small soft drink to qualify for the $1.50 hot dogs. At $1.69 for the soft drink, it is a huge ripoff. I can get a much better hot dog for $1.50 at one of the big box food warehouses and that includes a large drink which you can refill. I will not be back. NOT RECOMMENDED!

Just plain awful. Hot dogs are thick and bland... The kind you can buy at the grocery store. I lol'ed when I saw, I think it's on the side of the building, something about best salads in town HA!!! If you consider cubed lunch meat and iceberg lettuce a real delicious salad experience. There are a ton of these little hot dog places around but this one actually makes me angry at how gross and all around unappetizing the food is. I have given it more than one chance and no... Just no.
The food and service was horrible..unless you go there to drink it's not worth the visit..even with the $20 coupon selling for $10 I left dissatisfied.
If you like oscar meyer type hotdogs this place is for you. I wasn't impressed. I preffer all beef hotdogs & this was awful for me. Soory but not recommended

The cruise nights are kind of cool. 

The rest? Not so much. I've gotten food poisoning twice from this place. Fool me once... I don't really know who they think they're competing against because their prices are sky high and the food just really isn't very good.
The hotdogs are ok here, for the price. The atmosphere is ok. The biggest night/draw, in my opinion is the cruise night.

I'm giving Babe's 3 stars only because I am passionate about supporting small, local businesses. I had a hot dog and fries from here today but I have to be honest, I didn't care for it. The casing was too hard or tough. I know that is by design, but I don't care for a hot dog with a "snap." Also, I found the hot dog itself to be over seasoned, especially with garlic. Again, I realized this is by design, but its not to my taste. Having said that, the fries and service were great and the price wasn't too bad. I will definitely be back to try their burgers, but I just don't care for their style of hot dog.

Went on a whim the other night looking to try a different place and if I was just rating on the taste of the food they would have probably been given 4 stars. I got a couple chili cheese dogs that were as good as most others around, it's pretty hard to screw up a hot dog, as Well as a Philly cheese steak sandwich for my fiance. The Philly was great flavorwise but I would have liked it to be just a little bigger. I also go fried mushrooms, when I first got them the centers were frozen but about a minute of carry over cooking made them just fine. Now to the reason they got 2 stars. Crazy expensive. The Philly sandwich alone costed over $7 and That's without fries and a drink. The chili cheese dog was almost $4 dollars a piece. $22 is to much for a small sandwich, 2 hot dogs, and mushrooms. Go to Babar's for a Philly and Joe's or Hey Hotdog for dogs and save a couple dollars

Gotta order another item from menu to qualify...they don't remind you. Ordered 2 hotdogs with everything plus one with sport peppers and a chili dog with onions. Received the hotdog with everything correctnext dog had peppers but no pickleand chili dog had no onions.
One outta three not good. Do you really have to open up all your food and check before you leave?

The staff was very nice & the dogs are huge! I would definitely come back to try more. They have classic car shows often but as a spoiled Chicago gal, I had better hot dogs in my day.  It's still a good deal

By definition, a hot dog joint is a hot dog joint.

Can it really get more than 3 stars?  Yes, this place can.

The hot dogs here are really good, I like to grab a couple whenever I am over this way.  But it's a hot dog joint.

If you like hot dogs, you will like these.  Otherwise, upgrade to a restaurant and eat your dogs at home or the Ball Park.

I support small businesses. They are what keep our country alive. What I don't support is the hot dogs here. They have a strange flavour like a weird beef/Oscar Meyer mix. 

Get a wrap. You will thank me. I usually get the chicken parm wrap with added red peppers. It is incredibly good and incredibly filling.

Overpriced and not that good. I'm sure you can get a hot dog somewhere that is way better and not a rip off. I try to patronize local business but I would like for them to be good and worth the money. No thanks to this place. Sorry.

This place is Close to my work so I come here about once a week. The food is just average the beefs are kind of flavorless as is the burgers. The salads are pretty good and very big with lots of toppings. I don't like their polish sausage too much but I think the hotdogs are ok. Definitely wish they had the all beef dogs like the other places around us! Also a little on the expensive side, great service every time though.
Got the hamburger & fries. It was pretty good, nothing special. I'd probably eat here again if nothing else is around & open.

Food is horrible the hotdogs had little black/white speckles only god knows what those were, And the chili was horrid to.

The hotdogs are WAY to expensive for what you get the fries are dry and tasteless the pop is bad also and way to foamy I sat there for 3 mins filling my pop cause of foam....

The hotdogs tasted walmart brand and the chili tasted like hormels basic can of 1.75 chili what a coiecidence that walmart is right there, save your self money and go buy some ballpark hotdogs and wolfs chili for the same price but you get better quality and more food also the people are rude as hell and very patronizeing.

Will NEVER eat here again $7 dollers for a hotdog? id much rather eat at hey hotdog or protillios for a little less or the same price for much much better food.

The food is average at best except for the chilli which is downright nasty! A single sandwich (cheese steak) which mistakenly became a combo meal. A order of fries and an additional soft drink came to $17.51. The order of fries was the highlight of the meal. Not the chili cheese fries. The plain old run of the mill frozen ass fries. Ill come back after they go out of business and the new place opens. Just like what happened at the shorewood location. Minus one stereotypical is more appropriate !!

I have never tried their hotdogs, I usually get their Philly cheese steak sandwich. They're ok, and their fries are real good too. I've had better philly's but theirs is ok. I like theirs better than Jersey Mikes.

I've had too many meals here that just did not taste good, especially for the price. I got their award winning talian beef the other day and it was dry and had no flavor.  I paid $13 for a Itl beef,small fry, and medium pop.  Also have gotten the poor boy  and once again was disapponted. Mr. Submarine has got them beat by a long shot on price and flavor.  The chicken salad was gross too. None of their meat has any flavor. I like the idea of supporting local businesses but they've let me down too many times.  The only thing I'd probably eat here again is a hot dog and that's nothing special either. If it wasn't for me working a block away I'd probably never eat there again.

Babes has been here in Joliet as long as I can remember. A few years ago they put a second location up on route 59 in Plainfield....right near a Portillos.   That Babes seemed to go under quickly. Maybe that's why they have all kinds of papers inside about "spending your money locally"?   

Anyway, I mainly come here for their salads and wraps. The salads are massive, fresh, and rival the more expensive ones at Portillos. The buffalo chicken wrap is great too! 

The burgers are pretty good, as well as the pulled pork sandwich. The hot dogs are definitely my least favorite item on the menu. 

This place can get really busy around lunch time on weekdays and seems to have a lot of regulars. Try getting there just before noon if possible. You can also order ahead for a pick-up in the drive through.

Okay, I didn't go inside, so no comment there. However, the Jumbo Cheese dog was solid. Tried the deluxe jumbo dog as well which was also delicious. No comment on the beefs, etc. Cheap too. These places are hard to come by in the era of fast food chains and deserve our business.

Hot dogs are not that great, but not awful.
Joe's has better dogs.

Polish dogs are good.  Hot dogs are average
There is a hot dog special for $.99, but again you may want to pass on the hot dogs.
Sevice is reasonable.

Hot dog was disgusting, definitely will not go here again. Burgers are tasteless, it definitely looked good with caramelized onions and a toasted bun, but when I bit into it I tasted nothing, it no seasoning on it what so ever. Highly disappointed. Only thing that was good there was the french fries.

I agree with the other reviews. I went there for the first time today and tried their hotdogs. Disgusting! I ordered a jumbo with everything and it barely had anything. I was expecting more on them. I also had a chili cheese dog which was disappointing as well. They used a slice of cheese and the chili was blah. Maybe I will go back and try a wrap or something but definitely not for the hot dogs.
surprised at the bad reviews. I've never had anything bad here. I think the host dogs are some of the best around.

Just aweful! Their "hot dogs" are disgusting. I know a good dog, and this one is gross. Went there on $1 night, and there were so many children, i got a headache. Their service was slow, food gross, smells bad inside...If babe's paid me to go there, i'd say no thanks.
My wife and I went to try this place out, because we were told they have good hot dogs.  Well at almost $3 a piece, they were terrible!  I would not recommend eating here.  TERRIBLE!

I heard about the "great" hot dogs here, must have been joking.  They remind me of those nasty 3/4 lb hot dogs they sell for novelty in Las Vegas, but worse.  I had one guy who came in tell me tell me how he & his dad wait for the .99 coupons to come out to order a "sh*tload" of them and keep them in the freezer at home.  Come on, fast food places have .99 menus nowadays.  I think he tried to open a place next door to Portillos and quit before it was finished.  I also tried the beef, hated it.  The tamales, disgusting.  Will never go back, but if I ever get a .99 coupon I'll give it to my buddy so he & his dad can buy a "sh*tload".

I had the vegetable egg roll my husband the pork egg roll I had shrimp with vegetables my husband harbor delight Everything was Delicious. I will come back again. Service was also great. 
A hidden delight Asian Harbor Is. 
Gwen H

Nope. "Quality" is not just liking a place once. Quality is consistency, continual improvement, and setting a standard that customers expect and are happy to return to. Asian Harbor is not on course. Tonight, we ordered a variety of items for our family for take out. The proteins were all best described as "jerkys". The chicken and beef were both over cooked, tough, and flavorless. While the shrimp and rice dishes were good, i can't tell if they were actually "good" or just good in comparison (oh, and the brown paper bag they overstuffed the takeout order into tore itself apart on the journey to the parking lot).

The challenge Asian Harbor is dealing with is maintaining standards that make it worth returning to. If you recommend a restaurant to friends and family, you want it to be as good as it was for you. But if every time you go, it's a quality gamble, you'll eventually stop going. You'll eventually stop recommending it. Ultimately, it won't stay open.
Food is great. Service is wonderful. All you can eat sushi can be better with more rolls but they are all yummy and you don't leave on an empty stomach.
Good stuff. Not too greasy, very fresh sushi. Very friendly, fast service, not too busy at lunch time too

The service is on as long as they aren't too busy. The sushi is pretty good. I didn't enjoy the chicken and broccoli. I've been here several times but I only come for the sushi and when I have plenty of time

I decided to try a new lunch place today in Lockport where I work and boy have I missed out over the last five years working in the area.  The food is outstanding.  I had won ton soup and the chicken and shrimp hibachi lunch which was so good.  Only reason it did not get five stars is because they do not have wifi.  Will be back again.
Decent.  I've never had my socks knocked off, but a lot of people really like this place. For me it's just never blown me away.

Pros:
Clean. The service. 

Cons:
Bland food. Portions too large. Unnecessary to get that much food.
I've had very good meals here. My favorites are the Mongolian beef and the shrimp fried rice. Both are delicious.

Wow, what a hidden gem in Lockport. The food is very good, and the sushi rolls don't skimp out on the seafood. The all you can eat sushi offers a lot of variety, as well as a healthy amount of non sushi items to mix things up. My only issue is when we received flat pop, our waitress didn't seem to understand English when I mentioned that to her. She also seemed to pass us up on numerous occasions  when asking for her. Again, I believe it was due to the language barrier.

Otherwise a place worth visiting.

Second visit: had to dock these guys a couple stars. This time around only I ordered all you can eat and we had a warden by our table the while time. My wife reached over to try an edamame and he literally put his hand in front of her to stop her.
Was excited to try the food and was not disappointed. Ordered sushi and was really good. The place was busy too! Love keeping business in town!!

Best Sushi in town. They have all you can eat and a decent price. I recommend. My son loves their sweet and sour chicken. The staff isn't the fastest, but friendly,  the sushi is worth the wait. 
Sweet!!!

Very disappointed. When someone says they have a food allergy, you don't serve that person that item and tell them to pick it out. The only waitress took it back assured me it was new. I now am sick. 
Thank you Asian Harbor

This place was average.  I got the orange chicken with fried rice and crab Rangoon. Since I see orange chicken as one of the most basic things an Asian restaurant can have, I expected it to be solid.. Not the case.  As for the crab Rangoon, it was very good.

One last gripe is that I have never left an Asian restaurant without leftovers, but I left this one still hungry.

My husband and I were craving sushi so went here on a whim, not expecting much. We usually drive out to Orland for Fuji or Tokyo Steak House. We were sooo pleasantly suprised. Had the tempura shrimp roll, jalape√±o chicken, pork fried rice, and potstickers and they were all great. I also had a pear martini which was delicious. Definitely will be going back since it's right down the street.

This place is very overpriced for what you get! When they first opened, they gave generous r portions and good was great do the prices didn't hurt but now their prices went up, portions went down as did the quality!!!! I'd rather drive further to get good food worth the price!!!

If they aren't going to do their "all you can eat" one night they should have something posted on the window instead of letting you find out after you've sat down, started drinking and have your meal decided and then they expect you to be ready with a backup choice right there when they're ready. 

The staff is slow. The people that came in 5min after us were taken care of 1st. The staff has brought 2 different "to go" orders out followed by a woman from the back shouting in an Asian language as she takes the bag from them and empties it on the table next to me to change what's in there. There's a table near the bar that's been piled with dirty dishes from before I got there and sat the whole time. And when I got there we were one of two couples in seats and there were 4 people at the bar so there's no reason that table should be dirty.  And make sure to look all the way down near the bar. They obviously don't think the specials should be posted near where everyone will see them. I didn't see the specials until about 5min after ordering. 

And on cold days, leave your jacket on. We sat 1/2 way through the place and every time the door opened you get a strong cold draft. Never had this strong of a breeze in a building like this before. 

But the food is good.

They have great variety in their menu. I can't pass up ordering the Godzilla or Super Crunch roll. Great flavors and has a little bit of a kick. They actually hold up really well if you're doing a take-out order, too. You can't go wrong with the majority of the specialty rolls, but the Sunny was my least favorite. 

I've also had the Kung Po chicken/shrimp. These can be a little more hit and miss in regards to the spiciness of the dish. If you don't handle heat well, be clear when ordering that you want it on the milder side.

The dine-in experience can be lengthy especially on a Friday or Saturday night. It's a smaller place, and groups of 6+ are going to struggle to have comfortable seating. I would highly recommend them as a quick take-out option. Order ahead and give yourself about 25 minutes.

I've always had a consistently enjoyable experience. Very solid option.

Carry out review.

After getting home I saw the carry out order was incorrect so I called and they were rude on the phone. They would not make  ANY attempt whatsoever at correcting the order. They would not take the food back and make the right dishes nor just refund my money. Over $30 for two screwed up entrees. Will not be back.
The phone conversation was a nightmare as they barely spoke English.

In the vacuum of decent food that is Lockport, Asain Harbor stands out. Their Chinese food blows the other places in town away. Just don't expect huge three day portions to take home. They actually seem to grasp how much a normal person can eat.

Their sushi is good but nothing amazing. Ive never been upset with taste or presentation and am always quite satisfied though they seem to skimp on the fish if you order a more expensive variety.  Their chef specials aren't quite daring or unique but worth the order.  

Service is good but slow they really do try their best to make you happy.
Got orange chicken. Chicken was still raw in the middle. Also got chicken lo mein. The noodles were mush. Absolutely the worst food I've had in a long time. Probably never going back.

Tasty sushi in a cute place!  Love the ambiance of this little joint.  Very nice, clean, cloth napkins!!

Let's get down to the sushi-
Spicy Tuna - Yum.  Standard spicy tuna roll, generous amounts of fish
Angel Hair -  crab on top with apple inside?  Heck yes.  Win
Dragon - Tasty eel, tasty shrimp

Can't wait to try their other Specialty rolls.  

The regular rolls are super cheap, under $6.00, so it balances out the specialty roll prices.

Also, they do offer an all you can eat sushi option for $21.00/person.

Chinese food smelled and looked great.

The service is slow, but the food is worth the wait.  Why rush through dinner anyway?
Grabbed sushi to go, and it was so amazing and fresh! So glad there's a place like this in the area, so I don't have to drive too far.

Gurl bye. 

That's exactly how I felt after I read all of these glowing reviews on this place. Are you guys smoking crack? Abusing prescription meds? Snorting Drywall!?!! I stopped in for lunch with my boyfriend based on the good reviews. The inside is decorated nicely. I loved how they decorated the napkins in cool stand up triangles on the tables.
      I ordered a watermelon smoothie to start. I was so excited that Asian Harbor actually used REAL fruit, and not a smoothie mix. I started with a Japanese appetizer called Gyoza, which was a fried dumpling that resembled a pot sticker. My boyfriend ordered pot stickers, and we actually laughed about how they were similar. The pot stickers and Gyoza were very good so I just knew I would enjoy the rest. I couldn't have been more wrong!!
     Anyhow lets get down to business. I ordered a Japanese dish trying to be different, and I didn't care for it. The picture shows shrimp tempura on top of noodles. I got ONE piece of shrimp??!!  #MassiveFailure!  The egg rolls sucked! I ordered pork egg rolls, and I swear they gave me veggie egg rolls. I cut them open and asked them to show me the meat. The waitress said the little pink dots are meat?? Crumbs! The egg rolls tasted like  frozen pre made Manchu wok egg rolls. I tried my boyfriends fried rice, and it was nothing special. The entire meal tasted like something you'd get at a mall food court. #DoBetter 

Lockport residents you are killing me. Until next time!!

Never disappointed  with the carry out.   Sushi has never let us down and tried a lot of there choices.  The dine in is underwhelming and cold feeling.  Close and can't go wrong with the Sushi carry out.
Great food! Love it!

We've eaten here a couple more times. It continues to be hit and miss, but good enough for a 3-star. The curry was bland, but the sesame chicken was very good. We got another round of sushi too. She was still pretty unimpressed, but I liked what we got a lot better this time. All in all, a decent enough sushi place if we need something close, but I doubt we'll get it often.

Glacial service. Moves like pond water. To call the service in this establishment appalling and abysmal is an understatement. 90 (ninety) minutes for service of entr√©es on a Monday night with a 5:45 reservation. Party of 6. 90 minutes to deliver what turned out to be surprisingly little food. Truly the slowest service I've ever experienced. I would have walked out at around the 45 minute mark, but it was my mother's birthday. P. S. According to our waiter, the sushi chef is off on Monday nights. Apparently whomever showed up to prepare food tonight was also off. P. S. S. A dish on the menu which states it includes 14 pieces of tuna actually has exactly no tuna whatsoever. It does, however, contain eel. This was very puzzling to our waiter.

We went here with three adults and 3 children. The service was good and the food got to us quickly. We had the all-you-can-eat plan where you select different sushi choices from a menu. It seems to contain most of the same selections from the main menu. So its just a matter of deciding how much you think you will order. They gave us the same deal for the children at half price and didn't charge for the 2 year old. The food was excellent. My daughter and her children have been living in Singapore for 5 years and they love sushi. They all enjoyed the meals here. It didn't measure up to what they had when they went to Japan, but then again we're not next to the ocean. We'll be going back.

Finally a place to get good Chinese/Sushi in Lockport.  I was so sad when we moved here a few years ago and tried the local places to find they totally sucked.  

Soon as Asian Harbor opened I tried it and found my place.  Go here at least once or twice a month now.  My son love the Sushi (he is 8), and my daughter who is pretty picky sticks with the rice options.  

They are pricey but the lunch options are reasonable.  I wish they delivered.

Average.  Not our favorite for take out.  My wife likes it since it's clean.  I got the veggie lo mien and for $9 it was NOT impressive.  I probably wouldn't go back for average, not outstanding food.

I love this place!
The food is so much better than the other asian restaurants in town.  My wife and son love the sushi but I come for the best chicken lo-mein ever!

Lunch specials here, especially the bentos, are the best deal.  Sushi is good.  I have never tried their Chinese food, instead focusing on their Japanese selections, of which they have a few non-standard offerings for the suburbs.

Their udon is spot-on and delicious.  It's hard to find out here, and the noodles were actually, well, Japanese.  An excellent example of traditional udon.  The tempura is also perfect.  The shrimp is breaded in panko and done in, again, the traditional style, and the vegetables were also a delight.  It was a pleasure to find somewhere with relatively good Japanese food near Lewis University.

I've not tried their raw sushi yet - next trip definitely!
We've only had take-out here, but it's a go to for my husband and I! I love being able to get sushi to go.

The sushi is great.  I had the tiger roll that blew me away and your standard rolls that were good, albeit hard to screw up.  I will definitely return for the sushi.

The hibachi though.......left something to be desired.  I came in thinking it was one of those cook at the table chef flinging shrimp deals.  It is not.   But that's ok, not everyplace needs to be that.  EDIT: I just looked at the menu and they have a picture of the guy at the table cooking method.  Which was not an option that I saw on site.

Unfortunately the "hibachi" meals we ordered were on the bad side of crappy.  The meat was sub-par and the veggies had a smokey flavor to them, which was not terribly welcome.  The real kicker was that everything came out on one plate and lit seemed that they just poured a sauce over the whole deal.  The salad was saddening too, the ginger dressing was more like a ginger/thousand island mix dropped over some iceberg lettuce.  the whole meal was very lack luster and I wouldn't recommend it.

I haven't had the chance to try the "Chinese" food yet.  But I am willing and will do an update once I do.  Let's hope its better than the hibachi.
This was my first time here and it was fantastic.   We were going to go to aurilios pizza when we saw Asian harbor.  We only had sushi and will be back for the same.
Excellent. Sushi is incredible.  Highly recommend this new place. Been waiting for good sushi in Lockport for years. Finally!!!

Good food, kind of expensive for the quality of food you get. Don't get me wrong the food is good. We just got take out a couple times. There's not many options for Chinese food in Lockport so it will do.

There sushi lunch specials are awesome! You can't beat the price for three rolls and soup or salad. My only complaint about the lunch specials are that they aren't available on Sundays so you basically end up paying double which kinda stinks I've had the Chinese food lunch special and it was ok, I'd defiantly recommend the sushi!

Here we go with this place. I was excited to come here as they are fairly new. I ordered Chinese food. Pepper steak, egg rolls and fried rice. I love egg rolls but these were some of the worst. They tasted like something that was pre frozen. Just an awful flavor to them over all. The pepper steak was just ok. The fried rice was a mess if this is the best Lockport has to offer I'm going to have to head on the expressway

Asian harbor is awesome! It tastes like homemade. Everything is always fresh and hot. You never get twice heated fried rice it's still light and fluffy when you get it. I've tried a lot on the menu from sushi to hibachi to orange chicken and egg foo young and I haven't had a bad meal yet. So glad to have quality food near the house.
Come here strictly for the Sushi and never disappointed. Not my favorite sushi, but not bad for Lockport.

Place is so good !!! I have yet to try sushi but I'm sure they are amazing! They don't cook their food in heavy oil and salt and also always get my order right- I always ask for sauces on the side to mix in my own way! This place is the best Chinese/Japanese place in Lockport :)

Delicious. I tried the octopus salad, spider and dragon roll. All were great! My friends tried the Mongolian Beef and the Szechuan  Chicken and they couldn't stop raving about the flavor.
On a Saturday afternoon, the environment was surprisingly cozy and relaxing. The only reason I give four stars rather than five is simply because I got the impression the waiters were bored and literally came to check on our table about every two minutes. A little too attentive. But the food was delicious and the prices are fair. I'll definitely be returning. 
I hope this stays in Lockport for a long, long time.

The first time I visited Asian Harbor was right when they opened and I have to say I was not a fan. Well, I believe in second chances and I am so glad I went back.  We sampled a few of the chef sushi rolls - the Monster Roll is fantastic with just the right amount of kick.  We also tried the Jalapeno Chicken dish - so flavorful a hint of sweetness and just the right amount of spice - it is a crave able dish. Crab Rangoon and steamed pot stickers are great.  We will for sure be dining at Asian Harbor again.  Staff was very friendly and courteous, but service is either very fast or quite slow - maybe a bit more training. So glad they found their groove!

The food is excellent---particularly the sushi.  Employees are always friendly and the food, when ordered, is almost always ready in 15 minutes.  My favorite restaurant in Lockport since it opened in February.

Man!! The food here is great!! I had a Turkey Burger, mini corn dogs, and mac and cheese bites!! The Turkey Burger had great sauce and the greens made me feel very healthy. The mini corn dogs took me back to my childhood and the mac and cheese bites were a comfort food that put me at ease... 

GO TO MANZO'S BURGER! You won't regret it!

I went to Au Cheval, just to see if it was as good as all the hype.   I waited 1.5 hrs for a burger that was NOT as good as Manzo's.    Manzo's is worth the drive to the Southside.  

The Mushroom burger is the best.  Be sure to eat it there.  Something not quite as good when taken out.  The fries are also great.  

Will be trying the burger with the egg later.

Nice place, very quite and cozy. I have Southwest wrap with grilled chicken and it was delicious. My partner had a blue burger and it was great too. Even fries were good. Shakes are amazing too. Prices are right too
Great little family run burger joint.Never had a bad meal.  They do a really good job.  The buffalo chicken wrap/burgers are really good.

High quality burgers are obviously very trendy.  You can put this place up there with any popular spot.  Super satisfying burger, huge topping portions, good fries, good shakes, nice people, clean place.  And great prices.

Can't really ask for them to improve on anything.

If you're hungry and in the area, Manzo's Burger is the best choice. Top notch burgers and food at a reasonable price. Multiple burger combos, fresh fries, and even a gyro salad with the best dressing I've had in a long time.

It's foolish that other bars in the area don't serve food, but luckily most are byo food anyway leaving Manzo open for to-go orders. The service is always friendly and keeps me coming back.

I can't get enough of this place.

One of the best burgers & sandwiches in the neighborhood. Many options to choose from, and great deals throughout the week. Now called Manzos Burger. Service is excellent, friendly family owned establishment.

This is the best burger place in the area! The burgers are so fresh! Made right away when you order. It gets even better. Everything is made when to your order, the fries are cooked to perfection and nicely salted. It's a small family business, it's very clean inside and very few seats. Overall, a great experience here. Will be back!
Very underrated joint fries and burger is phenomenal but was debating giving a 4 due to small space and eating area. Im sure theyll expand eventually but its the grub that counts

One word...delicious! I bought the all natural Blu Burger (blue cheese, bacon, onion strings and special sauce)  and it was extremely tasty. The fresh cut fries were even better than the burger. Every neighborhood needs a fresh fast food joint.

This place used to be 5 Star Burger but same people..just a different name 

Let me start by addressing others complaints. 1) there is parking...its just behind the building. If you can't even walk that far you probably shouldn't be eating burgers and fries anyways...just saying. 2) Cash only is not that serious...especially when you consider its a small mom and pop trying to make a living. 

Now...awesome food!!  I love the burgers...my wife loves the veggie burger. Very kind people making awesome food and the ability to support a neighborhood business.  Sooooo much better than the high end burger chains!!

This is my kind of place. I drove passed it several times before I checked yelp. The positive reviews made me find a way to get there and I did. Family owned and operated. Great burgers in interesting combinations that work. I would love to see them expand and grow. Parking is an issue, minimal seating... But I go to a restaurant to eat when I'm hungry and Mango doesn't disappoint.
Had the 5 Star burger, jalapeno burger, bleu burger and turkey burger. Each and everyone is ridiculously good. Best burger anywhere in the area. You need to come here
Tried Manzo's burgers for the first time today, after hearing great reviews, and was not disappointed! I'm definitely coming back, and would recommend it to anybody.

I had heard such great things about this place but had not had a chance to try it until now. Everything I heard was true. The burgers are unbelievable.  And so are the fries. This place is definitely worth checking out.

What a great spot! I had a Chicago Style Dog and it was actually all beef! I'm always shocked when establishments put it on the menu and then you get a hot dog with chicken, pork, and whatever else. My boyfriend ordered the Jalape√±o Burger. He then ordered ANOTHER Jalape√±o Burger! My guess is... He really liked it! The fresh cut fries are just the icing on the cake. I will definitely be returning soon and my boyfriend even sooner.

Stopped in recently for lunch, hoping to enjoy what I was led to believe would be a solid Southside burger. Unfortunately, our first visit netted average meat sandwiches and a dirty, unlocked uni-sex bathroom door leading to an eyeful of employee deuce-making (Ewww). Anyway, I checked out the Five Star Burger, while my wife tried her hand at the Bourbon Burger. Both seemed to have the makings of a good burger, but fell short in the flavor department. I almost question if the excess of ingredients on both sandwiches were in response to the flavorless meat product they called a burger. Certainly not fresh, almost completely dried out, and void of seasoning. If they called it a grilled onion, saut√©ed pineapple, and smoked bacon sandwich, I might have left with a smile. But they didn't, and I didn't. My wife's Bourbon Burger was a tad better as ingredients were above par, but again same meat patty was involved. We did grab an order of French fries, which were hand-cut and seasoned well; but ended up almost cold and were obviously waiting in the basket while the burgers thawed away. Bottom line... Five Star appears to be an average burger joint at best.  They do offer daily sandwich and side combos around $5, but probably won't be returning to check out the rest of the menu. 

And what's with the old-school Italian music in the background? So confused...

If I could give 100 stars, I certainly would.  Another place I was excited to give a review for.  Was getting my car repaired nearby and saw the great pics and reviews on Yelp of this place and decided to try them.  Small place but very clean.  They've only been open close to 9 months.  I love supporting small businesses!  What I was impressed with right away was how friendly the staff were.  I appreciated that.  There was a couple that had gotten the Italian Beef sandwich which was huge and the Bourbon Burger.  Once I saw that Bourbon Burger masterpiece, I had to have that!!!  Very interesting combo of food that make up that juicy burger.  The burgers are handmade people!  When I opened my container to see my burger, I couldn't believe how huge it was!  Piping hot, because it was made to order!  One of the BEST burgers I have ever had!  So glad I went.  Can't wait to go back.  Want to try one of their shakes.  Top Notch service and food, a total win-win and certainly worthy of its name!!

Totally love this place, this was our first time here tonight, the service is amazing, food is awesome and will come back often, they have a new menu coming but the original menu is good, the hangover burger is insanely tasty and huge, my fianc√© got the 5 star burger and las she is from the west coast and said its  as good as 'in n out' is huge!!!.  Will be back here lots more, give this place a try for sure!!!!!

Just ok, and not worth the trouble.  This place hit a few of my pet peeves.  First,  parking is terrible.  Second,  I can't stand when places do cash only, with the high fee ATM inside that I'm sure they get a cut of. Third, 
If you're going to bother opening a restaurant get a fountain machine....Coke will let you use it for free. The burgers were ok which is why they got 3 stars.

I went here in support of a new local business and was very happy that I did. The "hangover" burger was awesome. Everyone loved the fresh cut fries and their burgers. Only wish that they had milkshakes but otherwise 5 stars.

Dropped in here on a whim and a positive recommendation I spotted online 15 minutes prior. Really quiet place that certainly deserves to busy from open to close due to their remarkable burgers!

I tried out the Irish burger and was not disappointed. This place puts a lot of love into their establishment. They are worth your time and deserve your support.

WOW!!!!
Handmade burgers - cooked perfectly, fresh toppings, fresh cut fries, homemade sauces.  I will definitely go back when I'm visiting family again.  Location kind of stinks for them - no parking.  I hope they are still there.  Take the walk!!  Support a family biz.  they were all there working and REALLY great.  Even switched the TV to a family channel for my niece (we never asked)
Great menu is really hard to decide what to choose but anything is great fries are the best fresh cut ever taste the service is exelent thaanks guys keep up great work

I have been wanting to try Five Star for some time, I went today and it did not disappoint. It is a small place, seats about 16 people. You can see your food being cooked, fresh cut fries, beef is really good, they have white American cheese, it is really a great addition to the burger along with the bacon. The five stars for this review is very appropriate. The staff helps with the stars, they are pretty friendly and will answer any questions. They are cash only so have some cash handy. The location is quaint as well in Beverly right on 111th street at Western Ave.  Try it you will like it.

AWESOME! I got a double cheeseburger with barbecue sauce, grilled onions and bacon and it was absolutely delicious! Everything was extremely fresh and the bun was extremely soft (I can't stand when you get a burger and the bun sucks. It really makes all the difference in the world!) I also got an order of cheese fries which was really good as well. This place is a nice addition to the neighborhood and I can't wait to come back! But be aware, it's cash only so hit an atm before you go.

Take the walk. I went here to get a quick bite on a Saturday and was very happy to find that the burgers are hand packed. 

The parking is tuff. It is hard to find a good spot. But please take the walk. It is well worth it. The sauces are made from scratch. I will go back the next time I am wanting a great burger.

Former 5 Star Burger (actual name) - solid grease joint with slightly exotic burger offerings food better than Nicky's Grill ( though no desserts likes Nicky's ) if Top Notch is still open that's the spot but Manzo's is best burgers/ grease in area ( Pops for better beef). Solid above average burgers

There are some creatively delicious burgers going on here at this gourmet joint. It's a nice surprise for the area. Yum. The burgers aren't oversized, which I like cos then I can actually finish it. My new lunch spot!
Love this family owned business. Food is awesome the service us great. The father has a special seasoning for the fries, that you'll love. My favorite is the turkey burger.

I read all the positive reviews, looked at the great photos, and saw they had a 4 and a 1/2 rating and thought I'd give them a try. For the most part I was pretty impressed. I'd actually give them a 3 and a 1/2 rating (but you can't choose 1/2 stars). I had the mushroom and swiss burger and it was pretty tasty. I really liked the buttery bun that they put it on. They put lettuce and tomato on it which is rare for a mushroom and swiss, but still good. The burger isn't that thick but it was made fresh to order. It could have used more swiss cheese. The mushrooms may have been slightly overcooked they were a little dark in color. I had a jalape√±o cheese pretzel for an appetizer. It wasn't too bad but, it sounded better than it tasted. I'm a pretzel aficionado so it takes a great pretzel to impress me. One thing that does irritate me about this place is the lack of drink selection. It's basically Coke or Pepsi. I had this same complaint for a sandwich shop in Crown Point (IN) named Sandwich City. Same deal, just Coke and Pepsi. Bottom line, Five Star Burger was good and I would go back.

Crave their signature burger.  Good fries. Need to branch out and try other items. It
is important to support local businesses and this one deserves it.

We came here because we are always looking for a good burger. While we have our favorites, there's always room for more. The food was pretty good and the employees were so nice. The prices are a little steep but the place is clean and it's a small business. I hope they stick around and introduce more items to the menu. They also only accept cash which is a big no no. I never have cash on me!

I don't eat hamburgers often (trying to be moderately healthy!) but I got a hankering yesterday that lingered through this evening. Several months ago, I noted the "burgerie" in question for just such a moment. 

The eat-in/take-out space is simple and clean. When I approached the counter, I was greeted by the friendly cook as well as cashier who took my order. I was asked several quick questions and in less than 10 minutes, I was served just what I had been hankering for PLUS a side of fresh, hot fries with my own bottle of ketchup.

I had a burger with grilled onions, mozzarella cheese and mushrooms served on a fresh, slightly grilled pretzel roll. 

Total gastronomic satisfaction with well-priced ($8), better-than-average food products, clean premises and a friendly staff who made the occasional indulgence completely worth it! I promise to return (though not too often) and highly recommend you give them a shot if in the area!
The five star burger is dank, didn't think I'd like pineapple on a burger, but its delicious, great fries, friendly fam that owns it. Sliders are good too

I thought it was just ok. A lot better places not to far away. The burger was decent,  and my fries could have been cooked a little longer. The place is clean and cook was friendly.  The owner or manager whoever was working the register  seemed like his personal call on his cell phone was more important than the customers.

Got the beef sandwich and fries, good stuff. It wasn't the special of the day, but the owner gave it to me anyway for $5, great deal!  The fresh cut fries were really good too. Friendly service, family owned joint...yeah, I'll go back.

Ok I drove by this place a bunch of times...looked at other yelp reviews had to give it a try...glad I did...fresh cut fries were not greasy but firm very good quality...I tried the turkey burger...(a little small for my liking) but fresh, homemade with very good flavor...plus the buns were very good...the price was not bad for what you get...give this local spot a chance for burgers

I have gone here several times and the burgers are very good. The turkey burgers are pretty excellent. This business is new and growing so its til ironing some kinks out but I believe it will do quite well as long as the quality of food stays high.  Welcome to the neighborhood.

Very good burgers! I really like them not only that but also the fries they're really good! They're freshly made and they taste so good ! I'm satisfied with what I had and I know ill have great quality burgers every time.

I love this place.....so far I haven't been disappointed with anything that I've order.... my favorite is the turkey burger...It's so juicy n flavorful...I ended up trying it on default only because they were out of beef and waiting on delivery...It was the best
Great burger and fresh cut fries! The service was good, the staff is very friendly. Also, the place is very clean and attractive.

I'm gonna give 5 star burger....5 stars! They made the burgers and fries from scratch and the owner was very friendly. I've lived away from the area for a while and I just moved back, and this was a welcome surprise. The fries are delicious and handmade and I watched the owner make the patty and cook up the burgers before my eyes. Excellent, and I will be back.

When it was Pacific Sub, it was a great place. Friendly, very reasonable prices, large portions,  just a nice mom & pop place to get something to eat. Now that the original owners have retired and sold the business, it is not the same at all. Despite them claiming to keep most of the original menu. Prices have gone up, portions are much smaller, and the food is not good at all. This use to be my go to spot to get a gyro, but not anymore. I couldn't even finish it, as it was disgusting. Burnt, bland, even the fires were burnt and bland.  Guess I'll be going back to Nicky's down the street.... R.I.P. Pacific Sub.
Wow was I surprised how good the burger was.  Not a big fan of fresh cut fries but they are fantastic.  the only thing that would make them better is if they delivered.

Really tasty burger and fries!  Staff is super friendly and accommodating. My only complaint was that they put mustard on my burger which wasn't listed in the toppings. Will definitely stop in again!!

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Joliet! For vegans, the beans are vegan without lard but the rice has chicken stock in it. I got avocado and bean tacos and they were delicious! Their guacamole is exactly how I like it- simple and a little spicy. The homemade fresh chips and salsa are also fantastic! My family got Huaraches and they loved them. Only bottled water and Jarritos & also cash only. Cheap prices, too! Really nice staff and great service. The restaurant is super cute and has a juke box. . I can't wait to come back to Joliet for El Comal!

Nestled in the SE side of Joliet (Rockdale) is this little GEM.  El Comal serves authentic Mexican cuisine with a heaping side of family pride.  Always busy in this small joint, but the food is consistently delicious.

Wednesday is $1 tacos - so call ahead and bring CASH...NO debit/credit accepted.  They have ice cream and a large variety of Jarritos soda.  Dine in or carryout they provide home made hot/mild salsas and limes. The fresh tortillas whether it be corn or flour are moist.

I usually order 15-20 tacos for my family - they are packed 3 tacos per foil wrap and always include onion and cilantro.  We like the steak/potato with cheese, onion and cilantro - but everything I had here is good.  

Why only 4 stars? 98% of the time I order 3 tacos with no meat for my vegetarian daughter they've given me all steak tacos...I finally quit ordering meatless tacos.

Take away these 3 reminders: Authentic Family Mexican, CASH only and No booze here.
Ordered the pastor and steak tacos, chips and guacamole, with beans. it was delish! This place is a hidden gem!

Stop in for lunch and for a small Restaurant it was very busy but well staffed and very pleased with the speediness and accuracy of the staff dealing with the lunch traffic. Food was hot and Great! Great food ! Great service! Great place to eat!
Great fresh authentic Mexican  food. Nice customer service. Small jewel in a small town.  The women in the kitchen cooking are very good and professional cooks. Try them out.

No horchata?!

Rockdale is like a quiet movie set for something set in a deserted, wild west town.  Rockdale is just south of Joliet and might as well be a part of Joliet.  I discovered Rockdale when I had to pick up a package from the UPS facility.  Curiosity led me to searching for restaurants in Rockdale, and that's how I found El Comal.

As I already mentioned, they don't have horchata.  What the FF?  They do have a variety of Jarritos sodas though, so I got the pineapple.

My husband and I had lunch here on Memorial Day, I was surprised how busy this spot was on a Monday afternoon.  While we were eating, lots of people would come and go, and at one point, all of the tables were full.

The food is good.  I had 2 tacos: one steak, chicken, and pork.  All three were equally good, served on soft corn tortillas with the customary cilantro and onion.  Chips and salsa are complimentary, and there are 3 salsas to choose from.  We also ordered the guacamole, which was served in a styrofoam bowl.  The food is good, authentic, and great for a casual lunch or dinner.

Prices are great too, I think the tacos were only $1.25 each.  Cash only!

If you live in Plainfield, drive the few extra miles to El Comal, because I still stand by the fact that there is no truly good Mexican food in Plainfield, especially tacos.

Came here the other night & must say the other reviews are spot on!  Huaraches are the way to go here. I didnt get the chirozo as recommended but instead pastor " the marinated pork." Wife had the asada huaraches.( Steak). I went there to get carryout. Place was mobbed at 6pm on a Monday. I waited a bit. Disappointed no horchata. Carryout was fairly quick. Cashier was a very pleasant girl. Still amazed  at the huaraches which are homemade soft corn tortilla shells. Whats interesting is they are not your standard 6" or 12" but a size different. They are an odd size which makes you realize they're homemade.   
Food was great! They put onions & limes
on the side. I like that cause you can put extra hot sauce on then cut it slightly w/ the lime. Not sure but feels authentic. 
I want to dine in next time. As previous reviewers stated, its cash only. They do have an ATM there in case you forget that. 
I did also have the quesadillas which were slightly above avg but nothing special. 
The prices are well below average which is nice if you have a group. Wasnt looking for margaritas and didnt see any. Small parking lot on side but plenty of street parking . I'd give it a 4 1/2 of 5 stars. If they had horchata, margaritas, and a better reputation for other menu items it 
could be a 5 but, definitely working checking out!

This place is awesome!!!! The food is fresh. The flavor is great and the price is just right. I definitely recommend this place. Anyone I've ever taken there always wants to go back. Overall it's one of my favorite places. The mass is fresh and the atmosphere is like family. The menu is not big but what they have on there they do it right! Five stars to this place.

I have heard good things about El Comal for quite some time and finally got to try it today.  I was very happy with the restaurant for the most part. 

El Comal is located in Rockdale, IL on a street that is famous for being in the Guinness Book of World Records for the most bars on one street (or something like that).  So the neighborhood is somewhat sketchy, but if you can past that it is definitely worth a stop. 

It was slammed at noon when we arrived, not an open table in the place.  Quite a mix of blue and white collar workers which tells me that this place is not a secret to those in the know in Joliet.  

I managed to read a few reviews while standing in line and kept seeing comments about the huaraches.  Now I've eaten at a hundred different Mexican places and one thing that I thought was odd is that every place has pretty much the same selections on thier menu.    How the hell have I never heard of a huaraches????   

I ordered the Tripas Huaraches and a Mixed Huaraches (steak, pork and chorizo).  I give them both a solid A.   The best explanation I can give you is a really long soft taco that isn't rolled up and the taco shell is home made and unlike any taco I've ever had.

Now, the salsa and the beans and rice leave a lot to be desired.  Had some of the sides been adequate I would have definitely given EL Comal a five star review!!

Give it a shot, you wont be dissapointed!

We are in the area visiting family and my aunt tells me that there is a place that sells huaraches. Obliviously, we had to get some so I ordered the al pastor huarache. The meat was tender and really flavorful, the tortilla was huge, but I could have used more cheese. Overall, extremely satisfied. I also liked that they brought out 3 types of salsa for the table to share. If we are in the area again, I am defiantly coming back.
Amazing, authentic, fresh Mexican food. Great service fantastic prices. Can't complain. Get the hurrache!!!

We are always on the hunt for a good taco place as my husband thinks he is to eat them on a consistent basis.  We went here on a Wednesday as they have $1 tacos (chicken, pork and steak only).  The first time we sat down with our two little ones who devoured the complimentary chips and salsa. We thought everything was great, except the chicken was a little dry.  The next time we visited, we took our order home. They give you plenty of everything to make sure your experience is short of dining in (minus chips). We had all steak tacos and they were delicious.  We will be frequenting this place, especially on Wednesdays :)
Just stopped in tonight in our way to Indiana. This place was legit. Very much a hole in the wall. Tacos taste like the real street tacos you can get in Mexico. Only warning is it is CASH ONLY.

Awesome place! make sure you order the chorizo huaraches they are HUGE, and very tasty. The place is small and most of the time you have to wait some time for someone to take your order but is well worth the wait for great Mexican good . Only thing that I didn't like is that is CASH only but is ok I guess.
Great huaraches. I ordered al pastor with no onions but they still put it on the side which I am thankful for. They were almost like caramelized onions

First if all, it's in a hilarious neighborhood. If you feel confident strolling through downtown Rockdale at night without being strapped, I applaud you. Once you get past that it's all gravy. The food is cheap and relatively fresh,  but their homemade salsas are shwag. It's cash only, which means one of two things. They are a money laundering operation, or they're a bunch of rebellious hipsters. I'm hoping it's the latter. The hours of operation are frustrating, I've been left out in the cold  more than a few times with this place. Despite all of the pitfalls associated with this place, it's easily the best mexican place in a 10 mile radius.

I stopped in here today for a few quick tacos, and overall the food was good.  It wasn't the best I have ever had,  not even the best in the area. It was just good. I will not be returning however because of the amount of dirt on the walls and ceilings.  If there is this much dust and grime right in Plain sight above my head, makes me wonder how much of it is not in my sight.  I had high hopes for this place, but I refuse to eat anywhere where I have to check my food for dust bunnies
Great food, great service nuzzled in a small community. Big portions on dinners, prefect size for any appetite. Very affordable, But be warned CASH ONLY.

Not a bad place, was really busy so that's always a good sign. Pastor was a little dry and not to par but the rest of my party enjoyed the steak tacos. They serve 3 different hot sauces with the chips, all were decent. Wed is dollar tacos.

Not a lot of lunch options here in j-town, so we decided on Mexican for a change and hit up this little gem in Rockdale.  This looks like your typical hole in the wall, no frills, CASH ONLY taqueria but oh my, it is sooo not run of the mill!!!

The specialty here are the huaraches, which is pretty much a long, HUGE taco.  But what sets this place apart from the others?  FRESH TORTILLAS!!!  They make it from scratch!!!  You can't find that ANYWHERE!!!  

I ordered a steak (asada) hurache and a gordita with chicharron guisado (stewed pork skins in a very spicy sauce)  All delicious and very cheap!!! My husband had al pastor and lengua and he was quite pleased with his choices.

Spanish and English are spoken here for all my non-bilingual friends. I was being nosey and looked at other peoples plates at I saw some delicious looking omelettes with their fresh tortillas on the side and some very good looking burritos.

Can't wait to go back!
Awesome place to come for lunch real busy but they are quick and they do many to go orders as well. Wednesday they have $1 tacos al pastor, asada, y pollo. Weekends they have menudo!!
Great food and service. It's a small place, so I usually eat and run as there are customers waiting to be seated. Prices are below average b

I very much enjoy this place! I can never decide what to get, because everything here is so good! Wednesday is $1 taco day. WOOTWOOT. 

Downfall is they only take cash, but they have an ATM!

I have had the privilege of finding this hidden gem about 4 years ago when I worked nearby. Carlos and his staff have truly created a masterpiece. It does not matter what you order because everything is Amazing!The quality of ingredients is second to none. What sets Tacos El Comal apart from the competition is their hueraches, which is hardly found in authentic Mexican cuisine. What makes the  huerache unique is that it is larger than a taco and has a sweet, corn/flour hybrid fluffy tortilla. furthermore, Tacos El Comal is one of a kind because of the salsa. The salsa has flavor that I have never tasted at any other authentic Mexican restaurant ever!!!  Particularly The red salsa has a smoky flavor great with steak.

Carlos, the owner Is a very friendly and is always working alongside his coworkers, and interacting with customers. Carlos takes pride in getting to know his customers and community. Do not be surprised if you are the only individual there that speaks english, which I think is a good thing because you know it's authentic. Another key feature is that it's super cheap. For 6 bucks a big guy like me can get full and still have quality. My wife and now live an hour away and still make trips to come here.

Bottom line: if you are looking for quality food and casual dining with a good culture and sense of community than this is the place for you. If you are a Pepes type of person looking for happy hour than this is  not your place. 

OH AND BRING CASH, NO CARDS ACCEPTED!!!!
They have ok tacos- one step up in authenticity from the "burrito" chains. The huaraches are what you want to get! $1 Taco Wednesdays, and well, you get your moneys worth.
Great Huaraches! But they accept cash  only.
I love steak huaraches! ..yummy. The guacamole is fresh and its delicious not like other places where you get a guacamole thats been in the fridge all day.

Burritos are great, Huaraches are great. I have been here 20 times now and I have never been short of impressed with the freshness of the food, attentiveness of the wait staff and the low impact price point.
They have the best huaraches.  Which is a bigger taco/quesadilla.  I get the steak. . Kinda of hidden place but worth time and effort .

Nice hidden find in Rockdale of all places.  This is the kind of eatery you'll find either by accident or came staggering out one of the 10+ bars the town has looking for some cheap, greasy food.

Tacos were above average. (especially when they're $1.00 each on Wednesdays) Its of the authentic kind and when they say if you want it with everything, they're referring to adding onions, cilantro on them. 

The huaraches was disappointing but was quite relieved that it was only a mere $3.25.  It was just a long tortilla with some diced steak on it.  However, I found a balled-up styrofoam in my bag containing long onion strips and a jalapeno, which I assume was for the huarache but didn't make it that much better.

My pork burrito was the real winner here.  If you like your burritos with lots of meat, beans, and cheese and with little lettuce and tomato, then you've come to the right place.  I've had burritos from numerous places and I rank the ones here right at top.

Overall, I liked Tacos El Comal but the huarache and being cash only prevents this place from 5 stars.  Everything else is great!

Food is really good. You can taste the fresh ingredients. I gave them 3 stars because they don't carry natural waters or mexican drinks. Also they only accept cash which is unusual because most people only use debit cards.

So, the boy went out for a drive with the neighbor boy and went to a place that had terrific "big tacos". Where I ask? Don't know ask the neighbor boy. Where I ask neighbor boy?  Don't know - somewhere on a main street. Luckily there are only like two main streets in Rockdale and after a little web searching I found the correct place.Teeny tiny little hole in the wall in an industrial area that I would  never have come across.

Turns out these "big tacos" are known as huaraches and are the specialty here:  homemade large tortillas stuffed with a choice of filling, cheese, cilantro and diced onion. Served on the side are grilled onions and lime. Yum! Boy had the steak and I had the daily special of chorizo and potato. We also shared the guacamole which was homemade and a big step above most Mexican fast food places. Total bill with two drinks was @$12.  We were going to carryout but decided to eat in. To our table we were brought tortilla chips with salsa verde, salsa roja and pickled jalapenos. This was a nice suprise for a fast food restaurant.

Awesome Thai food! Very new to the area and was looking for a new Thai place nearby. What a find! I got the red curry and it was amazing. The pad see eiw also is highly recommended by my household. Just be careful of how spicy things can get! The staff are great at explaining the menu and also accommodating those who can't handle as much spice. 

Great place!

Hard to believe that this little place in a shopping center plaza that is hard to find could be this good, but their Thai food is awesome, as is their cocktails.  I highly recommend them.  Great spring rolls and chicken satay!

I have sampled many an excellent Thai cuisine spots, but Montri Thai ranks right up there with excellent and tasty food preparations and presentations. I especially love the escargots appetizer, which is   baked snails in their special brown Thai curry sauce and sweet basil leaves, served with grilled garlic bread on the side.    I have had the honor of introducing this to many newbies and first timers, who were simply amazed. All of the entrees tried over perhaps a dozen visits have been outstanding, notably: Cashew chicken, Five Star Chicken, Nutty Chicken, Pepper Steak, Basil Fried Rice, Pad Kee Mao (my personal favorite) and Crab Fried Rice. Desserts are unusual and very pretty looking. Surprisingly they are have some interesting martini creations too. Highly recommended and if ever int he area - this is a no-brainer.

This is my favorite casual restaurant in Chicagoland. The staff are fantastic, and we always strike up fun conversations with the servers. The portion sizes are incredible for every dish, the food consistently prepared perfectly, and delivered with a big smile. It's a great place to bring a crowd. Literally every guest we've taken with us to eat here has fallen in love with it. 

Best Pad Thai in America. Seriously.

Meh. Nothing spectacular about this place. They have a very full menu, so there are lots of choices. I ordered the shrimp pad thai and the mango lobster rolls as an appetizer.

We got our entrees first. Then we asked about the appetizer which came about 10 minutes later. ????  We were told the chef had to work on the appetizer and that's why it was late. I didn't get that.

I really didn't find anything great about the food and neither did my dining partner. The service was spotty as they had the server handling the carry out orders as well.

I'm glad others are happy with this place, but I won't be going back.

Great avocado spring rolls and the chicken pod stickers did not disappoint. Got the Hawaiian fried rice and asked for it without shrimp since I'm not a huge seafood fan. It still smelled/tasted strongly of seafood. The rice was good, just wish it wasn't quite so fishy. The service was great, however. Very attentive.

I wish I could say I was super impressed with this place,  but I was not. My lil buddy Andy loved it. He said it was "the best 
Thai food he had ever eaten.." The Avacado Egg roll was good. I was not that impressed.....we got the 5 star chicken and sizzlin beef...Meh....

Try the Bangkok duck, it is amazing!! One of the best Thai dishes I have ever had. It is a kinda pricy item on the memu, but dont let the price stop you. It comes in a very generous portion. 

Other dishes I tried were not bad either. But the duck is just too delicious that it is the only dish I can remember and come back for.

Came here on a Monday night; we were the only ones in the restaurant. We ordered Yellow Curry with tofu and vegetable Pad Kee Mao. The noodles were average at best and the curry lacked flavor. We'll be sticking to our usual Khao Suay Thai from now on.

Welcome to the second non-chain restaurant in the Naperville area I will actually be glad to spend my money at! This place blows my mind; a complete hidden gem. 

From the outside, this place is nothing special and barely noticeable. I think this is what also makes this place great. You walk in, the ambiance is cozy and chic. It's not too big but not too small. My friend and I were promptly seated and offered drinks. Our waitress was awesome and funny. 

I ordered two things I don't quite remember the names of (see pictures) but I was so impressed by the portion and the quality. Even though there was larger portions, they don't skimp on the veggies or meat. It's loaded with deliciousness! Oh, and just like everyone says, the avacado rolls are to die for. Literally, die for them. They're amazing. 

Oh and something else to mention, they have free Jazz music the first Friday of the month! How cool is that?!

I foresee myself making this place my new go to carry out Thai place. It's awesome, and I can't wait until I can go again.

Tried this place on a whim and found a hidden gem!  We will be back for sure.  We ordered a few of our favorite Thai dishes to see how this place stacks up and left very satisfied!  We ordered the Pad Thai, Green Curry, and Panang Curry.  We asked for ours with extra spice and loved it!  Our server, Tah, was great!  Can't wait to go back.

Dine in on Sunday, place was absolutely empty, surprisingly for a Thai place nobody we've seen working there was Asian...
Anyway, we've ordered soup and 2 dishes, it took forever for the food to arrive, soup that was a coconut milk and lime grass with chicken was tasty, my coco-chicken was very good, wife didn't care her beef strings that suppose to come in on bed of chili peppers but had no spice or much of any pepper in it at all. Portions are fair, about right, service while attentive didn't know much about menu.

This place is no joke. Have only had take out but every time it has been stellar. Pad Woon Sen has the most flavorful sauce I have ever had with that dish anywhere, I love it!!! The basil fried rice has a nice peppery bite but is balanced by the savory flavors cooked into the rice. My wife ordered the pepper steak tonight and I tried it and it was quite honestly the best pepper steak I have ever had. I love Thai food, this place takes Thai food and elevates the flavor beyond what I have had in recent years. Also the avocado roll appetizer is also amazing. The crunchiness of the fried roll gives way to a burst of deliciousness!!! I was highly impressed by those. From all I have tried here I would say the theme that comes across is balance. In all their dishes, not one flavor overpowers another, they just meld together and are bright enough to complement one another without stealing the show. Seriously impressed! Their TomYom soup is also phenomenal. I ordered it extra spicy the last time I had a head cold and again the flavors were perfect together and pronounced enough I could still taste it despite my cold.

I will be a repeat customer and recommend to everyone!

I had a work victory to celebrate, and my husband decided thai food would be a good way to end the evening. The restaurant we initially intended on eating at was closing soon, so we yelped it up & found Montri Thai.

Located in a large strip mall in Winfield, IL it looks pretty simple on the outside. Once you get inside, however, it almost feels like you are at a restaurant near a tourist spot with soft music playing in the background.

We went on a Friday evening around 8:30pm, and the restaurant was on the empty side. We were seated promptly and given menus to look over.

I almost always order the Pad Kee Mao (spicy flat rice noodles) when I first visit a Thai spot. My husband ordered a curry dish (Coconut Yellow Curry?). My food overall was pretty decent. A little greasy for my taste, but definitely not overly oily to the point where I can't enjoy my food. The curry dish was delicious!

Our server was friendly and pleasant which enhanced our experience a bit more.

We look forward to trying out some of the other dishes Montri Thai has to offer soon.
I go here at least once a week.  I get things THAI hot and they deliver.  Wonderful spice and flavors.  Service is very good.

Absolutely wonderful first experience here on a Sunday night.  Both hubby and I had Tom Kha Kai soup with chicken, then he had the panang curry (which I sampled as well--amazing!) and I splurged on the bankok duck.  It's a huge portion--we could have easily shared--and well worth the price.  Nice, clean restaurant; server acted a bit oddly, but nothing major/did not detract from experience.  Will return for sure!

Excellent food. We are vegetarians and this places offered a lot of choices. We ordered vegetable rolls, Panagng vegetables and Drunken noodles. Everything was delicious. We also ordered Mango sticky rice for dessert which I did not care for much. Overall good experience. We will be back again.

Overall, it was good food. Crab Ragoons & Thai egg rolls were made fresh & had good flavor. Pad Thai was good, & the Oyster Beef was as well. One of the better Thai places I've been to outside of Chicago.
Absolutely the best Thai food my wife and I ever ate!! You need to try this place!! The duck is amazing!
Great place with reasonable prices.  I highly recommend the Pad Thai or Lard Nar.
Delicious! I had the chicken fried rice and spring rolls for appetizers. I am definitely coming back here.

WOW! is what I can start off with. This place is amazing. The prices are desent and the food was delicious. The server was soo nice I would definitely take the drive out to eat here again. The food all tasted fresh and the sauses that come with the appetizers that they say they make in house is really good and tasty.  I would so recommed this place to anyone wanting to eat thia food.

Amazing little spot I would've never found without the help of yelp!!! My girlfriend and I shared the tofu yellow curry dish and the vegetable pad tsi yew (sp)
Very delicious and satisfying!!
Very good food, great service!  We started with the fried shrimp, very tasty!  Spring rolls were just as good.
Third visit and this place is 3 for 3 for me.  Very good service and I love the spicy catfish. Also great Tom ka gai soup and satay. Aces.
Everyone enjoyed their meal and we will definitely be coming back. I highly suggest the Tom Yum soup it was great!

The avocado egg rolls were awesome.  The 5 star chicken had great flavor but the chicken was over cooked. My husband loved his noodle dish.  Service was slow but we weren't in a hurry so we were okay with that. We would go back.

Avocado rolls (plus the sauce that comes with) were so good! I would come back just for those. The Thai fried rice and chicken satay were also good, but pretty standard for what you'd get at many other Thai restaurants in the area. Reasonably priced and the portions are a good size as well.

You can't go wrong at Montri Thai. The service is always attentive and friendly.  The food is always fresh and delicious.  Their lunch specials are a crazy good deal - for a couple bucks more than a meal at McD's (under 10 bucks), you can enjoy a tasty meal including soup & appetizer.    I like their crab rangoons and spring rolls a lot, and usually get the spicy basil chicken for my meal.  DELICIOUS!   I believe they have live music occasionally on friday nights but I've only been here for lunch.

First time here, and wow!  Went in for lunch and ordered pad thai and cashew chicken.  The soup was yummy and spring rolls and egg rolls.  We ordered the infamous avocado spring rolls, which were just okay.  Nothing special.  I probably would have preferred regular shrimp spring rolls.  Overall, everything had a lot of flavor and I couldn't stop eating until there was nothing left.  Would love to go back and try something more adventurous like curry or something different.  

So far, so good.
Food is average. Not bad but not the best I've ever had. It's close to work and others rave about it.

I had high hopes for this restaurant because of all the great reviewed.  And I supposed you can't please everyone's taste buds and unfortunately, my taste buds were not a fan.  Everything else was great, and I would certainly come back to try other dishes.  The d√©cor is modern and nice.  The service is fast and friendly.  The owner even came over at the end of our meal to ask how everything was and solicit any feedback we may have.  He also mentioned that they will have a live Jazz band one Friday a month starting in a couple of months.

Thai Iceed Tea $3 - This was very good, not too sweet at all (in fact, I could go a tad sweeter).

Tom Kha Kai $5 - Thai coconut milk soup with your choice of chicken or vegetable cooked with lemongrass, bell pepper, mushroom and lime leave.  This was a tasty soup, but what threw me off were the pieces of green bell peppers.  I love veggies, but this is one of my least favorite vegetables.  I've never had that in a Tom Kha before.

Lard Nar with Tofu $9 - Big flat rice noodle with Broccoli and Collard Greens in garlic gravy.  They made this with a very strange twist - the noodles were crispy and the sauce was watery.  Maybe this is the fusion part.  I was expecting the normal soft wide rice noodles with thick sauce and didn't particularly enjoy this variation.  Also, I didn't see any collard greens.

Spicy Catfish $14 - Deep fried crispy catfish with red curry paste in coconut milk, topped with a touch of crispy basil leave.  My favorite dish of the night and it was delicious.

There were plenty of food, which we took home as leftovers.  I was particularly touched that even though we only had a tablespoonful of rice left, they had packed us more rice to go with our leftovers.

This place is wonderful and I'm grateful it's close as well! We ordered the chicken pot stickers, they came fried with a sweet dipping sauce. Hubs ordered the cashew chicken, he said it was pretty good, average. I had the Pad Kheemao, it was advertised as spicy but I was fibbed to. I enjoyed the fatty flat noodles! Overall, we were pleased :-)
Super good food. Lovely live band on Friday. Reasonably priced. Nice atmosphere. Definitely will come back again when I'm in the area!

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

Finally, great Thai close to home! I have been dying for some great Thai food ever since I ate at Banana Leaf in Dallas and remembered just how great Thai food could be. (amazingly the owner there looked Thai, but had a thick Cajun accent)

Seriously, we eat Thai food a couple of times a month and have been making do with food that is just OK and creeping up in price. Many of these Thai places don't even serve much seafood... What's up with that?

Montri Thai has a full menu with all the right stuff. We started with the Avocado rolls and Chicken Satay... followed by Pad See Ew with Beef, Tofu Thai Fried Rice, Thai Orange Chicken and Panang Curry.
