Everything was delicious! The Panang Curry is a real treat and the Satay is the best that I've had in a long time (looking forward to trying the pork satay) I can't wait to get back there to try the whole red snapper and some of the other seafood dishes.

Now there is more to eat in Warrenville than just Two Brothers.

Good prices, a nice room, decent wine list, friendly service and great food... an awesome formula for success. Now if only they could work on their Cajun accents

Excellent service here. Most of my neighbors opt for carry out but the interior and dining room is exquisite. I order the Crab Rangoon often and it is much better than other Thai places I have been to. 

The pad Thai is very good here, along with many of their curry dishes.
Visiting family in the area, decided to use Yelp to determine where to go for dinner in Warrenville. Wow, could not have made a better decision. Food was great, as where the drinks. Great experience.

Shrimp Pad Thai = GOOD!  The portion I was served felt endless, and there were plenty of perfectly cooked shrimp.  I asked for "spicy," and my dish absolutely was spicy without blowing my head off.  But don't eat those little red chilies in the dish, because those will make your mouth hurt.  I mistook them for a dried fruit, but I have no idea why I assumed something so ridiculous, so my mouth suffered a little.

The avocado rolls were interesting.  I liked the creaminess of the avocado and the crunchiness of the roll.  But it kind of tasted like guacamole which threw off the whole Thai thing.  Our friends ordered the Angel Wings appetizer, which looked like a giant stuffed chicken leg and deep fried.  I didn't get to try it, but it looked delicious.

There's a good variety of Thai dishes on the menu aside from the predictable Pad Thai including red, yellow, and green curries, and quite frankly a lot of other things I cannot recall much less pronounce (Pad See Ew, Kung...tingtangwallawallabingbang...)

Montri Thai is located in a strip mall, alongside a laundromat and thrift store, so I expected a more divey, casual joint.  While Montri Thai is casual, the interior of the restaurant felt intimate and classy with the dark wood tables, booths, and white tablecloths.  The restaurant can definitely accomodate groups, but it was so quiet in here (aside from the Christmas music) that I felt like I had to keep my voice down.

Good Thai food especially if you are looking for something a bit more upscale than the divey take-out joints.
I have been here several times.  Very good!  Nice staff.  The widows in front can get really bright, so the curtain can become an issue when dining.

Just moving to this neighborhood, and my husband and I went to this restaurant after reading all these positive reviews. However, I was so disappointed with the food and service here. I ordered Tom yum and pad see Wei. Unlike all the Tom yum I tasted before, it is too sweet and not really spicy. My husband ordered Panang curry, and this is the only dish he eat every time when we go to a Thai restaurant, but it is too salty. I think I just order some common dishes that you can find almost in every Thai restaurant. But this time is the worst.

In our family we debate about the best Thai food in the area. We love Thai and it often. I honesty think that Montri has the best Thai in the area. At Montri Thai, we love the Grilled Spicy Beef as an appetizer. You can't go wrong with the Basil Fried Rice and the Spicy Chicken with Basil Leaves. The staff is always friendly and very attentive.

After moving back to the area from Providence RI (shout out to Apsara! Super yummy Asian place), I needed a new go-to.

Hands down, this is it. Whether it's break ups, work stress, or something else, their cocktails are excellent (both in liquor content and price) and their Rama Chicken makes everything temporarily better. The Rama Tofu isn't bad either. It's large enough that if you pick at your food and have a liquid dinner when stressed, the food still tastes good microwaved the next day.

It's true, hardly anybody dines in. Which makes it perfect to talk to the servers. My favorite is on maternity leave but I've since become Facebook friends with her. Yes, this place is that amazing.

Everyone else's reviews are true: great avocado rolls, good curry, good prices.

Came here for the first time because my coworker invited me for lunch since we both love thai food.  Although I was craving the panang curry bc of its great reviews, I got the curry fried rice. This came on their lunch special with soup and an egg roll, a great deal! 
The curry fried rice was delicious! Not much to it but it was full of flavor and a good amount of food for a lunch portion. Definitely will be coming here again to try all the other curry dishes.

I ordered chicken satay appetizzer and had the Bangkok duck. The portion sizes were very large. The Bangkok duck was a half a fried duck on a bed of fried rice. Even the appetizzer had large pieces of chicken.

Taste was pretty good. The duck was fried and some was hard to eat since the breading or whatnot was extremely tough. 

The prices are about average for dinner and not too expensive. I think my appetizzer was around $6 and my entree was around $18.

Service was fine with no issues.

Overall, a good place where I'd come back.
Good and tasty food at a reasonable price. Good for dinner and their staffs are nice too.

I went to Montri with a large group recently and the overall reviews from everyone were mixed.  What I know is, whatever food I tried was good so I'm going to give Montri the benefit of the doubt here.  Really the two major issues were that the service was really slow.  We waited a LONG time just to get our appetizers like avocado rolls and soup.  That was excessive, but again maybe the issue was the size of our group, 8 adults and 6 kids.  The other issue my friends complained about was the sweetness of the food.  Many entrees came out quite sweet, which wasn't ideal.

I tried a couple of things.  First off, the avocado rolls were great.  Almost like a Tex/Mex-Asian fusion thing going on.  Really nice.  On the other hand, the Tom Kha soup was... not what I expected.  Not that it was bad, but it just didn't taste like the Tom Kha soup I have almost everywhere else.  I'm all for unique flavors, but this just seemed like a whole different kind of soup.  Really, the soup was my only complaint.  The red curry was great and the Pad Kee Mao was good.  I think we could and should have upped the spice levels on everything we ordered.  Adding in the hot sauce provided the heat we needed.

I would recommend Montri.  I would come back and give them another shot in terms of the service assuming part of the issues were just due to our group size.  We'll hope for a better experience next time.

Very cool little place.  If you had any question about it - the service is TOP NOTCH!

We arrived hoping to finish dinner by the closing time we thought was 9 (actually 10) on a Friday.  The place wasn't too full, but the decor and setup is very clean and modern while still being comfy.  We took a bit of extra time to order since we wanted to scan the whole menu to see what they had to offer, and the waitress was extremely polite and not bugging us, but attentive none the less.

We ordered some Thai Tea that really stuck to your gums.  The very good flavor hung around in your mouth if you let it.  Then we decided on some Tom Kha Kai which came in a plenty large enough bowl to share (but not too large as to leave you groaning).  The flavor was very good but there was an interesting aspect - bell peppers.  It wasn't bad, but it was unfamiliar for the dish (as well as a couple of others).  Probably just something to get used to.

We also had the Pad See Eiw which was delicious, but the noodles may have been fried too much (unless they started with a different wide noodle than I'm used to) as they were a bit too hard to cut with a fork and or spoon.  We commented to the waiter and he said he would tell the chef and thanked us for our opinion.  The dish also had broccoli instead of collard greens, but the flavor was great either way.

The other dish we ordered was the spicy catfish.  It was a very good mixture of red curry and coconut milk with a spice that I thought I was going to need to spice up at first, but set in to the perfect cruise to spice town.

When the waiter went to wrap up our food he noticed that we did not have much rice and, without asking, packed a nice, full extra container for us to take.  Awesome!


I really liked the lounge-style oldies that were playing the whole time we were there (Beatles, Doors, Steely Dan, etc) and the waiter also noted that they will be featuring live jazz once a month (2nd Friday?) and possibly more often if it is popular.  Cool stuff!

I really like this place and every time I go here I say to myself why did I wait so long to come back.  To start I absolutely love the Duck Basil Salad with fresh Mango pieces and the sauce is phenomenal!!  Everything here is so fresh and I always leave here feeling like my taste buds were delighted and I really ate a good healthy meal.

I have tried so many things on this menu and I have never been disappointed and will be back soon.
Great value for a delicious meal. Service was very friendly & timely. Nice decor for a strip mall location. We'll be back!

Whenever we had guests in Warrenville and we wanted to take them to out to eat nearby, this was one of our go to places. Compared to the food quality of most other places in Warrenville this place is a godsend. Even if they were surrounded with better competition, their food is well made and reliably tastes good. I was always happy with what I ordered and greedily finished my leftovers at home.

I lived in Thailand for a while so I am a bit biased as to what good Thai food is. Montri Thai does it's best to bring Thai food to the states and it succeeds. Their curry in particular is fantastic. I also like how they have Jazz nights the first Friday of every month. It adds that extra cool factor that makes this place even better.

This was my first visit here and it was outstanding.  The service was very good the food was great.  I had the Vietnamese Rolls and they were great with the spicy peanut sauce.  I had the Tom Yum soup and it too was very good, not too spicy and not to boring.  For my main course the Pad Kee Mao and it was also over the top.
So knock your selves out..

I'm really confused about all the good reviews about this place. I have been to Thailand, know the food and even speak it. We ordered some very basic carry out and it was mediocre at best. The pad Thai was tasteless as was the fried rice. Real Thai food uses fish sauce. Especially in pad Thai and fried rice. I don't understand Thai restaurants owned by Thai people that have lousy food, especially to a culture where food is so important. This did not have that Thai flavor. Crab Rangoon (which isn't Thai but who cares) was ok. I normally get joy Yees but they are temporarily closed. I will not order from here again. If you're reading this and are Thai, the food is "juhd cheep-hai"! Which in Thai means bland as hell. Skip it

My husband and I got delivery from this place late on a Friday after moving in to our new house. The food was fantastic! The drive went to the wrong address, but everything still came very hot, which was great because we don't have a microwave yet :). The portions were much larger than I expected. We had a dish with wide flat rice noodles and they tasted like they were homemade, although I don't know for sure. Everything was delicious. I ordered kind of at random and was extremely pleased with everything. I am very happy to be living a quarter mile from this restaurant :)

When it comes to Thai food I am very picky about how it tastes, I have to tell you that Montri Thai is one of my favorite Americanized Thai restaurant. The food is great, the staffs are super friendly and their drinks are good. I'm from the city but every time I go visit my friends in Warrenville, I often stop by to grab some bites here.

Writing this review after trying other thai food places in Naperville. Montri Thai stands a class above local thai restaurants.

Been here for around 5 times now. We usually order PadKeeMao, Pad thai, Panang curry and the Basil Fried rice. They have a good sausy taste to the PadKee Mao, and the portions they serve are more than enough every time. 
The fried rice have a good flavor and taste.

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place out based on other yelp reviews. Ordered the avocado lovers roll as an appetizer which was pretty good.. Like a crispy spring roll filled with guac served with a dipping sauce.

For our entrees we had the panang curry with chicken and tofu and the green curry with chicken. Both were flavorful and delicious!! Some of the best I've had in the Chicagoland area. The green curry was creamy coconutty goodness with thinly sliced bamboo shoots, peas, and peppers. Both dishes also had just the right amount of heat to balance out the sweet and creamy. So so good. 

We were stuffed but had to try out the mango sticky rice for dessert since everything else we had ordered was so authentic and tasty. I'm glad we did because it didn't disappoint! Left happy and stuffed.

This place has very good Thai food. The red curry chicken was really delicious & perfect for a cold day! So smooth like a lobster bisque. My hubby had appetizers for dinner- the crispy crab rangoons w/ an excellent sauce- a must order! The chicken satay had large pieces of chicken & the spicy beef salad was super spicy & good. We are definitely coming back to try more things & enjoy jazz night on 1st Fridays. 

Update- We visited again for Jazz night. Our waitress was really nice & let us stay to listen to the band. No rushing you out which was great. We tried the shrimp cargot w/ green curry & coconut milk. It was delish! Also tried the spicy basil chicken could have been spicier, but it was good.

This review was intended for Reserve 22, Glen Ellyn, and posted here in error.

We visited Reserve 22, at Village Links, on a Fri nite in May '15. The place was already very busy at 7, not so much with golfers coming off the links, but with diners who made "22" their target for the evening. A loud boisterous crowd filled the dining room, the large bar, and most of the terrace. Video screens covered sports of the day.

Service was very attentive, and there was plenty of staff to handle the large crowd as well as keep problems down and service up.

"22" is not the usual clubhouse dining. A long list of craft and specialty beers, and wines, are offered. They do have typical soup/salad/sandwich menus, but also an interesting list of small plates and sides, from $3 to about $15. A limited list of plate dinners ran mostly below $20. We had chicken linguini w/artichokes and bistro steak w/truffle/parmigiana fries. The steak was no filet but was well prepared and nicely dressed with a savory, slightly tangy sauce. The fries were to die for! I devoured the whole mountain of them. The chicken pasta, a large serving, was very good and included several dried tomato slices. Sides are extra.

The noisy crowd diminished about 9PM and management went to great efforts to move the band, and pull out some tables, for those who stayed for the entertainment and dancing until 11.

While not gourmet dining (3*), and the noise is not our thing, prices are modest,  the food offerings are creative, the mood is up-beat, and service very attentive (management gets a 5*). A good value and fun place. Res. recommended.

We went to this restaurant after reading the positive review. But actually we didn't like it there. Ordered the Montri Starters platter, Tom Yum chicken soup and Pad Kee Mai. The platter was Good. Tom yum was good, but it was totally different from what I used to have. We didn't like the Pad Kee Mai, it had too much salty. I don't know if its just our bad luck. But we wont be going again.

I really like this Thai restaurant. The waitress was really nice, and cared to check that the spice level was perfect. The spice level was perfect. The ingredients are fresh and the food is delicious. I feel like driving there now and getting some crab rangoons and pad ke mao.
The lunch specials are a great deal and come with soup and an appetizer. The service is friendly and attentive. I'm not sure why this place isn't packed with customers at lunch.

Well since I've been looking to try a Thai place in my neighborhood, and this place was new with lots of positive reviews...I thought I'd give them a try.  
It started first with us walking in...and not be acknowledged. no sign saying to seat yourself, or wait to be seated. We had to go and find someone to ask.  
We placed our order and asked for 2 sodas.   We waited and waited. 15 minutes passed and the waitress never brought our drinks, or even stopped by. 20 minutes passes and nothing.   The restaurant wasn't even that busy. It seemed that almost everybody was waiting for food. Even people for carry out waited much longer than what seemed necessary.   After 30 minutes with no visit from the waitress, no comment that they might have been short-handed, or anything...we finally just walked out and left. Prior to walking out, I noticed a couple behind us almost walked out as well.  
If you have all night to wait for dinner...this might be the place for you.   The only positive thing worth mentioning is the place has a nice decor. If I could give zero stars for this place, I would, but they get one by default.

Delicious food, great service and lovely ambiance!
The Avocado Lovers Roll were just amazing and the Panang Curry was too good!
We went on Friday night and they had some live music too! It was bit loud maybe bcoz the place is small. 
But overall experience was good! Would recommend and definitely come back.

Its been 5 months, a few times a month, and can I say "I love montri!".  They are very consistent and so yummy.  Here's our Favorites:  seafood panang - yummy creamy red curry with seafood, cashew chicken -super delicious!  we also ALWAYS get the calamari and now I just tried the vegetable tempura -I liked it a lot.  Ive tried all the red curries and two months ago I got seafood the seafood panang, never trying anything else again - its a winner!  its always take-out for us.

This place was a pleasant surprise. Nestled off Rt. 59 in a strip mall, we walked past it going to the hardware store and decided to give it a try. My husband is gluten and dairy free, so I sold him on the rice noodles and peanut oil in Thai food.

We have been back twice and loved everything we have tried. I adore the mango lobster roll appetizers, which are spring rolls with a peanut sauce you can spoon on yourself. I've had the baby corn and peapod and trio delight entrees and they were both delicious. My partner had pad thai chicken and some kind of coconut curry with shrimp and pineapple that he raved about. The Jasmine iced tea is refreshing and light, too.

The banana dessert reminded me of overcooked oatmeal, but there is so much delicious food, I can skip dessert. :) I will definitely be going back often and we noticed they do a brisk carryout business, so we are looking forward to having a new carryout place that is on my way home from work.

There used to be another Thai restaurant (Ariya) in this space that was only so-so, and so when we got to this location (flying blind after reading the excellent reviews here at yelp), my friend insisted that we'd been there before, but I said no (I'd written no review for Montri, after all!) 
At any rate, we went in to dine. Yelp, I hate to be the dissenter but I fear that I must say that Montri is carrying on Ariya's mediocre tradition.

Why? Due to pretty much everything we ordered. For an appetizer we split the Blue Sea Crispy Rolls. For a dish that claimed to contain a combo of lobster, crab, shrimp, and scallop along with carrot, cabbage and bean threads, I have to say that the seafood was almost undetectable. The taste wasn't bad for what it was, but what it was was pretty much a deep-fried veggie roll. 

For our entrees he ordered the sweet almond beef and I got the mussaman curry with chicken. Mine came in a large ceramic cauldron, a heady broth of coconut milk bobbing with potatoes and chunks of pineapple; I fished around with the serving spoon to locate the chicken I'd ordered until we realized that it had been made with tofu. 

(Servers: this is what an ordering pad is for!! There is no shame in using one!!)

I snared the waitress before she got into the back, and she took it away and apparently they remade the whole dish, because my friend finished his whole meal before mine came back. It ended up being okay, but in the end I should have tried something else initially (had I known). 

His dish was alright but as he said, only serviceable. 

There were a number of interesting sounding dishes on the menu (nutty chicken, coco chicken) and a plethora of seafood dishes (including the hilariously named (Hotty Seafood), but after this experience I'll return to the safety of Le Siam further south on 59.

I was a fan of Ariya because of it's freshness and service. Montri has yet to dissapoint. I do go at lunch a lot and the 5 star dish is wonderful. I recently went back and tried the spicy basil chicken- WOW. Excellent job! The starter egg drop soup was much different than expected and was delicious.
I really appreciate a restaurant that makes things fresh and care about what they serve. Montri is small and quaint and makes it's food a nice presentation which I appreciate, and you can taste the freshness. Try it, you'll like it. 
If you support restaurants like this less and less cookie cutter chain restaurants will appear!

After hearing the glowing reviews on this place coupled with the fact that I have found no good thai in the western suburbs, I decided to roll the dice. Called in a pick-up order and was bringing food back to some friends who own a nearby business. Upon arriving, I liked the interior and the people were friendly, but when I got the food back, I was shocked to see what was being portrayed as thai food. Got a few noodle dishes and a bunch of apps. NONE was good and none was remotely close to authentic. One step up from food court sweet and sour chicken at the mall really. Ask for spicy, and you get a 1/2 cup of red pepper flakes thrown in at the end type of crap - and the crazy thing is that people like this junk. Needness to say, I'm still looking for the elusive (and even edible) suburban thai food.

I'm usually skeptical of good thai food out in the suburbs as I have a city kid bias but this place was excellent! 

The menu selection was extensive (not just your typical pad thai etc.)

The mango lobster roll appetizers were great but keep in mind they are spring rolls.  For some reason I was anticipating something more like an egg roll but that was my own fault for not reading the description well enough.  

The food had good flavor and the ingredients tasted fresh.

Restaurant itself is clean and decorated nicely.

I finally tried a different Thai place for the very first time! (I normally go to Tusk Thai in Batavia) So I work in Warrenville and came across this place online when searching for a nearby Thai restaurant. I stuck to what I know best which is why I ordered Thai fried rice with chicken. The chicken was very flavorful and delicious! Definitely exceeded my expectations! Now the rice on the other hand didn't. I'm not sure what ingredient they used too much of but the taste reminded me a lot of the $1 Michelina's boxed frozen fried rice which I do not like. Price for my order was about $10 and it was a good size portion if only I had liked the flavor more. I just admit I was a tad bit disappointed that it was not as good as my favorite Thai restaurant.

HOW you guys can even give FIVE stars ? This is a Thai restaurant and all Thai flavor sucks. I decided to give a shot because of the reviews but I was so mad with every single dish. It is the worst Thai restaurant ever. They can even cook a simple curry normally! Even the Tom yum soap! Do you think people don't know Thai food! You can buy the Thai curry from a Asian supermarket it is way much better than this! When I walked into the restaurant I'm glad  because the waitress are Thai people but when I eat I got so confused. WHAT THE HL is dat! I have been Thailand and I eat a lot Thai food in U.S. But this is so bad can you Thai guys try yourself? HOW you can sell this and it is not cheap. At least you guys should give some real Thai rice because it is famous and normal in Thai food; HOWEVER! The rice is so sticky and slagging I'm sure it is the same rice like super cheap Asian fast food rice. Well, anyone who give 5 stars I hope you guys enjoy. Im would be glad my review could help someone or maybe just one person who gonna try this restaurant. If you think I'm wrong go Assi market or Amazone to get the can curry, drop some beef, bell pepper, and coco milk, then try their curry . You will see.

Have gone twice in the last two weeks and both times the food was great.  I would defiantly recommend and 
 be back again.

Awesome dinner tonight.  Our first time at this place. We had shrimp cargot (a must try),  spring roll, avocado lovers roll (another must try), pot stickers, pad thai woonsen, pad lard na.  Everthing was very fresh and delicious.  We also heard that they have live jazz performance first Friday each Month.  We will be going back to check that out.

The lobster and shrimp dish is fabulous!
Soft shell crab app is perfect!
Service was perfect!
Cocktails were tasty!
We will be regulars.

Excellent restaurant! Love their pot stickers, pad Thai and Panang curry. Everything was delicious! Great service too! I highly recommend it.  I would love to try their lunch to get a variety but I have my favorites so I tend to order the same things...

Truly some of the best Thai food in the area. Unassuming location but don't let that fool you. They do not skimp on the flavor. Try the Panang Curry it's the best around. Good lunch specials also. Can't go wrong here.
Wow this place has the best chicken pot stickers and Thier red curry is awesome even tho it had apply yes apples surprised twas still gud.

Good service, nice environment. The food was okay, but not as good as I had hoped for. Never experienced chunks of pineapple in a Massaman curry before!?

You could do worse for Thai in the area.

Who would have thought you would find awesome Thai in a strip mall in Warrenville?  I have never had a bad item here.  The Pad Thai is the best I've had and comes with generous chunks of chicken, beef, or tofu.  The pot stickers and steamed shumai are a great way to start a meal there. They have an awesome weekday lunch special where you get an entree, an appetizer, and a soup for less than $10. The decor is lacking and somewhat dated and the liquor selection is nothing to write home about, but you come here for the awesome food first.

Love this place! Tried for the first time on a recommendation from a friend and we were blown away at the flavors and quality of the food. We will be back....don't let the fact it is in a strip mall dissuade you. It was absolutely wonderful!

So, we just got takeout from them tonight.
I'm still impressed. I do think next time we'll dine in. Tastes much better without the car ride. Nothing beats hot out of the kitchen crab rangoons.

We had the avocado rolls again. I think that is my favorite thing here!
The rangoons were good again.

I tried the chicken satay, and it was good, but again, not my thing. Just the flavoring of it wasn't to my liking. But it's good. Again, I hope this makes sense. Just because I didn't like it doesn't mean you won't. All I could taste was the marinade, not the chicken. not how I like it. It was heavily flavored. There's the word I want. the peanut sauce that goes with was pretty tasty.

Hubby had the tom kha. He was happy with it. And now he has satay for lunch. 

Our order was ready in a timely manner. And it tasted good. :) I'm a happy customer. And I'm full.

And I have more avocado rolls and rangoon for tomorrow!

I was looking forward to the food here due to all the reviews, but was disappointed. The food is just okay, nothing special. Soups were too sweet, pad thai and fried rice were just okay too, won't come back.

Fantastic soup. The egg roll and ginger chicken were phenomenal with plenty 'o fresh ginger.  Relaxing and quiet for a nice break from your day.  Very funny Asian Madonna music adds to the feel in some quirky way.  7.95 lunch special well worth it.

Went there with a group had great experience food was great the best Thai food in Naperville area server gr8 pleasant 
Will go back again

Best Thai food I've found around the suburbs.  I have not been disappointed in a dish yet!  I recommend the Thai fried rice, any basil dish, Coco Chicken, Avocado rolls, Egg rolls, Spring Rolls, and their dipping sauces are delicious!  Only iffy dish we've come across was the dry duck my boyfriend once ordered.  I would give it a try again though, might have been an off night.

The food was good and the price for the lunch special is unbeatable. 7.99 gets you a small cup of soup, 2 small spring rolls, and a plate of your choice for the main meal.  I chose the pad kai sei (not sure how to properly spell it).  I asked for it to be spicy and it came out about a 5 on an American scale (prolly a 1 on the Thai scale).  It was very good, my only complaint would be that it was on the cold side. There were a few parts of the plate where it was room temperature.  That is why I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5.
Solid lunch spot.  I really enjoyed my food off the lunch menu both times I have eaten here.  Prices are affordable and service is friendly.  I recommend!

We found our new Thai favorite, which used to be Le Siam but this is a better value (by using restaurant.com), is closer to our house and still very tasty.  Had chicken satay, chicken pot sticker, fried tofu, chicken panang curry, beef soup, shrimp fried rice, garlic chicken. The chicken satay was more chicken than usual Thai places...I loved it had more meat but my wife thought Le Siams was tastier. The garlic chicken and shrimp fried rice were very tasty as well. My daughter loved the pot stickers because they were a little crispy on the bottom and the meat was still tender in the middle.  The beef soup was just ok to us but one thing that impressed me was they actually had a lot of beef in it that wasn't fatty.  Finally the panang curry was very tasty as well.  Hopefully our next visit is consistently good!

So far this is the best Thai restaurant... I live in Indiana and haven't find any good Thai restaurant there... Their chicken Satay and VIETNAMESE shrimp spring rolls are really delicious .... If you are a seafood lover try their sea bass, it's the best...

Great Avocado lovers spring rolls!  My wife had  Ginger Chicken which she loved and I had the Five Star chicken which was delicious and loaded with chicken and veggies. The sauce was very tasty on both entrees.
The service was very friendly and helped us within a couple minutes after we sat down. The interior is very clean and the booth was cozy for us.  We will definitely go back!
The Angel Wings were very excellent.. I would get it again. The employees were very nice.

I was blown away by how delicious everything was! We had avocado spring rolls, the shrimp appetizer, Thai Time and the curried catfish. It was very inexpensive for both  the quality of the dish and the atmosphere. The waitress was friendly and helpful.

You need to eat their avocado egg rolls. Every day.

Great thai restaurant.  Just wish it was a little closer to home.  I have enjoyed their Pad thai, 5 star chicken, and shrimp, egg rolls, and garlic chicken.  All of the entrees were tasty.
Will return for sure.

My favorite restaurant in Warrenville! Fantastic food that is made with fresh ingredients that always seems to be cooked just right. Not a huge ambiance place, but it helps make for affordable food that is high quality. Staff and service is down home, natural, authentic, and high-touch! I've sent many neighbors here.

One of the most friendly people I have ever met!! You walk in, are greeted, your name is remembered, even the next time you come in she still knows your name (I don't know how, I wish I had this superpower because it makes people smile), and the food is filling for right after a workout. I already ordered by the time I saw their seasonal protein smoothie advertisement: pumpkin (I will never stop loving you - until the last piece of pumpkin pie on Thanksgiving reaches my stomach), but I'll have to give that a try next time I come in. They also do meal plans if you want healthy, protein packed food delivered to your home, and pickup if you're on the way back from a workout and your muscles don't want to wait to repair.

Date of my visit: 17-September-2016
Time of my visit: Early dinner

This was my first time at Muscle Maker Grill...  I should note, I did not realize that it was a chain until after I started writing this review.  However, I will make an exception, because of the uniqueness of the chain (it's mostly located on the east coast NY/NJ area).

Off to the experience, I paced my order for pickup.  It was easy to place it, however, we wanted Warrior Nachos, but sadly they were out of chips/nachos.  I ordered Premier Burger and my girlfriend ordered Penne Romano.  When I arrived the order was ready.  I liked that!

I was a bit surprised by the portions, I guess being too long in this country, I got used to large portions.  The portion was probably right size.  My total was $17 and change, which was a bit pricey, even for this area.

Off to our food.  I could not speak to my girlfriend's food as she only let me try a little bit, but I would say, I was a bit disappointed...  The side I chose was cucumber salad.  The salad was decent, it was well seasoned.  The burger was interesting...  It seemed that the topics and the cheese over powered the taste of the meat.  The bun was good.

I would give this place a C-.  For the price I was expecting more value for the price.  Service was very good!  I would like to come back and try Warrior Nachos.

I'm currently doing a high protein/low carb weight loss plan, and am getting sick of cooking for myself all the time. I was excited when I found this place offering tons of high protein/low carb options, plus nutrition information that's posted online. I ended up being pretty disappointed with my meal... I ordered the turkey taco salad, no cheese, and sour cream on the side. The turkey was broken up so fine it was almost like a meat sauce on top of lettuce, and it was lukewarm. The salsa that came on it was like jar salsa. It tasted like there was a lot of sodium in it too (and verified by their online nutrition facts). It was far from wow-ing me, that's for sure. There are healthier, more flavorful ways to punch up ground turkey to make it fantastic, and sadly, I was wishing for my own cooking as I ate this. I was only able to eat half, and the rest will be in the trash shortly. My guy got their chicken entree dinner- a grilled chicken breast, potato and steamed broccoli. Everything came out piping hot, but we never saw a piece of chicken go on their grill. He said even though the potato was steaming the entire time, it didn't taste hot, which was strange. He suspected some microwave action in play.

The only saving grace was the staff who made sure we had a clean table to sit at, fresh cups for water, and checked on us once while eating. This place has potential, but we were far from impressed and won't be back.

I was on a really long bike ride and saw this place while passing. I stopped in to grab something light and ended up getting a cheeseburger salad and a chocolate 16 ounce protein shake. Overall, I love the concept since I eat basically a modified paleo. They have a lot of healthy choices for most diets your on. Looking at the menu I didn't see too many organic options or gluten free however I understand a lot of the foods are inherently gluten free. Great concept, okay price point, pretty good flavor profile.

I stumbled upon a menu for this place at UFC Gym in Lombard.  Since I work in Wheaton, I thought this might be a good place to grab a healthy lunch from.  Yes, I was right.  My first visit here was after a boxing class at the gym, I just wanted a protein shake...they have em! They taste great and are of decent size for the cost, and most importantly, convenient.  
The night I stopped in to pick up a shake, the woman asked me if I wanted food to go along with it, and I said no, because that was big enough for a meal, plus I watch my carb intake.  She pointed out their low carb options which brought me back here last week for lunch. I called ahead for the "Texas" one of their low carb solutions.  It was just perfect (and filling) for lunch.  It was still hot when I brought it back from work, plus the container is great for food prepping at home.  

This place is also a heaven sent as I'm currently participating in a weight loss challenge at my gym.  I will continue to stop in at this place.  All of their nutrition information is posted online... all healthy stuff!!!!

This place caters, they deliver, they have take out and have meal plans...how cool is that?!?!  They need to open more of these, because every suburb should have one!

For my 200th review ('bout damn time, eh?!), I've decided to tie into my quest to hit 200. Of the pounds persuasion.

You see, I've always carried around a bit of extra weight since late childhood, but I have taken steps to combat that, to get rid of bad eating habits, and to stay physically active. And so Muscle Maker Grill helps make Review 200, and it helps me in my quest for 200, because they offer well-portioned and well-PROportioned meals. You want high protein/low-carb? Balanced lean protein, veggie, and starch? Veggie options? It's all there. You can tell certain food items come pre-cooked, or pre-prepared in some fashion. But the price is right, and at the end of the day, someone else is doing all the food prep for you! Most meals can be split into two sensibly sized portions. Eat half now, save the rest for later.

If you're reeeeeeally not into the whole cooking/meal prep thing, they also offer meal plans that run about $7 per meal, with no weekly commitment whatsoever. I also get a 10% discount thanks to my association with the Cardinal Fitness in Glen Ellyn. With mostly healthy, and mostly guilt-free options, there's a little room to feel like you're cheating, but also plenty to make sure you stay true to your nutritional goals. The quest for 200 (and beyond) continues!

We are really happy to have this place in our town.  Everything we have had here has been great, but there are a few standouts:  Their soups, the Turkey Taco Salad, Tuscon Chicken, Sante Fe Wrap and their Premium Burger.  The place is always spotlessly clean and everyone we have encountered here is friendly and knowledgeable about their offerings.  

This is our go-to place if we don't feel like cooking during the week and want something healthier, guilt-free, but tasty!

I have only eaten here a few times but have been very pleased with the food every time.  Love having a place you can go for a healthy, reasonably priced meal.  They have seemed somewhat unorganized behind the counter.  I called ahead once because I didn't have time to wait and when I got there they hadn't even started making my meal yet.  Good food - need to work on customer service.

First the positives: I will come back, albeit with a discerning eye. They have a nice selection that is healthier than 95% of the other offerings around town.  I had a chicken breast that was served over steamed broccoli, what a treat instead of fries.  Lots of different choices, good food, hot, cooked fresh. 
On the flip side, I have had the chicken breast sandwich and it was pretty small, about the same size bun as a Mcdonalds regular burger, and the smallest chicken breast I have seen. I think it was $9, and that came with a side. Was a little underwhelmed.
I had the godfather last time, which the menu lists as Griled chicken and Portabella mushrooms. Since I love the earthy taste of portabellas, I tried it.  Well, the vast majority of mushrooms on my dish were regular button mushrooms.  The person at the counter said they mix up both kinds.  So why doesn't it say Portabella and Button mushrooms?  If I saw an offering that said "Kobe beef burger", I would expect 100% Kobe beef, not a mixture of 90% ground chuck, and 10% Kobe, right? I felt like I was a little mislead, and that makes me wonder what else is "mixed" on the menu.
We order from them at least once a week. Great food & service couldn't be better!!!! Love it!!!

I just went in here for the first time today after work. They were very helpful and explained everything that I had questions about. They weren't crazy busy either when I walked in. I also ordered a five day meal plan worth of food to take home. All four of my meals including the one I ate there totaled in $35 not including tax. I have been wanting to come here for awhile since I know others that already do. There food is simple, portioned and good. I am excited to try the other four meals I have in the fridge. You don't have to do the meal plans but it does save you time and money. The regular portions are a bit bigger and cost alittle more. I will go back and weeks I can.

Fresh and healthy - and well portioned.   The Rocky Balboa has been my goto thus far.  So glad I found this place.   By the name I thought it was like a GNC vitamin place or something - so glad I finally went in.

Have not signed up for their plans - but if one is looking for pre-made stuff - tasty healthy and a pretty good value - you could get all your meals for a week (or at least lunch to bring to work everyday) for only $7 per meal.

Placed an online order on Sunday at 4:00pm. Never delivered my food. Problem they charged my card... $30.15. I understand it's mamoral day weekend. A sometimes businesses close early but fix your website so it doesn't charge people during non business hours. It's an inconvenience to the customer. I'm out 30.15 and no dinner. Very disappointing...

My boyfriend and I REALLY wanted to like this place. We've been talking about going for months and we finally found ourselves nearby so we decided to go for a late lunch. Upon entering, there was a weird, bad grill smell- strike 1. The place was completely empty- strike 2. We ordered the Texas Chicken Nuggets, Rocky Balboa Wrap, and Arizona. Our food came out 2 minutes after we ordered it- strike 3!!!! I thought it was going to be great that it was empty, they'd have plenty of time to cook our food, but no....they clearly took pre-cooked food and microwaved it. Every part of me did NOT want to eat this chicken and turkey bacon... And alas, I had an excuse not to- there was a hair or fuzz in it. My boyfriend said the Texas Chicken Nuggets tasted like "canned chicken". 
Overall, I'd rather go across the street to the grocery store and buy ANYTHING else than eat here again. I'm sorry, we really wanted to like you Muscle Maker Grill, but you sadly disappointed us.

Hot, fresh, non-processed and guilt-free food that tastes great!  My friends and I really, really liked this place.  The food tasted great, which I wasn't expecting because I thought it was going to be bland health food. I was totally wrong!  This place is great!  

What I learned is that most of their food is made fresh, not frozen.  That's one of the things that makes it such a healthy option.  

First thing I noticed is our food arrived to our table steaming hot!  Sweet!  I ordered the El Mexicana from their entree menu.  It had seasoned chicken, black beans, rice, bell peppers, cheese, and salsa.  Mmmm!  It was more than I could eat.  I took some home.  They have these really cute take-home containers that are microwavable, dishwasher safe, and reusable!  I'm totally saving this for future uses.  

One of my friends ordered the Rocky Balboa wrap.  The Rocky Balboa had a blend of chicken and meatballs with mozzarella cheese and a tasty sauce.  I was lucky to get a taste before my friend ate it all.  After one taste, I knew why he ate it so fast.  It was SO good!!  I think I'll order that next time.  The wrap came with a side dish.  My friend chose the spicy chunks of potato and loved them too!  

My other friend ordered the grass-fed beef burger and had a side of the greenest, brightest, most flavorful broccoli she had ever seen or tasted.  I don't know what their secret is, but this was beautiful broccoli!  The burger was incredible, so tender and juicy!

We will DEFINITELY be back!  Looking at their menu, Muscle Maker Grill delivers and also offers meal plans. That's cool.   There are lots of options to explore at this place.  They will certainly see us again.

Wasn't sure about what to expect here, but what a suprise. I had the burger, it was cooked to my liking and had a great sauce. I really enjoyed it, along with the side of cold pasta salad. 
A friend had a chicken and broccoli dish, the broccoli was very green and fresh and had a wonderful balsamic vinegar sauce. 
The steak wrap had a great deal of steak and the side of spicy potatoes hit the spot for another friend. 
Being a cheese burger and fries kind of gal, I was totally suprised and impressed by the food I was served. I don't live close to this restaurant, but when I'm in the area I will make it a point to eat here.

was double charged for delivery because im further than 4miles away even though it is not indicated on menu i was at the hampton inn off north ave 
in carol stream and only had a menu to go by so not fare to say the least
It says heathy but what they mean is smaller portions and worst of all ot was cold!

I've ordered delivery and take out from here. Everything's been delicious! My favorites have to be the nachos and burger Cesar salad. Also they go above and beyond to make sure your order is just right! If this place was down the street from me I'd be in trouble. Lol
First time here and it was delicious! I ordered the MMG wrap with steak! It came out hot and fresh! And the cucumber salad is very good too!  Can't wait to come back and try something else!

Love their food! The Santa Fe Wrap was amazing and you can never go wrong with the Mexicana. The portions are just right, especially if you are not trying to over eat like most places serve you! Definite must try!!

Excellent! I eat very clean 6 days a week. I eat whatever the heck I want on the other day. This place is everything I enjoy for my meals 6 days a week. Met Erica the owner she was very cordial and inviting. I had the European wrap?( chicken and spinach ) Fantastic to say the least! I put some hot sauce on that bad boy and enjoyed it immensely. Going thru the menu it looks extremely clean and I will be frequenting this place in the future many times over........

Had the godfather and the steamed broccoli, spinach, and cucumber salad. Everything was delicious. Juicy chicken breast grilled to perfection and surrounded by portobello mushrooms! Must try! Make sure to call them and confirm they received  your order if you place it through yelp. My order took a while to transmit to their system but they had it prepared in about 10 min!

This place is FANTASTIC! My boyfriend and I saw this place a few times but never stopped because we weren't hungry and finally made a point to go to it the other day.. We were so satisfied! We came here before rock climbing at verticle endeavors and it was the best "full" feeling without feeling over stuffed. It was great knowing we had a low carb, high protein meal to satisfy our hunger. The whole menu is geared towards helping every diet or fitness program possible. They have the carb heavy for the bulkers, salads, lean protein, low carb meals for the cutters, protein shakes, vegetarian meals, and snacks. We loved everything about this place and the food was delicious. My boyfriend had the Godfather "guiltless entr√©e" it came with TWO chicken breast on a bed of broccoli and some portobello mushrooms and peppers. I tried some.. And wanted more. I had the TeX Mex fajita wrap and a cucumber salad both were the bomb. Considering going there again this week the place was so good. And prices are comparable to a chipotle so not overly priced and def eating healthier than you would be anywhere else. Its a must try!!

First time here was very pleasant. The staff was helpful and friendly. They guided me through the many menu options and on their recommendation I tried the Arizona. The portion was generous and the quality was outstanding. I got full before I cleaned my plate which was a pleasant surprise. I will add it to my favorites list the next time I am in G.E.

Friggin love this place. The Godfather and the Rocky Balboa are awesome meals. Protein shakes are ok (too watery for my taste) but the smoothies are great. Tons of protein, hardly any carbs or calories and it tastes great. Lil expensive but it's worth it if you need good food on the fly.

I have gone here a few times and had unique healthy dinners. I like the Italiano salad. It's nice seeing the gluten free options (even in their salad dressings), the calorie counts, and their staff has always personalized our experiences. In order to have healthy options we need to support places like this!

I placed an order online for pick up and it was ready as promised when I arrived.  I ordered the European Wrap with the cucumber salad.  The wrap was SO YUMMY!!! It was piping hot and juicy!   Not knowing what to expect, I ordered a side of fat-free sour cream in case it was dry or not very flavorful.  I didn't even notice that I hadn't used the sour cream until I had three bites of the wrap left.  The cucumber salad was ok - I'm not a fan of onions but the cucumbers and dressing/sauce were good.  It didn't taste like "Health food"  just good food!
I will definitely be back for this wrap and to try other meals as well!  : )

As soon as I saw that the title was muscle maker grill I knew I was in for a treat. I tried the grass fed beef burger and I have to say I was really impressed with the quality of the burger it was amazing, flavor wise it was amazing. Well worth the money I spent. will definitely return.

We're very pleased to have a healthy option for delivery in the area that is also good food that we enjoy at a reasonable price. We've had the burger, steak fajitas, teriyaki chicken, vodka penne and bbq nuggets.  They are all good, but the burger and fajitas are better. All in all a great option for the family.

The smoothie (berry) I had was delicious. Wish I had gotten a larger size. Being a burger fiend, I of course ordered the burger with a Caesar salad for my side. The salad was pretty good. As to the burger I wasn't impressed. I know it's healthy but the texture just seemed really off. More mushy than most.

Overall I'd definitely go back and try something different.

WOW!!!

I just spotted this place in my neighborhood and thought how cool it was to have a healthy food restaurant in Glen Ellyn.  I just tried the Godfather and my tastebuds are having a party.  The Western Potatoes were a delicious surprise.  I expected deep fried, but NO!  Potatoes are cooked in a mildly spicy sauce.  It melts in your mouth.  Go to this restaurant for great food at a reasonable price.  Yum.

Been here twice since moving to town and it has a real family atmosphere. The staff (I would guess owners) make an effort to connect with every customer. The food is excellent and doesn't kill your diet. I want to try everything!  Will be back soon!
Perfect place to grab a quick and healthy meal!

10-31-15, After writing my previous review about this Hooters, I received an email message from the store manager. She explained that they still carry bottled craft beer, but the menus were not available. So I re-visited the store again and sure enough they now have new beer menus. That being said, they still don't have the well rounded selection they once had. But they have bottles craft beer nonetheless. 

My recommendation to management of this store is to get the whole menu reprinting thing done before you dispose of the existing menus. And, educate your servers through the transition from old menus to new menus. 

My 3 star review is based on their new selection of bottled craft beer only.

Saddest nachos I have ever witnessed in my entire life. Is this a joke? Who would ever think sending nachos out of the kitchen this way would be acceptable. Never again.

 Buffalo chicken sandwich, really good with good quality chicken. 

Boneless Wings were okay. 

Curly Fries were absolutely awful.

And to top it off... I was told someone would contact me and they never did. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE. REVIEW JUST DROPPED TO A 1, 0 ISN'T AN OPTION.

Very clean restaurant,  very good service. As a service industry employee myself, our table was a bit needy and our server handled it with a smile and never got impatient even when I think she had a right too haha. All of our food came out hot and exactly what we ordered. Draft beer was ice cold.  Typical Hooters, my experience was 100% satisfaction.  

GOOD Eats: Buffalo shrimp,  Daytona wings, steamed shrimp and clams.

Well I tried to hold off on this review for a while, but I guess it's well deserved. I'm currently writing this message while I'm on hold with them. I went here once, I'm guessing on shift change. The waitress served our drinks than didn't return for a whole twenty minutes to let us know a new waitress will be taking care of us because her shift is done. Another time i asked for water and it tasted horribly, I let her know she told me she can't do anything about it. That's how Joliet water taste, I asked her if there was any other kind of water and that I would pay. She said no, I will be attaching a screen shot to show that I been on hold this long just to place an order. I get they get busy but at this point I feel forgotten. I will not be placing an order even if they answer before I'm done, this place is a joke and the ppl that work here apparently don't care.
Horrible experience. The supervisor Jeff is an arrogant tool. Terrible lack of customer service skills.

So disappointed. I have been coming to this hooters since they opened the doors. I love hooters.

My sister & I decided to go for an early dinner on Sunday March 20th to enjoy our girl time, we chose on hooters because it's something we both thoroughly enjoy & have done it every couple months, religiously might I add. This was literally the worst service I have received at this location.

They messed up our food order. Which took 40mins to come out. Mind you, it was not busy. They brought two cheeses when I asked for ranches & never brought our fries.. which whatever, it was fine. Mix ups happen. I understand because I used to work in a restaurant. I was also given a dirty look when I asked for extra lemons for my water, for the second time in 20mins. So I corrected our served almost immediately about the mix up. & yet, she still tried to charge me for the fries we didn't receive & the cheese we very obviously didn't use or touch. When I corrected her a second time, she had the audacity to go back to the cook to check if I had fries on my plate. 

That right there should just tell you how much of a service she really was..

Im annoyed & extremely disappointed. GET IT TOGETHER!

Service is slow and very poor. I had to keep asking for refills. I was given no utensils. Crab legs came with orange slices (????) Wing badder doesn't taste like traditional Hooters wings. So many young girls employed with no customer service skills. Took forever to get the check. Don't waste your calories or money here.
Stopped in ordered 10 wings to pick up.  They were only moderately busy but my wings took 20 minutes and they shorted me 2 of the 10. First time I've had terrible service at any hooters.

We come here for the wings and they (typically) never disappoint.  These were a tad on the dry side however, definitely could have used more sauce.  We asked for extra sauce and I was disappointed to learn I was charged for that when the bill came around.  You didn't put enough on so now I have to pay extra for something you failed to do?  As well as the ranch dressing and celery.  I mean, c'mon.  These are the things that typically are included with wings.  I'm surprised I wasn't charged for my ice water.  Seriously though.  What makes ranch dressing so special?  There's ketchup on the table.  I don't see a charge for that.  

I've also noticed the prices have increased as well.  Now paying nearly $1 per wing.  At least they're decently sized, but it's getting to the point where our hooters visits will be seldom if any.  $50 for two people for wings and beer is ridiculous.

If I could give 0 stars I would. I am a frequent customer here and today I went there and had the worst service I have ever had in my life. We waited over ten minutes to be greeted at our table while our waitress talked with other employees and ignored us.The waitress was ditsy and I had to repeat my order to her multiple times even tho she wrote it down. She could tell we were frustrated with her and went on to talk about us to other employees right I front of our faces.  We then had employees staring at us while we are our food.  My girlfriends food was over cooked and she didn't even eat it.  No service was provided after we got our food.  The waitress name was lexxy.  If u ever get her I suggest getting another waitress.  Avoid this restaurant as much as you can.  If you have a taste for hooters spend the extra gas and drive to another one.

Stopped for a quick bite after a movie. Apparently the don't like seating single business men from out if town. After waiting 5-10 minutes just to get on the seating list, and having multiple hostesses come and go, I left and went down the street. After they helped a family that came in after me. I've never seen so many kids at a Hooters in my life. Must have been kids night.

Wings were delicious!  Lotsa tots were ok... Little too soggy for me.  Clam chowder was passable.  Waitress forgot the buffalo shrimp but recovered quickly.  Check took a log time to get.  Solid three star meal all around.

Shrimp was horrible and  usually it's my  favorite food.  I'm very disappointed because I don't come here often but when I do I expect nicely breaded hot shrimp and instead I received basically unbreaded cocktail shrimp soaking in hot sauce with salsa.  Yes, salsa because that is what you should serve with hot breaded shrimp?!?! Thank goodness the cold cold beer only took 10 minutes.

Service is quick, girls are sweet, and food is proper. I haven't had a personalized experience yet as I usually am picking up to go but I am sure everything will be great. Only small issue I had was ordering ranch and celery and not getting it. I paid and then when I got the food checked and it was nowhere to be found. They then charged me for it even though it wasn't my fault. Kind of annoying but very minor hiccup.

This hooters I would give an okay rating.  It is hit or miss for service.  I've had great visits and not so great visits.  Overall a solid B. 

Edit:  Went back last night for dinner and had awesome service from Nikki.  Fast, polite and friendly.  Moving them to 4 stars.

The carryout sucks here.  When I dine in at the bar, my experience is usually good, totally opposite from when I carryout.

Carryout has seriously disappointed me on two separate occasions.  The first disappointment I ordered wings for the first NFL game of the season.  I timed it so I could be back home with the wings for kickoff.  Unfortunate for me, Hooters jacked up the entire order.  Instead of having my order ready when I got there, Hooters had to start a new one while I stood there and waited.  By the time I got home with my wings, the game was in the second quarter. 

The second carryout disappointment came this past Friday, December 12th.  When I arrived to pick up my order, they couldn't find it. Why?  Because they put it under the wrong name, ("Pink" instead of "Kate") which took the manager forever to find.  I ordered fries and ten wings.  The fries were hard and cold; the wings were dried out and overcooked.  I live only 10 minutes from Hooters.  Food does NOT get that cold that quickly. Nothing was edible. I totally wasted my money and was so irritated!!  Hooters left a bad taste in my mouth, pun intended.

Our first ever hooters experience:
We absolutely loved this bar/restaurant! Didn't know what to expect and especially my wife was a bit worried about going here  but it was all good fun. The waitress we had was really cool and the food was pretty good! My wife even bought a shirt here, that was a big surprise to me!
As always - TMI wings (order the wings naked, with the sauce on the side) & some nice cold beer hit's the spot....

Manager should consider hiring competent front door hostesses that can count to four! Hostess sat 3 other groups that arrived after we did whose parties were the same size or smaller than ours. We insisted multiple times and she continued to disregard us. Will not return to Hooters Joliet! Off to Hooters Aurora! Learn to count!!!
The avacado slices are not avacado slices. They're like some kind of jello flavored avacado.

I take back everything I said before.  Hooters has plummeted as a place to eat in the last few years.  I ordered a steak sandwich, fries, and a coke.  the cost? almost $19.  This is a $10 meal at best!  

with so many other places to eat near by... skip this one.

Have gone there three times and tried to get what was owed to me from the GM. The second time we finally got what was owed, actually part of it. We were supposed to get a half off for the order and 2 pitchers, we got the discount, but still had to pay for the one pitcher we got. The GM said my name and what we were supposed to get was to be in their book or in the office and the manager at the time after searching several times said no. He reluctantly called the GM at home and she said the half off. Apparently she even forgot about the pitchers. We thought after that visit, the service and speed would pick up. Boy we were wrong, I don't know why everyone in our group wants to go back. Our waitress this time, Alexis was good at taking our orders, but when it came to taking care of extra needs like silverware, hand wipes, and extra sauce it was horrible. Never saw silverware and had to ask for the hand wipes. Refills were far and few, one person in our group had iced tea and when he asked for a refill, they didn't have any more and had to get a diet Pepsi instead. Wouldn't you think if the place is still open that they would still have tea available. Usually around 11:20 or so, you can see the girls cleaning up and straightening up tables for the next day. I get it was busy earlier with the Blackhawks game on and some other sporting events, but come on you are open til midnight. Our waitress, was not very attentive and when one at our table asked for blue cheese dressing, it took a good 10 minutes. The refills took about as long. I don't get how two buffalo chicken sandwiches, a philly cheese steak sandwich and an order of wings all with tots or onion rings can take 30-40 minutes. Flagging down a manager to ask him won't do any good, since you can't rush frying chicken. 
I ordered no cheese on my sandwich and it had cheese, I didn't want to risk the food going back only not to receive a sandwich back. The onion rings that came with the food were nothing more than frozen onion rings you can get at a grocery store and I got maybe 8 rings. When you order tots or fries, the plate is loaded with them. 
It would take a lot to get my business back and I will encourage everyone in my group to go to TGI Fridays nearby. We are loyal customers who are tired of getting the raw end of crap service.
Thanks Leah for hearing out and getting back to me! Truly appreciate it :)

This is my second time at this location. The fried pickles came out hot and were delicious. All of the food we ordered came out smoking hot but it took forever for it to come out. We didn't mind that much since the food was good and it was hot. Our waitress was really nice and was on top of everything. Much better than the Orland park location in my opinion. The sweet Thai chili sauce for the wings was amazing, it was my first time trying it. I'm definitely coming back here again.

Very clean establishment fast and friendly service they are starting to catch on to craft beer and are generally a good place to catch a decent lunch and dinner management seems to have it together and so do the staff I would recommend this hooters to anybody best one I've ever been too girls are decent looking too! The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because it's just a chill spot and not a blow your mind place it's pretty reasonably priced too I would recommend it to anyone trying to unwind or a nice family lunch way classier than tk.

I had a $25.00 gift card burning a hole in my pocket and nothing better to do.
I am not a big Hooters fan but I tried to be fair here; the biggest issue I had in this Hooters was the parking, it is just off the mall loop drive but it is really confusing trying to find the parking lot

I was promptly greeted at the door and I took a seat at the bar (good so far). I ordered a long island and Chicken quesadilla. The waitress didn't know how to make the Long Island (really) and the manager was no help, the staff seemed happier running around being rambunctious than being productive. That being said the long Island was below par the quesadilla was pretty good. I had to flag down the manager to get my bill I dropped the gift card and walked out. if I return it will not be on my own ambition.

I like Hooters.  Perhaps once a year I get a craving for regular wings and curly fries from here.  This is the closest location to me, which is in a far outlot of Louis Joliet Mall, and can be a bit tricky to get to via the mall parking lot.
     We came in for a late lunch on a Wednesday afternoon, and were one of the six or so occupied tables.  Although music was playing, the atmosphere was quite subdued for a bar/grill type of place.  Our server was prompt and well-endowed (Duh!) but very listless.  Not that I expected rah-rah fanfare, but at least crack a smile now and then.  I then noticed that the entire staff had that same robotic, nearly catatonic sort of vibe going on.  Maybe everyone was just winding down and chilling after dealing with the lunch rush.  Who knows.  
     I had my normal order of regular wings and curly fries.  The fries were great (even better when dipped in ranch!) but the wings left something to be desired.  I know they are tossed in a butter sauce, but these things weren't merely tossed; they were bathed in the stuff.  So much that I had to wipe down each wing before eating.
     I don't know, but it kind of killed as opposed to satiated my craving for Hooters.

Called and placed an order for pick up around 12:20pm, was told that it would be done in 15 minutes, it took me roughly 20 minutes to get there, I went and they couldn't find my order in the system,  they finally found my order in the system and it wasn't done yet. I sat down and waited, after two more customers orders were ready, the customers came in, paid for and left with their orders. After another 5 minutes or so went by the bartender asked what I ordered and what sauce I had. I ended up waiting a total of 30 minutes actually in the restaurant, not including my drive to the restaurant.  Finally my food ended up being completes where I than had to wait on my ranch and my cheese for my fries.  After I recieved my food I was never apologized to for the wait or inconvenience.  If I would of got an apology I would of never sent in such a negative review.
Forgot my wings,  terrible service ....watched my kids eat.  This Hooters is the worst I've ever been too!!!!!!!

The wings were great, but they gave me traditional instead of boneless as per request. Plenty of new sauces to choose from rather than my typical local Hooters, due to being a franchise. The service was great and I chose to go there twice last week. The downside was that they did not offer all you can eat which Wednesday is known for, and especially on National Chicken Day (which I went for)!
as always; never disappointed though I think the newer location I wrote about last is def my fav!
My chicken wings were cold. Like ice cold. Beer tasted kinda funky. At least I got to hangout with my friends. It was about the only positive.

I normally go to the orland park location, but found myself in the joliet area with the wife and decided to stop in. The place was really quiet and the service was excellent (even though the waitress screwed up our choice of wing sauce, she quickly noticed it on her own and fixed it while apologizing). We ordered the fried pickles and the Mozilla sticks and both were hot and crispy and tasted better than any other time i have had them. Will definitely be coming back here  as opposed to the Orland Park location.

3 stars for service. 2 for food. I have eaten at hooters in multiple cities. There is good hooters food..and bad. The only thing that makes it different is cooking it properly. My fries were old and cold...my buffalo shrimp were soggy. I'll give this place one more chance and update my review then
I used to love eating at Hooters! The last few times I've ate here the boneless wings seem undercooked and watery. I don't know what the deal is. The food here has plummeted the last few years.

I LOVE this Hooters, I Love the staff and the food.... Been going here for years and have never had one bad experience! Great Management and cooking staff, servers and Bartenders. Will go to this hooters as long as it stands!

Yes, you can be a girl and go to Hooters.  I'm living proof.  I love their Sangria and the original wings.  Nice sized wings, unlike the other Hooters in Orland.  Joliet is much better.  
The waitstaff are all really nice and don't bat an eye at a table of girls out for an evening instead of a bunch of guys watching the game and oogle-ing (is that a word?) at all the waitresses.  Sitting directly at the bar gives you a whole different experience; you can watch the poor guys in the kitchen run around like crazy folks getting those orders together.  It's amazing to watch them co-ordinate the tickets to get the food out at once.  

Only 4 stars because having to walk through groups of smokers all standing right outside the door (even though there's laws against that) is horrible.  COUGH COUGH!!  Gross.  Hold your breath, run in, and grab a pitcher of sangria.

After the waitress took our order and brought us our drinks she literally forgot about us and our food. We saw the manager yell at her and she came running. By then our appetizer had been sitting out for at least 20 mins and was served cold with our wings. The wings were HORRIBLE. The mediums wings had no sauce or flavor on them and the hot wasn't hot at all. And then there was a piece of shrimp tail fried up in chicken. The cold mexicurly fries were made worse by the fact that they are made with cheese that tastes like bland melted velveeta. The food was terrible in general. Literally, my stomach hurts. Then after our food was given to us, the waitress did not check on us once. Didn't ask the food was, nothing. We watched her run around servicing other tables, but not ours. We had to flag her down just to get the check. We usually tip very well. I mean VERY well, but not this time. Disappointed in the service I left a two dollar tip. I hadn't been to Hooters in 4 years, and today I remembered why. They could have had a new regular customer, but instead missed out on that opportunity.  Every time I hear someone bring up Hooters now I'm going to tell them about how poorly we were treated. Did I mention we were veterans? Yeah. I honestly think we were given the shaft because we were there on Veterans Day & got a discount on our meal.

The staff is great & friendly; however, i was there last night & my TMI wings were not that hot (cold actually) and I'm not too happy that the prices have gone up.  $33 dollars for 10 drums TMI, 2 ranch, 1 fries, 1 tater tots, a kids meal & 2 Pepsi's is too expensive.

Ordered the boneless wings,we're cold and dry also ordered a draft beer was flat drank half asked the server for another fresher beer the manager came by 10 minutes later and scolded me for not bringing it to his attention sooner and that they have a policy if you drink half of the beer they don't replace it. I was very insulted to be spoken to that way, I told the manager that I never asked for anything "free" and that I wanted to pay for my beer. This manager was very rude, my date and I spent 50 dollars at this dump. Plus my girlfriend ordered a second Pepsi and the server forgot it, we had to ask her twice, this place wasn't even that busy! We got an 8 piece of traditional to go that was the best part of the visit, the traditional wings are excellent. I will never go back or recommend this place, not pleasant!
Love me some Philly cheese steak!!

I agree with the other reviewers.  Food is the same, no matter which Hooters you go to.   I also agree that the waitresses are too busy socializing with each other instead of getting their customers (ME) their free refills.   Sooo annoying...just because you think you look good in those shorts doesn't mean I don't want another coke.  Geez
Best service in town, friendly staff and what can I say you just can't beat their wings.
What can I say its a fun place.  The food is better than most chain places, and well so are the servers.  Try the buffalo chicken sandwich.
Nothing better than chicken and beer and football..

OK... So I don't go to these places, but it was right next to the hotel and I wanted to have wings and watch the Blackhawks annihilate some teams. The food is decent, but the waitstaff is very friendly. I don't mean that in a dirty way, but they really were nice ladies. They chatted me up even after they were cut for the evening. I've found myself going back in order to have some company on my business trips out here.
Love hooters hate this hooters! Wings are very greasy. And you may want to bring your own drinks if your not drinking beer. The water tastes like a sewer so does the ice.
The girls at the Joliet Hooters are soooo attentive to the union workers! Make sure and wear your Local 150 gear to get the extra "special" attention....

If you're going to call yourself a "Latin" or "Mexican"  restaurant, the first thing I will judge you on will be the chips. Not a good first impression here, sorry. The chips were thick, heavy and a little greasy. The guacamole was good, but was such a vivid green that it looked fake. 

My dinner was some steak special - Also disappointing. It was thick, dry and chewy. Tough to cut it because of the light weight fork that kept bending while I sawed away with my flimsy knife. 

I'd like to come back here. Maybe I will, if someone can tell me that they have improved.

Food is great, place looks great. Been there 3xs. It attracts an older generation and that's cool but it's rarely a lively crowd. Tried a Fri and Sat night. Takes too long for drinks to be served so we tried beer. STILL too long a wait. Hostess goes from nice to weird and over bearing. When we ask for doubles, waitress says"you know all their gonna do is give you the same amount and poor more ice". Order jager bombs "We're out". Order one of their signature drinks " those take too long to make because we are out of our premix". The place was barely 1/4 occupied.
Mentioned this to the manager, He makes excuses and accuses us of lying even after his waitress confirmed the story. Told my husband to please lower his voice. My husband says"I'm sorry I'm hard of hearing" Manager/owner says "Well I'm not". 
Just rude, poor customer service skills. Wanted to see this place succeed but the place is never full and now I see why.

This restaurant has a great vibe! It feels young, fresh, and hip. However, the food needs improvement and the wait staff is a bit slow to service. I had burnt empanadas and pork enchiladas with sauce that was way too sweet. However, the margarita was one of the best I've ever had. 

I'm pulling for these guys and hope the food gets better. P.s. Where were the free chips and salsa?

Ordered: 312 urban wheat ale, enchiladas en salsa verde, chips and salsa.

Review: beer is good with this food. Salsa is spicy with a little hot bite. Chips are good..taste a little darker like wheat though it may be the wheat beer influencing the palate. Portions were decent. The atmosphere is nice. Stop in on a Sunday and look for the specials. Demir is an attentive server but I think he is the bartender. Enjoyed it!

I don't care what we order, it's always beyond delicious and beyond our expectations. The flavors are truly unique! Many restaurants use salt to flavor their dishes, Rubi uses spices. We visit here a few times a month, it's our go to place for Latin food. 
Demir is an awesome waiter, who always welcomes us and does an incredible job of making us feel welcome. Keep up the good work! You will see us soon!

Five of us had lunch their today and we all agreed we would spread the word and return.
The food was great as was the service, our only complaint would be that the noise level is a bit much.
I would much rather eat there than a traditional mexican restaurant and the prices are very reasonable.
Great place. Ask Demir for suggestions!!  The jalapeno Margarita was great!!!  Also try the banana boat. Will definitely return .

This used to be a very good restaurant, and a good value. After my most recent visit on 8/27/2016 that opinion has changed. My wife and I usually stop in and split their quesadilla dinner. It used to be a very substantial meal, more than enough for the two of us. Not so anymore. The portion is half as big, yet somehow at the same price. When it arrived, we inquired about the change we were very casually told that the owner had made some changes. According to the waiter, this is often done rather arbitrarily. Either way, we ending up paying $30 for a meal that would barely feed a single person. This place has gone from nice to far over priced. There are other places that offer a far better value that I will be taking my business to in the future.

Good place for the area I guess. No free chips and salsa which I thought was a state law or something for Mexican restaurants. Portions are small but the food is good. They are going to need to do some promotions to keep people coming back. Nice televisions inside.

Went in for a late lunch on a Sunday. Great time, we were practically the only ones there. Service was great and timely. Drinks were fab (cucumber margarita and the puna) and really complimented the food. The food was piping hot and fresh. The coconut shrimp weren't the best I've had but the raspberry sauce definitely evaluated the flavor. My super picky brother loved the empanadas. My entree was the Puerto Rican lasagna was heavenly. We'll Def be back.

We went here after a movie because we wanted to try it out and because we had 15% off coupon. 
We ordered empanadas and drinks. The empanadas were horrible and over cooked.
