After getting bill we were told we weren't getting the discount because you needed to buy an entree , but nowhere on the coupon is that stated.
Don't waste your time or money here. 
The only good thing was the waitress. She was courteous and did her job well .
If I could give it less than one star I would. 
One more thing front glass is broken and if a strong wind hit it , it would hurt someone.

The food is good -- if you can actually get any.  The server was pleasant and hardworking, but the kitchen is another matter altogether.

Our party of ten made a reservation for 7:00 on a Saturday night.  The owner said that our large group would overwhelm the kitchen at that hour if we ordered all at once.  So we changed our time to the less-busy 6:30, and we ordered a little here and a little there.  We didn't need to eat all at the same time, so that wasn't an issue. 
     
Chips and salsa took over an hour to arrive.  And the rest of the food came out at odd intervals, with no apparent rhyme or reason; dishes did not arrive in the order in which they had been ordered. 
    
We had to wait unbelievably long times for the rest of our food: two members of our party waited TWO TO THREE HOURS -- yes, you read that correctly -- for their meals (one a quesadilla, the other a flatbread of some sort).  The quesadilla was ordered at 7:15 and still hadn't come as of 10:20.  And this after repeatedly asking the server!  Unreal and totally unacceptable.
   
The rest of us waited anywhere from 30 to 90 minutes for our meals, still far too long.

If you have all night to hang out, with no place to go, then stop in here.  But if you have fewer than four or five hours to spend here, or if you are hungry, do yourself a huge favor and go elsewhere.

I stopped by to get carry out, we have kids so this was the only way to try this place. The hostess told me they don't do carry out until after 9 because of the dinner rush. It was 6:30 and the place was half full, I had my hopes set on having a whiskey while I waited for the food. I ended up at Taco Bell. Unfortunately, this place is too cool for us.

I used to like this place, but not anymore. The service has gone down hill, they over work the staff and bartenders which leads to slow service and a long wait for drinks. The menu is short of options. If you've been there more than five times you will run out of things to try. The last time my wife and I were there the new manager was obviously drunk and unapologetic about the slow service, also the male owner walks around the place and gives customers dirty looks and glares for some reason, i feel like its hard to relax and enjoy myself because I'm constantly being watched. ONE MORE THING! They refused service to my wifes friend the last time she tried to eat there because she gave them a bad review! This will probabaly get my banned from rub agave, but honestly I don't plan on going back!

My date and I went here around 8p on a Sunday night. The venue was fairly empty. There was a family that was leaving as we arrived and a few individuals sitting at the bar. 

Needless to say, I don't think they place can be classified as an authentic Mexican restaurant. There are plenty of Puerto Rican infused items in the menu. The appetizer for example was a goat cheese and meat stuffed plantain with a savory salad and rue on top. I wish I could re-call the name. 

Date and I ordered the exact same meal, but were told there was only one. So I compromised since there was the skirt-steak chefs special on the menu. As a rule of thumb, I never order skirt steak. Is a poor cut and chewey. However, not far from edible. I can't say that I enjoyed my dish, much more of a personal preference than anything. The skirt steak wasn't worth all the chew. 

The original meal I wanted to order was absolutely delicious. It was like an oso bucco stew and you're given a heaping amount of rice. After trying my dates, I definitely lost the appetite for my main dish. 

I took off one star for them running out of a main dish on their menu. And I took off a second star (this may seem trivial, but it's all about balance) for only having super ginormous booths. I was swimming in the booth.

Not sure what the other complaints were about, we must have came on a good night! Loved the food! We had the mini jibaritos, which reminded me almost of tostadas, but way better and way more flavorful. We also had chicken tacos and guac and chips. Tacos were also good, and the guac was perfect. You can tell it's made fresh with the chunks of avocado on there. 

My passion fruit mojito was my favorite drink that I ordered, it was delicious.

We also played the one game on one of the big TV screens called "Fibbage" which was a lot of fun, especially when others in the bar joined in. Music was goood, and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. Our bartender, Demir, was great and always checking up on us and made us feel welcome.

We will definitely return!

This is used to be my favorite place around my town until  tonight. The manager was really drunk  and the owner was really mean tonight. I asked him for some latin music, and he was really  mean and never played latin music during all night.  I loved that place because of the bartender Emir,  but after tonight the bad treaof these people gave to us, i can  tell me and my husband  will  never come back.

Good vibe! Just what Homer Glen needs-- a place that isnt your run of the mill, canned  suburban restaurant. We had great Spanish tapas, good mimosas, and then noticed a Hookah bar. Pretty edgy for Homer! Great Latin music/videos. We will go back.

Such a HUGE disappointment! Went there to celebrate a family event with 7 people. They REFUSED to put the tables that were right next to each other together. We planned on spending the evening there for dinner & drinks. The drinks we did order we had to order twice took over a half hour to get & they weren't even that crowded. The place looks cool but the customer service was absolutely the worst we've experienced!
Delicious and creative food offerings, great atmosphere and very friendly and helpful staff.  Our entire party enjoyed their experience.
Place is always empty, and drinks overprice!

Went there tonight for dinner- I was not expecting much...But I have to write that this was the absolute BEST tasting Latin inspired food that I have EVER had.  It was delicious, absolutely phenomenal!  I started with a margarita- it was PERFECT.  Not too sweet, and the tequila was smooth.  For dinner, I had the chicken soft tacos.  I can't even explain how delicious the chicken was, let alone the rice that came with it as a side.  My husband ordered the Pollo con Mole Poblano- another chicken entree.  It was amazing; we are still trying to figure out how they got their chicken to be so tender.  The food there is quite tasty and I gladly give this restaurant 5 stars and I will become a regular patron.  Oh- one last remark...the staff is very willing to help its patrons.  I did have my small daughter with us- although they do not really have a kid's menu, they really worked with us to prepare her something she would like.  Needless to say, she loved her meal, too.  Good food, great staff.  What more could I ask for??

I waited almost an hour and twenty minutes for my food order.  When I called to complain I was accused of skipping out on my bill.  Nothing further from the truth.  I signaled over to the bartender and she looked at me.  Instead of waiting another half hour I placed my money underneath the folder...$40.  When I complained about the food I paid so much for and it didn't fit the description which drew me into the establishment I was contacted and falsely accused.  Intact I found someone's belongings on a chair behind me and placed it on top of the bar.  If anyone was to be accused it would be the servers.  The restaurant had my information and why would I skip out on a bill???  I think it was sour grapes after my constant complaining.  I did not notice much food coming from the kitchen or pick ups being made.  All attention was for drinks from the bar.  Perhaps I will go back, definitely not for the food but others seemed to enjoy the drinks.

Very tasty. Do not go expecting "Mexican restaurant" food. This is a South American/ Brazilian restaurant. The cocktails are yummy, the home made salsa is delicious, and the entrees are very tasty. Service was fantastic. We will be back.

Wish I could give this place a 0. It's horrible every time I've gone there. Service sucks..was just there last night and asked for a jack and Coke and waited 15 min For it and started asking what's taking so long to my friends and they pointed the waitress out sitting at a table on her phone just texting...so I finally went up the bar and got it and she gave me my check...she added the drink she never gave me...smh..have fun with all the nickels and pennies we gave you as a tip you deserved it champ.
Waited 20 mins for chips.  Waitress blamed everyone else.    No communication.  Walked out.....never got the chips

After sitting at the bar drinking overpriced drinks we ordered. Chips and salsa - that they charge $4.00 for. They give you a great big basket of chips and when you run out of the tiny bowl of salsa they give you you are S.O.L. buy another $4.00 salsa. Really? There are plenty of other places to go that has better service and food. I give this place a few more months to be open. Sianara
Great food and service!!! I'm not sure what the other people experienced but our service and food were nothing short of great!!!! I will definitely be back!!

I would give this place a 3.5.  The drinks were great but the food was just average.  We had a group of four that sat at the bar on a Saturday evening and the bartender was very responsive. He made a great margarita ($7.50) and amaretto pi√±a colada ($9).  I wasn't impressed with the caribbean pork tacos and ceviche.
Don't waste your time...Rude, Slow, Ripoff is just the beginning. . Don't worry it will be a Dennys in No Time...

Apparently if you make a negative comment about this place expect to be blacklisted. I went into the bar not even 20 minutes and was denied service due to a negative post on their Facebook commenting about their music. I really enjoyed coming to this place but if the management cant handle criticism then ill take my business elsewhere. If i could give negative stars i would.
I definitely love this place! They have a cute little outdoor patio. The food was amazing! Had the coconut shrimp... Yum!!! Went during happy hour! Great time!

Had a great time here tonight with friends. I had the skirt steak special and it was perfect. My lovely wife had the short rib stew and she loved it. Good salsa and guacamole. The live salsa band was also a nice touch. Beautifully decorated too. I highly recommend this place for great Latin food.

Do not go to this restaurant unless you are just eating and not having drinks.  I ordered an old fashioned drink.  When I got the bill they charged 10.00 per drink!  That would not be that bad if we were downtown chicago or if the drink was even worth it, but the drink was extremely small , almost all ice and oranges.  I complained about the first drink, when he made me another one it was better  but they charged me additional money for an"upgraded drink".  Are you kidding me?!

I had three very small drinks.  21.00 plus $9.00 upgrade.   Wow!
The bartender should have gotten a manager when I questioned the bill, instead he just said "yep that's what we charge" 

Food was good.   We will never go back to this place.  Our bill was 76.00.  We had a Mexican pizza, another dish that cost 11.00. The rest were our drinks. My husband was only drinking beer.  Don't go unless you have extra money to throw away.

Veryy disappointed.  Service was terrible.   Go down the street to pepes
If you want Mexican food and drinks.

This is an interesting spot where you can pretend you are on vacation. They are a sports bar, nightclub and restaurant in one. They had live Latin music til 9, then a DJ, all while the hawks played on the big screen. The service was SLOW! The food was reasonably priced and delicious. The drinks were hit or miss. Didn't like the Puna, loved the mojito and the pi√±a Colada. I also loved the octopus and the banana boat for apps. The "metal box" is a def must try. Delicious meats!

Food was excellent, service was very good, and drinks were outstanding! I highly recommend the Pomegranate Maragarita, although the Jalape√±o Maragarita was also tasty just a little spicy and very potent! Hostess came by quite often to make sure we were happy.  Needless to say, we had a great time!

It's nice to have a restaurant with authentic Mexican ambiance in Homer Glen.  They have totally redecorated since the establishment was known as Cool River. Ruben has added booths, tables and a lively menu to make the Rubi Agave more of a restaurant than a bar. However the bar scene is still alive and well on weekends and late into the night. 
      The food was good but came to table lukewarm. Service below average and that is kind. It was jammed the night we were there but still a little attention to the customer is warranted. 
      Margaritas are yummy and the pi√±a colada is to die for. But you would have to have a few cocktails to get u through the looooong wait for food. Music is nice and I hear there are live bands on weekends and other occasions. Ole!!!
    I think we would try here again but on a week day when not so busy. Need more help obviously.

Totally love the food, quesadilla and tamale are so good. 
This place has such a different twist to Mexican food. 
Really good, you have to try it!!!

Went to celebrate Cinco de Mayo with 6 of my closest friends. The service was slow to say the least. Appetizers took forever. Drinks you might have well brought your own. In defense of the server the restaurant was way under staffed our server was actually making his own drinks. Two of the 7 meals came out 20 minutes after the others and they offered us 20% off just the 2 meals. Now to the check. Charged for 12 margaritas  when we only ordered 7. Had a coupon that the server did not want to honor. Waited 15 minutes for the owner/manager to come to our table. When he finally arrived he agreed to take the  coupon. Upon leaving I stayed behind to speak with the owner he was very rude and dismissive.  So moral of this rant is I will never go to Rubi Agave again and I recommend that you do the same!

Over a year ago I gave a great ***** review. Chef Reuben, you MUST be hemorrhaging money. Your food is good & original. You need management at the front of your house.  Train your staff.  Fire your ponytailed bartender. Your own family is going to kill your business. 

Since my original review my wife & I have been back at least 1/2 dozen times. This was the 2nd time we actually walked out and we won't ever come back.  The service was so bad this time it outweighed the unique cuisine. 

Rule number one in the restaurant business is don't bring out a humongous bussing cart when there's people walking through the restaurant. The busboy ran right into my wife's chair and nearly knocked her over, he looked at her, and just moved on. No excuse me, no apology.

The waitress came to our table bringing only two waters for three people. She said she would be right back with another water and we never saw the water come until 30 min later.  We immediately ordered two empanadas appetizers and two whiskey Manhattans straight up.  The waitress asks us what type of glass we wanted. I told her it normally served in a martini glass.  She returned to the table with short rocks glasses, warm, and they were half full.  I had to explain to her what a martini glass was and she said that the bartender told her this is the way HE does it.  Now I've been drinking Manhattan's for over 20 years. I've never had it served in a short rocks glass. It wasn't iced or shaken.  I asked the waitress to bring me a martini glass and poured my drink into it.  I showed her that it was only about one third filled and on top of that after taking a small sip, it definitely was not a Manhattan made with proper ingredients or proportions & since there was no ice, I thought it strange my regular drink lacked flavor. I would hope it wasn't watered down but I'm suspicious. Basically it was only 1 ounce of warm booze (I know how much a short rocks glass holds).  She apologized and said she would speak with the bartender.

She came back only after I had to take my empanadas appetizer from the table next to us (it had been carelessly dropped on the wrong table by the food runner without comment) and the people at the table were kind enough to ask if that was our order.  When she returned she told me again the bartender told her that this is the way HE makes a Manhattan.  I told her this is completely wrong and definitely the wrong proportion after I showed her how much was in the martini glass. 

At that point the hostess  saw we were getting aggravated and came over to talk to us.  I asked her to have Ruben come out and speak with us regarding the service. After a quick run to the kitchen she said he was cooking and didn't have time to come out and talk.  I told her that will be here a while and if we if he has two minutes to come out to talk please do so. He was probably the only person back there so we never did see him.

A few minutes later the bartender, a young kid with a long ponytail (I believe he's Ruben's cousin), came over to see what the problem was.  I explained to him that after working 10 years in the restaurant business including professionally bartending, I've never seen a Manhattan made this way.  I even told him what the correct proportions were. His response was "I used to bartend in New York and I know how to make a Manhattan". I explained to him you can go online and see what the proper proportions are and take a look at any picture of a Manhattan in a martini glass and it does not look one third filled!  Again his response was "well that's how I make them."  I said to him that if that is the way he bartended in New York, no wonder he's not working there anymore.  I kindly asked him to take the drinks away since he decided that he knows best.

Now I have had that kid wait on us before as a server, and he was horrible and unattentive. Why they would have him behind the bar when he clearly does not know how to bartend is beyond me.

At this point for over a half hour had passed and the waitress had still not taken our food order. She apologized for the behavior of the bartender, sort of shrugged it off and took our order.  After another 10 minutes & mulling over the whole situation we decided to just pay for the empanadas & leave. 
I left my name and phone number for Chef Ruben to call me as I really want to see him succeed. The place is nice, well decorated, and has awesome food.  The issue is he has his family working behind the bar & serving. These were certainly not professionally trained waiters waitresses & bartenders. In fact, they're going to kill his business.  The food is consistently good & the service is consistently the worst I've ever experienced. 

Chef Ruben, you really need to do something about the front of the house. You lost at least a $100 tab from us. Family or not, you need to fire the staff, hire a professional bartender as well as someone who has the ability to train your servers. A manager up there is a MUST!

This place is a little bit bar little bit restaurant and a little bit music venue.
The place was decorated nice and had a great Latin vibe. 
The drinks were fantastic and I really enjoyed the bartender helpful friendly.
The food was excellent we had the guacamole it's was delicious and the salsa was very good as well.
My wife have the tacos and I had the big sampler and it didn't disappoint.
They also had a nice outdoor patio area.
I would give it give stars but we were there on a night that didn't have live entertainment. I could see a bigger crowd and a live band pushing my experience to a 5 star 
I would highly recommend this place

If I had to say something positive about this place, it'd be that it's virtually impossible to get a DUI driving home from there. This could be due to the low alcohol content of the cocktails, the 45 minutes it took for them to arrive at the table or both. Add another hour to get how long we waited for our appetizers - which we ordered at the same time as our drinks - to be ready. Is the kitchen cooking with Bic lighters or something? Why should it take that long to melt cheese? The service was so lousy, it seemed intentional. A few members of our party actually got up and left rather than deal with the BS. Judging from some of the other Yelp reviews I've read, our experience was not unique. Unless something changes, I can't see Rubi Agave remaining open much longer.
This place is really cozy and the food is really good.  The empanadas were big and very delicious.  The jiberitos were great.  Very flavorful and the house salsa yum!

Been here 35 mins a sever never came up to us yet . Not anyone this is crazy. The band is good that's why we're still here. An just to let u no as I am writhing and looking at my friend  pictures   Still no SERVICE
Great atmosphere, food, and drinks! We had a mojito and margarita that was made with fresh fruits. The guacamole is delicious as well as the dinner.

BEST salsa, guac, and tamales ever!!! GREAT service!! GREAT beer & Drink selection. If you're looking for a beer list you should get up and look a the tappers, ask your server or go back to pee pees (spelled correctly) hidden GEM!!!

I went with a group of friends on a Thursday night. Place was empty. Service was very slow.  When the bill came we noticed that they charge extra for everything.  It's an extra $8.00 for chicken in your chimichanga. And cheese is an $1.00 extra plus $2.00 for sour cream.  Seriously?  Won't be back.

John Taffer might say, This place does not know it's niche, is it a Night Club/Bar or a Restaurant. The food is designed for quick snacking when done on the dance floor not a place that you would sit down and really enjoy a meal. The menu is limited NO rice seasoned fries REALLY. The bar is loud with locals coming for drinks like it was in the previous BAR. Too Bad, I was hoping for Great Latin food not just another BAR with Poker Machines.
Tasty! I was hesitant because of the 2.5 stars but a friend recommended so we tried it. Good chips dip and gac. And the shrimp and chicken were very good. We'll be coming back!

Awful .  If I could provide negative stars I would.  We went there after dinner to celebrate our engagement with friends.  First off the service was awful and we were there for about 10 minutes with no server - this so called establishment was not busy (I now know why) so we went up to the bar and they told us we had to open a tab and they requested credit card.  We stayed for awhile and we enjoying ourselves and when it was time to leave, we paid the bill in CASH.  We received our credit card bill and Rubi Agave charged us again.  I'm still in shock that this establishment is in business since they stole $189 from us and I wouldn't be surprised if we were the first.

Ok .... So I left a review on Facebook already but Yelp is where it counts. First, I'm shocked that anyone thinks these drinks are strong ... Whatever you people are smoking please pass it here because I'm not a drinker (usually buzzed off a shot) and I finished a del mar that was so watered down it seemed pointless to even order. My husband had the margarita which he ended up returning because it was watered down and just plain nasty. 

We initially when in for the Brazilian dancers which were awesome but was ruined because we were sat all the way in the back when clearly there were tables open. 

 First, we waited and waited and waited some more 20 minutes in and we still didn't have drinks - not even offered water. We even put our order in at the start and waited another 20 mins after getting drinks. The best part is that we waited another 30 mins for our check after waiting and waiting - maybe this joint should be called Waiting Rubi! Our server was sweet but does not know the menu and was not on her game. 

The food was actually pretty good but not anything to rave about- there was not a lot of choices and for what you would pay there you would pay in the city for way better concoctions. 

My husband and I decided to confront the owner, which was really weird. There wasn't a sincere apology it was more of an excuse. Excuses that went on forever. First, it was an off night, the server was new, people called off, our food is made to order, it was packed.... Here's some advice - I don't care what the excuse is - you had entertainment come in - you should be on your a game knowing more people may be there for it... Packed? Again, what are you smoking? Packed would mean there are people lined up waiting - there were tons of tables and spaces at the bar open.... New server? More like bad training ... 
Here's the icing on the cake: we were pretty much forced to having a dessert shot on the house as a sorry excuse for a comp of any sort. I asked what was in it because it was interesting ... I got two ingredients ( milk and roasted coconut) listed and then "some other special things", really? You don't know what your shots are made of? Not surprised since everyone we asked questions to about drinks or food items had to take a moment ask over their head piece.... Not wise to not know what's in your food or drinks if you have someone ask because they have an allergy or restriction - lawsuit anyone? 

$65 later and 2.5 hours we finally were able to pick up and leave ... Unfortunately I was looking forward to coming here but it's nothing special ... It's a wannabe latin dance club with amped up Mexican food... Great entertainment but that will only hold you up for so long - best of luck to Rubi but I won't be back! 

If you're looking for real latin vibes head to Nacional, Carnival or Rios in the city - $65 will get you food, drunk and dancing all night :)

Great place to unwind, listen to music and eat some great food. They had a band that played Salsa music and after the band they had a DJ. We had some beers. They have Green Line on tap and tried some food. Empanadas, quesadilla and hand made guacamole. Everything was really good and hit the spot. The place was warm feeling and I kind of felt like I was on vacation. Servers were friendly and prices reasonable!

I am surprised this restaurant has more than one star. Extremely disappointed in the service and quality of food. I have worked in this industry and consider myself a good judge. This place needs to reevaluate their menu as the food is bland and tapas size portions in the selections we ordered. The service is the slowest and most uneducated I have ever encountered. I would strongly encourage the manager to retrain all staff in liquor selections and customer service. If you promote yourself as a tequila and whiskey bar your staff should be able to take a simple cocktail order. You make your money on your bar service and this is the slowest service I've ever had. And delivered incorrectly. If you hope to stay in business please spend some time retraining the right people to promote your business.

Went on a Sunday around 5pm. We were seated right away. My girl and I split the 3 meat plate with skirt steak, chicken and chorizo with plantation veggies. They give you tortillas and salsa so you can make a taco out of it. The meal was very good and seasoned  well. Tasted very good to us. We would go back again.

Found this place on restaurant dot com and decided to check it out. Didn't know what to expect but came in on a quiet Tuesday night. Cute place, bar atmosphere but fairly well lit and lots of very large tvs. Ordered a couple of the Ruben margaritas, one regular and one mango, both are on the rocks, no frozen drinks here. The mango one had nice hunks of mango too!

Very interesting menu, things I had never seen before. Ordered guacamole and chips, great fresh guacamole!! I had the quesadilla which was the size of a pizza! Very interesting and good!  Definitely coming back.

Great service, good food, definitely a thumbs up. Best part was when check came, not only did we use coupon, Margaritas are a special on Tuesdays!!!
Crap food, crap prices.  I would never go back there and probably won't be able to when they close in a few months.  Really disappointed in the food and the atmosphere

Such better decor and vibe than Cool River. I had both the mango and strawberry mojitos, which were amazing with fresh muddled fruit! Didn't get to try any of the food since we only stopped in for a drink, but I definitely would go back to try it. Staff was also very nice, we were greeted right away and not ignored. The patio is small but so pretty!

This restaurant has so much promise, but is seriously under staffed in the kitchen. Wait times just to get your food or appetizers were absolutely ridiculous this weekend. The last time we were there it was perfect, this time HORRIBLE service and not very apologetic for a 1 1/2+ hour wait time to get your food AFTER ordering it. Had I written this review after our first visit they would have gotten 4 stars, but the service this week was way beyond horrible.

I have gone back a few times, and while I am happy the snotty bartender is never there I am always greeted by really nice service, the food  has gone down. The menu is smaller. The awesome cheese dip is gone, lots of meats and fried foods have been added. I am sorry, I was so hoping this place would be a winner.

Went for the big hype on a Friday Brazilian dancer's night.  I arrived to a full parking lot but that's what's to be expected on a Friday themed night.  I found parking and headed in.  No one greeted me at the door.  I found my friends at the bar where upon my arrival they mentioned, good luck getting a drink - great.  Everyone on staff appeared to have at least two jobs.  The bartender was running food from the kitchen, taking orders and tending bar.  There was a guy in back who I can only assume is cooking is running dinner orders out.  The rest of the staff looked confused an disoriented and could not keep up with demand.  45 minutes after my arrival, I order my first drink.  20 minutes later while seated at the bar, it arrives.  The couple sitting next to me at the bar waited so long to pay their bill they eventually gave up and walked out without paying.  The bartender never noticed and the tab from the persons previously sitting in their seats was still sitting on the bar top.  My drink arrives, and the bar tender never asks for payment or for a card to run my tab.  Later in the night when it takes us 20 minutes to flag her down to pay she now tries to figure out who ordered what and who is paying and how.  She messes this up three times, coming back on several occasions for repeat instructions.  She approaches my friend to pay who has a tab open and my friend has to tell her she already has her card.  There was no system in place for getting seated at the tables since my friends had put our name in at 6:30 and by the time we left several hours later - were never seated or approached for a table.  I can't say enough bad things about the service and hopefully I never return.  It's a shame because it has the possibility of being a good place to go.

The drinks were very delicious and would be the only factor in my return.  Most likely I would never go back, however if I did it would be on a Wednesday night at 4 p.m.
The food is bomb. Daily drink specials.  Mojitos are so fresh. Service is slow most of the time but the staff is nice. Rating purely for the food and drinks

The menu is limited, and they were out of a lot things, which says something about their planning. The atmosphere is also stale and dry, not an exciting place at all. I would only visit this establishment if you wanted a quick drink and were near by, not worth the commute. Although the tamales were really good...

Let's start by saying Thank God for some authentic Mexican  food and margaritas in the southwest suburbs. I grew up on the south-side of chicago where there was a delicious Mexican restaurant every ten feet so I've eaten my share. The ambience is great. I love the warm paint on the walls and the stone bar not to forget the gorgeous patio. The new owners have worked wonders in this place. We started with the chips and salsa, this is not your average Pepes salsa this salsa has levels of flavor sweet, spicy, sweet and spicy again just enough to leave your mouth wanting more. From there we went to the tamale and taco duos. The tamales were mind blowing. The masa was not dry at all and awesomely sweet  the pork was seasoned perfectly and the whole thing garnished beautifully with a drizzle of crema. The tacos were solid seasoned and cooked perfectly next time I would try the steak. Even the little side salad was delicious dressed in something delicious I couldn't define. This is a must try and a gem in the burbs. I will be back,.

My review after visiting Rubi Agave for the first time. I really really wanted to like this place, I did. There are no other Mexican restaurants in the area besides Pepe's. 
My husband, daughter and I went, we had a taste for Mexican food so I thought go give Rubi Agave a try! The chips and salsa are VERY small in portion but NOT price. We were left chewing our finger nails because our tummies were hurting from hunger pains waiting for our food. Our dinner had finally arrived! 1 quasadilla 2 burritos and THATS it!!! No beans, no rice, no jalape√±os and carrots no refill on our chips!! Nothing else but the quasadilla and 2 burritos and 12 pieces of lettuce that was referred to as the spring salad that came complimentary with the overpriced burrito that lacked not only character but taste. I'm not used to this way of a traditional Mexican dinner/restaurant I mean come on who doesn't have carrots,jalape√±os or fricken rice! Our bill came I almost fell over and shit out what little bit of the food that I did eat out on the booth. Bill $64!! 
$64 for what??? Oh my jeez 
Well whatever we paid we learned a lesson we left NEVER will be back unless it's 1am and I'm drunk and it's the only place open.

I came here because they are starting to offer line dancing lessons on Thursday nights.  It is definitely a nice place and has a fun atmosphere. I had their chicken tacos, which came with cilantro and onion, and they were perfect.  I'm looking forward to going back for the country night Thursdays!

Stopped in for the first time after driving by many times. My husband and I sat on the patio and had great service. Both the food and drinks were amazing! We are already planning our next trip back as there were a number of appetizers and entrees we want to try!

This place did a 180 from when it was cool River. Not only is the food awesome the staff is incredible. I suggest the chicken wings that they make in house. They are awesome. My second suggestion is to sit at the bar at night and have Ruby take care of you. One of the best bartenders I've had. I've been back a number of times I'll tell you, their DJ Yogi is great. He really makes the atmosphere there work.

Went here to watch a good local cover band and was very happy with the service .  Good service is hard to find!  Margs are excellent but very strong...I was three sheets to the wind by the beginning of the second set :) Had some of the chips and salsa and Mexican pizza....yum.  Would love to go back when my fav band plays there again!

Place claims to be a Latin kitchen but only offers burritos and chimichangas. Just say your a Mexican restaurant. The food was nothing less than stellar. The Mexican pizza was on a deep fried tortilla that was burnt and had so much fryer oil in it that it was oozing grease. Yuk! I tried the $20 special fajita that was a normal fajita with a few strips of overlooked chicken and some beef. The only novelty of it was that it was served on a skillet box where you are supposed to cook your own meat more to your liking, but the meat was already cooked to way overdone. Talked to someone to tell them how awful. the pizza was but they seemed not to care and just dismiss it as nothing was wrong. However the server was fantastic constantly checking to see if we were ok and did bring it to someone's attention and the pizza was taken off the bill. Thank you!!

The decor and cleanliness--Very nice!  Went on a Saturday evening and they were quite shorthanded in the waitstaff--2 guys working the whole restaurant, bar and night club side.  They did their best but seemed overwhelmed.  They were friendly and polite.  The regular margaritas were ok--not great and not bad.  You have to pay for chips and salsa--not complimentary with your meal.  The Mexican pizza was very tasty and a good bargain for the price.  Someone in my party ordered a burrito but there was virtually no meat in it unfortunately.  I had a feeling that they are catering more to the nightclub crowd.  They had a party going on that side of the restuarant.

Excellent food. Unique menu. Nice atmosphere. Owner/Chef visits his tables and cares about the customers. Many of the reviews here are about service. If you want fast service go to TGI Fridays. If you have time and want a good meal this is a good choice.

I ordered the castilla taino which was the beef short rib, excellent.  My girlfriend ordered the pork tamales and steak tacos which were also, excellent.  Very well decorated with good music playing all the time and attentive servers.  Thank you.
Rubi Agave deleted my review because I said how bad the service is. Bad bad bad I do not recommend

Over priced .I would give this a 0 if I could. Service was ok, you offer salsa and chip before you get the menu and charge you $12 for them? Drinks way over priced. With your dinner you get something they call a salad?  We had 4 people and all of are dinner came out at different times? Just a bad place go somewhere else!!!   To put it simple PEPE'S IS BETTER AND THAT DOESN'T SAY MUCH!

I love this place.  What a surprise to find a quality cocktail lounge out here in the burbs.  The drinks are excellent and some are very creatively presented.  We had the nachos and an order of guac & chips.  Wow.  Great guac and the nachos weren't your run of the mill creation.  They were spicy and mouth watering.  I actually haven't been there on a "show night" yet, but I am planning on it soon.  Don't walk.  RUN to Rubi Agave!

I really enjoyed stopping here recently for lunch. I didn't realize before coming that it's connected to an upscale grocery store. But not to worry, this is a casual and welcoming place to stop for lunch with pretty reasonable prices. 

You walk up to order at the counter and take a number to your seat. What was different at this place though was a server continues checking in after bringing your food. They were friendly and attentive. 

I can be nervous eating out since I'm sensitive to several different foods,  follow the Paleo AIP diet, and am also gluten free. I didn't call ahead or ask very specific questions, they didn't bat an eye when I ordered a gluten free and dairy free salad with no pepper or seasonings. I didn't ask specifically about oils or seasonings on the meat, but felt I was pretty safe ordering the kale salad with salmon. Just asked them to leave off the nuts, cheese, and seeds. Then did oil and vinegar dressing at the table. The salmon didn't seem seasoned with pepper or any other obvious pre-marinade. 

It was also nice to stop by the grocery and pick up a few items on my way home. Good value, friendly place, nice eating area. Surprised and happy with my stop here on vacation.

Do not let the uppity grocery store setting that is attached to this restaurant fool you; this is a great low-key spot to sit down for a meal. With a huge menu filled with many healthy and fresh options, Standard Market Grill always sounds like an appealing choice. 

I've had burgers, sandwiches, salads, and my easy go-to Buddha Bowl with the addition of salmon. Everything has been worthy of a repeat order. Their sweet potato fries are simply the best. While most restaurants who serve sweet potato fries seem to only serve limp ones, theirs are addiction worthy. I never order my own since willpower is not my forte. --It's best to snag a few from a friend's plate since manners will keep my sweet potato fry eating in check. 

While the environment looks a little sterile with its stark modern lines, the sunlight that pours through the massive windows softens everything it touches. The lit candles in the evening help accomplish this as well. If weather permits, grab a table outdoors. The umbrella covered tables look out over the ponds. You can actually forget you're on the ugliest stretch of Naper. -- Ogden Ave.

Best sandwich ever:

New York rye bread, monterey jack cheese, Marketmade roast beef, chimichurri a√Øoli, giardiniera

Just try it!

I've been coming to Standard Market Grill more times than I can count since it opened.  It's has an upscale modern grill connected to a grocery store (similar to Trader Joe's only pricier).  I leave from there disappointed today from my choice to go there for breakfast, a choice I will likely not make in the future.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy with the sunny side up eggs, my husband- the omelet with fruit (substituted for the hashbrowns).  Aside from the waiter - service was a major issue.  Starting out the cashier seemed confused and couldn't answer a single question without consulting someone else - our questions were simple no brainer's (gravy on the side, replace hashbrowns for fruit, etc.) which clearly she wasn't trained to know the answer for in advance.  There was just a handful of people, yet it took several minutes for it to arrive at the table.  When it was delivered our food was cold & my sunny side eggs were broken and running all over the plate. (my husband didn't send his back) I told the runner (that delivered the food) that the food was cold & requested that it be remade as I'm not one to accept this.  He took the plate and returned within a few minutes with the same plate (leaving the gravy), which as still cold and appeared to be slightly microwaved. He had to take the gravy back to be microwave it at a separate trip.  When the waiter came back we told him that this isn't acceptable - at that point I was so frustrated I simply wanted to leave.  After that the manager came to the table (after telling the waiter we didn't want to talk to her) and tried to pick up our check as compensation.  I quickly told her that wasn't the point and declined the offer.  I reminded her that in Naperville's competitive restaurant market service issues of this litany has brought many restaurants before it out of business - service is paramount and expected.  She proceed to make excuses that they have no plate warmers in their kitchen, that they just started service breakfast 6 or so weeks ago.  Again, not a valid excuse when I've been in Standard Market multiple times with every table filled and not had those issues.  I've given it three stars because the food is high quality and for the most part good.  However, the service issues for me will be a deal-breaker with future visits.  I'm disappointed, because the food is for the most part on point, but service for me will trump that every time.  My suggestion is to hire a manager with experience - it seems that the staff's training is lacking.  Service is king in Naperville - especially when you can go a different restaurant every day for an entire year & never hit the same one twice!  The restaurants that make it long-term in Naperville have mastered service first and foremost - coupled with good food and portion size.  I give it three stars because it's not been this way every time.

This review is for the Grill. My wife and I visited last night, and this place is a circus. Upon ordering we noticed a customer actually in the kitchen! The guy was complaining about his food, and the staff let him back there, where he had his hands and arms on the serving station. It was crazy, and the staff were completely absorbed by the event, and paying no attention to the customers. 

The food- Uggh! the worst. I ordered a chimmichuri steak with potatoes. What I got was an overcooked piece of meat (worst cut possible), and a pound of green potatoes. Flavorless and terrible. My wife had a fairly uninspiring turkey burger.

We have noticed over the past several months that service level and quality is declining steadily there. At the end of the day, this place is a grocery store, and they need a lot of improvement in basic food preparation and restaurant operations.

I really love the food half the time, and am left disappointed the other half.  I generally order a Buddha bowl, and never know which mix of vegetables I will get.  Sometimes there are mushrooms, sometimes not.  Sometimes leafy greens, sometimes endemine.  For being "standard" the recipe seems to vary a lot.  The line when you order carry out can be frustrating too.  You watch your food sit and get cold while the slow, young staff attempts to take orders of those in front.  A carry out register would help.  
My husband and I tried the breakfast one Sunday morning and were pleased with the food quality, though it took twenty minutes to get a waffle.

My husband and I had a quick dinner here on a Thursday night before my quilt guild. 

The ordering process and delivery was very efficient and the physical room was much nicer than I had expected. It's a order your own food cafe attached to a grocery store but the vibe is much more elegant.

I tried the stir fry and a sandwich because I had read about them on other reviews. They were fine, pleasant and adequate.

I liked the little mini sweet when you were done, that was the best part of the meal.

If I needed a quick bite I might come again but I wouldn't make a point of it like we did this time.
Had a fantastic veggie burger with sweet potato fries and honey mustard dipping sauce. They even delivered it to the cube in the back where I was enjoying $5 glasses of wine. I LOVE this place!!!

My first steps inside were to the Satandard Market Grill which is their restaurant.  I can't find the words to express my level of satisfaction and gratification with the ambiance, atmosphere, service, and, best of all-The Food!  Gahhh it was great!!!!!!!!!!! I had the Salmon Burger with fries, and ordered the  OJ smoothy and it was the greatest smoothie to ever touch the surface of my taste buds.  The salmon burger gave me a feeling of optimum nourishment I've never encountered in any dining experience in memory.  Hence, my body loved it!!!!!!!  I cannot help but go back and I will!!!!!!!!!!

The food here is always great. A big variety and huge portions. The problem with The Standard Market Grill is their service. My family and I have been coming here for lunch since they opened, and each time we have come the service is always extremely slow. You wouldn't think that based on the amount of staff they have working all day, but it's true. When meals should take approximately 10 or so minutes to arrive at your table, they take closer to 20 or minutes. For a casual dining place, that is way too long. And if you're expecting refills on your drink, forget about it. You'll get your drink 10 min after you sit down and a server won't be back well after you're done eating. With how much they charge for a meal, it's unacceptable. I hope they fix that problem.

Ok. So I've gotten food from standard market grill on three different occasions now. Food has always been great. I have ordered the kids sliders and fries because it is a big enough portion for an adult, and I love them. I order them with sweet potato fries that come with delicious honey mustard sauce. On point with those. I've also tried their Buddha bowl with steak and it is also absolutely delicious. 

My beef here is the drinks and how much they charge for how LITTLE you get also with the service* I've had the past two times. 

My second visit I ordered a milkshake for $5 and it came in a smaller glass, which wasn't that big of a deal because I added a bunch of stuff to it and honestly smaller portions are better for you (contradicting their meal portions). Today I ordered a LARGE size of their strawberry banana juice and I got my cup, same size as the milkshake but it was HALF full. The girl bringing me the drink asked the one who poured it if it was correct, the girl who poured it rudely said "that's how much they get". I would have stayed and asked to speak with a manager but I was already running late for work.

My advice: Skip the drinks and just order water with your food. Maybe get it to go as well, I've had rude and snooty service two out of the three times I've been there. But alas, I will be back to try more things on the menu.

My boyfriend and I came here for Sunday brunch after doing a quick search on the highest rated brunch choices in the area. Standard Market Grill had the best ratings and all the positive reviews and pictures looked promising. Located next to the Standard Market, the grill is its restaurant offering fresh fare. I was expecting a full service restaurant and was surprised to see an ordering counter as soon as you walk in. There's a digital menu beyond the counter and to be honest, I was looking for more variety in brunch options. If I didn't want a sandwich or salad, it seemed my options were limited to one of two omelets, a breakfast burrito, or a Belgian waffle. I quickly decided on a hanger steak and mushroom omelet, which is exactly what it sounds like and is served with standard breakfast potatoes (diced potatoes mixed with onions and peppers) or fresh fruit. Choice of white bread, whole grain bread, or English muffin. Strawberry jam and butter on the side. We were given a buzzer, told to grab our waters from their water station, and find our seats. 

Now is time to note that I like the layout of the restaurant. There's an indoor dining area; a semi-outdoor dining area with views of the pond, high windows and a cozy fireplace, and an outdoor dining area with wooden chairs and large umbrellas. There's a sign in the center table directing you to place your buzzer there and we did as instructed. Shortly thereafter, a server appeared, grabbed our buzzer from us, and assured us our food would be out soon. We waited only a short time and our food arrived. 

My omelet was fluffy and well-seasoned, with bits of hanger steak and mushroom through the egg instead of inside the omelet itself. I'm not a huge meat person, but I think they could have definitely been more generous with the steak, especially at $9 for the omelet. Perhaps there was even an adequate amount of meat in my omelet and I just couldn't tell because it was chopped up and mixed with the egg and mushroom. The potatoes were heavily seasoned, and the onions and peppers gave it more flavor. The English muffin was also delicious, and I appreciated the fresh butter and strawberry jam.

After delivering our food, our server did not come back to check on us and didn't seem to be anywhere near the patio area, which makes me very confused on what level of service Standard Market Grill is trying to achieve. I do not mind ordering at the counter or picking up my own drink, but then I would expect a classy place like this would offer more service than a greeting and food delivery. Overall the food is good; I'm not impressed with the brunch selections but I look forward to coming back and giving lunch or dinner a shot.

Went there to try but not planning on having a second visit!

I cant believe a weekend lunch having a burger, a salad, a small side and a drink for two ppl can cost 40+ bucks lol

The place look great, well maintained...even have a person to deliver food to your table...not sure if its a diner or fast food restaurant?!

I had passed by this place quite a bit and decidied to finally stop in and try it.  This particular restuarant takes advatange of the fast casual trend and provides a great place to get a meal on the side of a Trader Joe'sish type of a grocery store.  The place is beatiful and open with tons of places to sit.  The one thing I will have to comment on is that they are a little slow to clear down tables, as one was left dirty for quite sometime into the meal.  While I'm on the downsides, their draft beer list is on a rotating screen and the person at the counter taking the order had no clue what beers were being offered.


Outside of that the food and beer selection was pretty fantastic. I ended up getting the BLAT.  It had tons of crisp bacon, nice toasted brioche bread and creamy avocado.  All things considered it is a nice location and one I would likely return to.

Used to be one of my favorite places,then they took the ONE thing I get off the menu. 
Whoever thought removing the 24 hour steak salad from the menu should be fired, tarred and feathered. Seriously, I am so angry about that I will never set foot in that place again.

The Standard Market Grill is perfect for people like my husband and myself who enjoy grocery shopping dates!  The food is always cooked well and tastes amazing and as a review that caught my eye said, "get the sweet potato fries!"  They are amazing.

The atmosphere matches the feel of the grocery store and is clean and updated.

The service is very nice.  Although you order up front and sit down to wait for your food, the rest of the experience is like a full service dining establishment.  The staff is friendly and very helpful.

This is a perfect place for meeting friends for lunch or taking the kids out to eat before restocking your refrigerator!

Spent $35 on very subpar food- I don't mind paying for quality and maybe cause I got my food to go that I was sorely disappointed . Got the Buddha bowl and no ginger peanut sauce...instead they gave me a yellow mustard- mayo sauce X 2. Hangar steak salad for $14 was literally like an appetizer and sadly not great. And finally the  kids grilled cheese was painfully bad- I mean how do you really mess up grilled cheese?? Waitress was very friendly though.

I currently live in Chicago and now I'm reminded why the burbs get a bad wrap.

The manager of the Standard Market Grill on Sunday, January 17 was absolutely fantastic when it came to addressing food allergies and cross contamination concerns. I have not experienced such great customer service at the Grill before. 

He was extremely knowledgeable and really went out of his way to ensure our food was both gluten and dairy free! 

The food options are great, and I definitely recommend the "Kale Slaw" as a side. The Buddha Bowl is also amazing, and can easily be made gluten free friendly.

Food rocks. 5 Stars! Service not so much. 3 Stars.Can't take phone orders properly and the high school staff running the registers can't communicate. 

The male and female general managers get it. I understand they can't do everything but hire and train the rest crew.

My girlfriend and I came here for their opening and the food was delicious and service was friendly. It was nice to see that nothing has changed since my last visit, their four farmers salad was delicious (and healthy!)

Things have gone down hill at the Standard Market Grill since they opened. While the food is still fairly tasty, lately we have been either rushed through dinner (servers attempting to pick up our plates while we're still eating) or have waited more than 45 for ONLY half of our table's orders to arrive (while the other half's order was lost! ~ this was last Saturday, 1/23/2016). 

It's going to be a while before we come by again. We'll stick with the Cube in back.

Stopped here for lunch, on a yelp recommended hunch.
We were very impressed.  We both had the Buddha bowl one salmon the other tuna.  Nice light lunch lots of flavor, fresh veggies. Then we did a little grocery shopping for items we can't get in our small town.
We will definitely be returning .

I love standard market! Everything is so fresh and clean, it's the only stop to go for your proteins! They also have also have a fantastic wine section. I've yet to go to there restaurant and I most likely won't nothing against it I just prefer to shop there. They have a lot of great healthy options too

We went here specifically for the restaurant. Sure, the grocery store is nice as well, but the restaurant really takes the cake. The grocery store prices have niche items, so if I needed a specific ingredient and couldn't find it at a specialty store closer to me, I could probably look here. But, kind of out of my budget right now. The restaurant fits nicely within our budget, though. They have cucumber water and watermelon water, so that's free also. 

My husband ordered a chicken sandwich with chicken, cheese, and bacon. He orders a sandwich no other way. He liked it. He also had a bowl of chicken tortilla soup. He said it was good, but it was literally just chicken and tortilla chips. Usually there is some corn, tomatoes, beans, etc. in the soup, but not in this one. It was more of a chicken chili. Also, it came with tortilla chips on top..and a dinner roll...and packaged oyster crackers..so carb heaven.

I ordered the veggie burger and I can confirm that it is not just a Morningstar or Boca burger patty. I asked and they do make them daily. Granted, I'm sure that's a given, but it seems like most restaurants just use frozen patties. Anyway, it was delicious and I would order it again. Maybe without the BBQ sauce (I'm just not a super BBQ fan). I did like the buttermilk garlic, though. 

And the fries...oh. the fries. Delicious. Freshly made and really, really good. If you're trying to be healthy and order a salad, good for you. The fries are worth it.

Only downside is the seating. There needs to be a wall separating the ordering line from the booths. Otherwise, we had people watching us the entire time we ate. And maybe a better system for seating people. There were people walking in and saving tables so that by the time we ordered, there was only one table open. 

This is definitely a place to which we will return.

I love this place! Clean, modern interior with lots of fresh dining options. They also have a good selection of beer and wine. We had brunch on this visit. Loved the fact that they asked if we wanted our dishes split for sharing. We ordered the Belgian waffle and breakfast burrito. Both were fresh and delicious. Also love the water which they infuse with fruit. The only thing that confuses me about this place is why it's never packed. We will continue to come back!

I don't think we will come here again. 

The food was overpriced. 
The windows were smeary. 
My wine glass was dirty. 

The protocol was confusing, do we tip the guy who brings out food when we stood in line to order it?

Ridiculous amount of loud, poorly behaved children in every seating space. I don't mind kids, but screaming kids make the dining experience less enjoyable.

Have tried this a few times, but prefer the Westmont location over this one.

Bad service, dirty tables everywhere, and served the wrong thing on two consecutive visits. They just don't have it together.
Had their cajun fish sandwich- delicious! Even the half sandwich leftover eaten cold the next day tasted great. I'm also a fan of their kale slaw: well-seasoned with a perfect kick of spicy.

I love the standard market. My husband and I would drive to westmont (45 min drive) before this location opened up. We love there quality of food. We always get our fresh fruit and veggies here. It's a guarantee fresh, local (meats) and full of flavor. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for quality freshness! The employees are helpful and nice as well.
I love the healthy choices! Food options are wonderful and delicious. My personal favorite is the Buddha bowl! Can be a bit pricey! And service isn't the best.
Sweet potato fries are amazing!!! Love that you can buy alcohol from the store and drink it at the restaurant. Customer service is always great and food is fast and delicious.

Oh my Lord, was this place awesome! The grocery store alone is tremendous, but my lunch at the Grill took me over the top. We had the grass fed burger with white cheddar cheese, tomato bacon jam, kale slaw, and red onion on a pretzel roll. I ordered it medium and it came out light pink in the middle and juicy. The jam was quite strong, but I liked how the raw onion cut the flavor. And you can't go wrong with a pretzel roll. 

I also had the mustard honey chicken sandwich. Pretzel batard, grilled chicken, Monterey Jack cheese, roasted red pepper, bacon, avocado, Bibb lettuce, red onion, mustard-honey. Everything just came together perfectly. I'd order it again for sure.

And the sides are great. The market side salad as these soft cornbread croutons. There is no crouton anywhere near as good as these. And it's true, get the sweet potato fries. Incredibly thick, nicely seasoned, and a good honey-mustard dipping sauce. I want some chicken fingers for that mustard!!!

The Arnold Pomer was a really good drink; it's basically an Arnold Palmer with pomegranate juice. Very refreshing and refills are free. And there are no salt and pepper shakers. They give you a grinder that has coarse salt on one end and peppercorns on the other. You grind either side, so both the salt and pepper are as fresh as can be. Awesome. And the service was really good, everybody was very friendly. 

For a casual place, the ingredients are top notch and the menu is unique and creative while being approachable. Definitely will return.

Very busy. So busy that the family in line in front of us walked away when the cashier warned of a 20-30 minute wait on food. The food was above-average. My pizza with goat cheese and mushrooms was decent, but barely warm. Proof that the kitchen was overwhelmed and rushing food. My daughter had the chicken Buddha bowl which she loved. The food runners were running and the environment was
chaotic. Expected better, but maybe it was an off day for them.

Ordered on grubhub for pickup, went to standard market to pick up my order and mistakenly they gave my order to someone else. So they said they would make me a new one... no big deal. Then I hear the manager yell "we just lost out on $12!" Whatever so I waited about 15 mins and all these other people are getting their orders, when one of the cashiers saw I was still waiting. She went up and asked what was going on with my salad... they clearly forgot about it. They finally made it and the cashier was very apologetic and she seemed to be the only one who wanted to help me out. But no drink while I wait or cookie to leave with. Anyways I leave, start eating my salad and it's missing ingredients, this is the second time they have forgot to put avocado in my salad! I get this salad at least once a week and it's usually good. For $12 it should be made right every time! Not sure what happened but standard market grill is not as good as they use to be.

I can't say enough good things about Standard Market Grill.  We were there for a party and unfortunately I snagged my pants on a nail sticking out of a booth.  Standard Market paid for the repairs to my pants, and even showed up at the tailor personally when they wouldn't take a credit card over the phone.

The Super 7 with grilled salmon was excellent, and I was impressed with the craft beer selection on tap.  I'll definitely be back to walk through the market area, which definitely looks to give Whole Foods or Mariano's some stiff competition.

Well done Standard Market.
Very good! Easy atmosphere with really inspired dishes. I had the Crunch Salad and it was a great vegetarian selection, with so much flavor. My husband had the chicken cuban and loved it.

So many options! The food is top notch. Great beverage/brew selections. Tired of the grill...cool just hit the cube.
I little pricey but who cares.
It's only money.

This review is JUST for the restaurant. Check out my seperate review for the grocery portion.

Came here for lunch. It is the type of place where you order at the register but then have a server from there on out. Brock and I split the mushroom/goat cheese pizza (AHH goat cheese!!) and the blue cheese steak sandwich. We were lucky enough to find a seat on the patio where we waited with our pager-thingy. The neat thing is that the pager has a gps of some sort so your server can tell where you sit and bring your food to you. We even moved seats once and he figured it out!
Our food was brought quickly and was delish! The pizza was larger than I expected, definitley sharing size, and the sandwich was average size. The pizza was a kind-of cross between a flatbread and a regular pizza, kind of rustic, with perfect crust. The steak sandwich was cooked well, rare, and was of average tenderness. It still got stuck in between your teeth as rare steak typically does. The star of the sandwich though was the blue cheese aioli. It was not too pungent but you certainly knew it was there. I am not a HUGE blue cheese fan but this was balanced perfectly. The sandwich was paired with fries which were average if you ask me, I don't know what other Yelpers are raving about there.
The service was excellent as was the value. Our freshly squeezed lemonade even came with refills which NEVER EVER happens. Our server was attentive but not overbearing and came with warm chocolate chip cookie chunks to accompany our check. 
The patio is small so the seating is a little tight but I love eating outdoors. I'll be returning if i'm in the neighborhood.
Standard Market Grill has great burgers.  After you eat, check out the store.  I am normally in the Westmont Standard Market, but it was fun to check out Naperville.

We havent had a bad meal at this place. The staff is always friendly, and the specials are always interesting. Ive had their burgers, sandwiches, and breakfast so far, all have been good. They make a decent arnold palmer, and I have yet to try their smoothies, but I have seen them and they LOOK really good.

First time ever to the market and still wondering why I waited so long!  The market has a variety of culinary pleasures including HOOK'S aged cheddar.  Lots of items you wont even find at WF though I found the prices to be comparable.  

It lost one star due to how small it is, imagine how much more stuff you could fill in here if the place was bigger.  Moving along, you can find helpful staff and pre-bagged dinners, with fresh ingredients to make dinner/lunch yourself OR you can pick up pre-made.  I believe there are different meals depending on the day of the week.  The day we went they had a pre-bagged steak dinner and pre-packaged knuckle rolls (lobster salad sammies) YUM. 

As we moseyed around we saw people drinking wine next to the cheese counter area, will have to come back to check that out.

Last, the GRILL.  We opted to sit outside because the weather was perfect and started with the chicken tortilla soup which was excellent.  We shared, the Pulled Pork Pizza, the Molten Grilled Cheese, a side of hand cut fries and Kale Slaw.  All were fantastic.  

Everything from start to finish was tasty, we will definitely be back again, and again, and again.  :)
Great store with awesome!  They sever the best salads and turkey burgers in their caf√©.  Love it.

The best food around!!! I love to order at the front and the flavored water. 
Pizzas are to die for and the hamburgers so juicy. Good job. Keep doing like that!!

The best of the Standard Market Grills in the area. The staff is the best of the best. Extremely professional and courteous and so good at what they do. And they do it well. I have been to the Westmont Standard Market Grill. The Naperville location is superior in food and the quality of service. I don't eat anywhere else in the Chicago 'burbs.

Extremely overpriced.  All of it.  There's nothing here that you likely can't find at Trader Joe's.

Or Whole Foods, if you have no soul.

The grill is OK, again due to the pricing.  My wife and I paid $60 for two entrees, a few sides, and a few drinks.  Not great.  Food quality was good, but due to the pricing alone, it makes it seem less than great.

I love this place.

I try not to go too often, because it is on the expensive side, but it is a great if you are shopping for a special occasion or something out of the ordinary.

They have a great selection of meats, including lots of preseasoned/marinated options.

They also have a really impressive coffee selection.

The wine bar is a nice place to relax for a bit after an afternoon of running errands. You can even buy a bottle in the store and drink it there with no cork fee.

I am a regular at standard market and I absolutely LOVE there meals for 2 so I have been waiting to come to the grill. I ordered the pesto chicken sandwich, it was really good. My fianc√© ordered the Cuban chicken sandwich, which he enjoyed as well. My moscow mule was off though, very lemony. It just didn't seem right. 

Our service was a little less then average. We sat at the bar so we were up close to all of the action. It was very busy, but just sitting next to two working the bar we didn't get asked about drinks for about 10 minutes. Being at the bar, and I n front of all of the workers in the 45 minutes we were there we witnessed 3 meals being refunded.

My over all impression was that yes it was busy, however I feel like I saw lots of confusion with workers. I think if it was more like an average restaurant where you sit down and order (which I was very surprised when I realized you ordered at the counter) then the workers would be less confused and wouldn't wander around the entire place with found searching for the right table.

Have you ever seen a pretty grocery store?!?! If not then this is it. I have never seen a grocery store that actually looks pretty when you first walk in but we shall see how long that lasts since I went there right when they opened... Its actually kind of a small store considering the way the building looks but it also has a restaurant/grill attached. Anyway you can kind of expect whole food prices when you walk through the door, but in my opinion better products. This place doesn't try to shove everything in your face like other places nor do they overstuff there sleeves. Also the cafe place is really nice. Kind of small but they make an amazing matcha latte and chai tea... I didn't get the chance to try the coffee yet but I'm sure I will be back to do so.... 
I think I need to go back to form a better opinion of this place but overall I do like it

So, delicious food in a casual and comfortable environment. Love that. They have a sunny outdoor patio which is where we dined on our first visit, but the inside is nice, clean and modern as well. My friend and I shared a pizza with goat cheese, spinach, red peppers and olives and we both loved it. We also had the four farmers salad which was full of fresh and tasty ingredients, but that didn't get finished because we were distracted by their amazing french fries. Hand cut, with some skin left on, and the right amount of salt. Not greasy either. Just perfect. I had a $5 margarita because it was on special. Drink prices were a little high given how casual the restaurant is and the location, IMO.  My husband said he really enjoyed his sandwich and that he would totally come back here. I responded with "we could've come here so much sooner if you hadn't kept shutting it down!" We'll def be back.

Yesterday was my second visit here and I liked it even more than the first.  I had the Four Farmers salad.  YUM!  I can't say I've ever had a salad with hazelnuts and dates in it.  It was so so so good!  If you like the sweeter tasting salads that have goat cheese, avocado, fruit and nuts, this is your salad.  They mix the dressing into the salad perfectly!  I was thinking about it all day today and wondering when I will get my next Four Farmers salad. Good portion size, too!  Well worth the $12.  I felt it was more of a value than the sandwich I got there the first time.

I enjoy this restaurant.  It's clean, contemporary.  I like the bar area that overlooks the open kitchen area.  

I like the flavored water stations that you can help yourself to.  

They will bring you little samples of their chocolate cookie bars.  Mine were hot out of the oven and really good.  

Until next time Standard Market Grill...

Went for lunch, and its pretty good. Its a bit more expensive than I'd usually go for, but it is really yummy. I had the 24 hour steak and it was pretty great. I don't think I would have ordered it if someone else was paying since it was a $14 sub sandwich.
awesome little market. They even have a bar where you can drink the wine you bought in the food. TVs to watch the game. And excellent seafood
Wonderful place. An expensive but I like be there. Good energy.  The employees are wonderful.  Thank you all

I get the chicken Buddha bowl here and I love it so much that I have a hard time trying anything else from the menu - the veggies always taste fresh, the chicken is always tender and flavorful, and the sauce is incredible. It's basically the perfect meal, for me.

The price is right, too, since it's about $12 (with tax) for the chicken Buddha bowl, and you get a large portion that's presumably made with higher quality ingredients than most places use.

I *really* don't like that they don't provide nutritional information. I looked everywhere I could think to look, and still have no idea how many calories, how much sodium, etc. is in their food. I'm not a crazy health nut or anything, but I like to know... and I'm sure there are lots of health conscious types that would also appreciate that information.

The food is delicious with generous portions!  Only weird thing is how much of a tip do I leave?  
I've also ordered online & picked up.  This works smoothly!  Their turkey burgers are fabulous!  I eat gf and they now offer a gf bun (which was tasty!)

Went here for Sunday brunch. Service was poor. Women taking orders at front were rude and unfriendly. One of the worst cups of coffee I've had in recent memory. I got the early riser pizza, which was ok, except the over easy egg that comes on top, was sunny side up with lots of clear gooey membrane floating and jiggling around. Gross

Standard Market is the Apple store of grocery stores. It's expensive and only sells select items but it's a great experience overall. My only complaint is that sometimes the staff is not as knowledgeable about current sales as they should be and I often have to wait while someone goes and confirms the price. This also reflects poorly on their inventory system. All in all, I love it and am there a few times a week.

Best food across the suburbs! City vibe. My fav place for breakfast (pourover coffee), lunch (budda bowl), game night (roadhouse burger and beer), and dinner (steak!!)... Exceptional service. Manager is on top of everything!! Just a great time every time we come out... We drag all our friends here! Price tag is friendly for all as well...

Top notch eats and service. This place used to be a quiet little spot to get away. No longer. Couldn't find a seat on a recent Thursday night. Either at the cafe or the Cube I assure you that you will not be disappointed.

My friend and I choose this as our go-to place for a relaxing atmosphere and tasty meal. We both order the grilled cheese with sweet potato fries ($9) and we love, love, love it! Menu hack: If you don't want bacon on your grilled cheese, ask for the kids grilled cheese with sweet potato fries. Basically the same size and costs only $7!

Got takeout for dinner tonight. Chicken was delicious. Somewhat dry but still good. The mashed potatoes tasted like they were from a box. My sister got the salmon. She was upset because it barely had any flavor. I tried it also and she was right. The rice had the same flavor as chlorinated pool water. The salmon was dry also. I'm not sure why this happened. I had high standards after hearing about them from friends but this was unfortunate.

Both the market grill and cube restaurant in the back have great food. I have been there a few times know and have never had a bad experience. My favorite is the farmers pizza they also have good sushi. Another great thing about this place they have a very large selection of craft beers. If your lucky on Tuesdays they get there shipment of three floyds!! Does not last long... So get there early I have been there a few times for lunch on Tuesdays by noon not much is left.
Really a 4.25-4.5, what can I say, great menu, many options for an omnivore like myself and vegetarian like my wife. Decent beer and wine list. I love coming here.

You must go to the cube! Not only is the food and wine AMAZING but Luke, their wine specialist, is beyond helpful and kind. If you're going to the cube you must ask him for a recommendation. We've been here many times and have never been disappointed. 5 stars all around!!

My wife and I have been to the Standard Market Grill almost 20 times since we moved to Naperville in June. It is fantastic. Best sweet potato fries anywhere. Generous portions. Delicous food. We also love the flavored water we can get at our leisure. They have done pineapple, cantaloupe, cucumber, and berries. They are all terrific.

The other amazing gem here is their coffee shop. We are coffee snobs and this is the best in Naperville. Try the pumpkin latte and you will not regret it.

The Buddha Bowl with perfectly seared tuna. A bounty of veggies, brown rice. Not too saucy, flavorful without being salty. Hubby has the spin class salad-really enjoyed it! Only thing I would say is that I would have liked another ounce or two on my tuna portion.

The last 2 times we called ahead to order place an order it was not ready when we arrived. The second time I had to wait 20 minutes longer than i was told on the phone. When we got the food home the sweet potato fries were stringy and burned. Disappointing....


The food is excellent. We order or eat in at least once a week. The BBQ chicken sandwich on the pretzel roll is fantastic. Chicken tortilla soup is great and make sure you try the sweet potato fries. I have never had a bad meal here. Tip - sit at the bar and order and skip the lines when it is busy.

We love the food here but every time we order food for pick up they always mess something up or forget to put something in the bag. I wish I was exaggerating when I say always but it truly is every time. If you order food be sure to double check. I believe it is a systems issue bc this happens to us at both the westmont and Naperville location. The sweet potato fries used to be one of our favorite staples but they must have changed how they make them bc now they are soggy and not as good quality. 

I went there Sunday bc I enjoy this chia teas. My husband brought me my drink. It tastes like dirty dish water and was disgusting. I brought it back and complained about how wrong it tasted. The girl behind the counter said she could make me a new one but it would take a few minutes to make the chia. We were in a hurry so I had to get the receipt to make the return. I'm concerned that it wasn't made right in the first place bc the chia wasn't brewed and she just threw something together hoping it wouldn't be noticed. I'm very disappointed.
