The four farmers salad is the best salad in the town of Naperville. Which may not mean much to many people, but it's a damn good salad so just get it. I almost 75% certain that the champagne vinaigrette dressing is poured down onto Earth via a spout from the heavens.

We have now been to the Standard Market Grill for both lunch and brunch. The food quality has always been great! The service is friendly, but can be a bit slow. I do wish they would expand the brunch menu a bit, maybe add a french toast or pancake option, maybe some options of customizing the breakfast burrito? The lunch menu is extensive and varied. 

Overall, great addition to the area!

Standard Market has lots of options, for health & convenience.
It's has
Grocery Market
Catering
The Grill (restaurant)
Cheese & Wine (with a bar)
Deli 

This is a Chef driven business so everything seems to be pretty top choice^_^ almost everything is top quality with almost no artificial preservatives/additives. Prices are similar to a Whole Foods, so it may seem a bit pricey but this day and age we end up having to pay a little more for REAL food as opposed to over processed, mass consumer items. I'm the kind of person who tries to save money where I can, but when it comes to what I put into my body I will pay a little more to put good stuff into it. 
Not to mention it tastes better ;))
*gluten free options available in grocery store & at restaurant
 
Ps the sweet potato fries are amazing & my BF worships the bacon hahaha :)~ 

Sandwhiches we tried we delicious! We had the *24 steak & BLAT (with Swiss cheese & egg added). The steak was perfectly done so you didn't have to rip at it through your sandwich. The Swiss cheese on my BLAT went perfectly with the fried egg (I added both of those).

Enjoy!
^_^ Cheers

Yum. We frequent the grill, food is really good especially the burgers and chicken sandwiches. I will have to try the infamous Buddha bowl as the yelp fam keeps raving about it. I was introduced to Angry Orchard ale (aka Angry Bird because I accidentally called it that on more then one occasion) here and have been addicted ever since. Service is good and food comes out pretty fast. Great casual environment and I really enjoy sitting out in the area where the fireplace is. As other reviewers stated it is on the pricier side, however you can get a good meal here.

Let me pre-face this by saying, I am a huge fan of Standard Market Grill and have eaten many a meal here. Now when I walked into this fine establishment on this fine day and observed the fine menu board rich with options, I was blinded by my previous experience. I ordered the Brunch Burger, a delicacy by my standards, and my amigo ordered the Brisket Grilled Cheese. I had been resting in the booth with my good friend when after an extended period of time my friend had his meal and I was still waiting for my glorious sandwich. I had to go say something to the server and finally I had the beloved burger in front me. Considering the quality of food served here, I had high hopes that have never been disappointed before. You would think frying an egg is a simple task, but it seems the chefs that day had it out for my immune system (as in salmonella, which is rampant uncooked eggs). As for my friends brisket grilled cheese, it was less than satisfactory. He considers himself a connoisseur of brisket having eaten and enjoyed it for many years (he's pretty old but that's just between you and me). As I enjoyed my bacon and burger (minus the egg) I periodically looked over at him taking large slices of fat off of his grilled cheese. While I am no professor of brisket according to him this is one of the worst sins possible in meats. Over half of the brisket were large pieces of fat. With the combination of the poor service, and the lackluster elements of the food, Standard Market Grill was not up to standard

Standard Market Grill has a clean, bright, spacious and modern feel to it - very trendy!  :)

I ordered the Mediterranean Salad and it was one of the top three salads I have ever had - absolutely delicious!  It comes with grilled salmon, balsamic dressing, field greens, Campari tomatoes, focaccia croutons, cucumber, feta, and Kalamata olives.  The salmon was perfectly seasoned and cooked - tender and not overdone.  The dressing was sweet and had the right amount of bite from the balsamic vinegar.  Everything tasted fresh and was cut in small pieces for dainty eating.  I could not put my fork down, lol.

I also enjoyed the flavored waters - not sure what was in mine, haha.  Maybe labels might be helpful?...  ;)

I thought the service seemed accommodating and friendly - I requested my salad without olives and my order was accurate. 

This is a perfect place for a "date" or a great place to take clients for a casual business lunch...  I'm impressed!

This restaurant is great. I love their Asian chicken salad -- full of tasty vegetables and lots of chicken. Everything I've tried, I've enjoyed. My kids love the fruit - infused water and the complimentary cookie bites at the end of the meal.

The food here is really good. I love how many options they have. A salad with dates??  It was the Four Farmers salad. Sign me up. I know it's a salad but if your going to eat one at least let it be flavorful and this definitely was. Their prices are a little pricey considering what your getting.  I don't mind paying a little more for quality. This is a type of place you eat at from time to time to enjoy. Not just to grab a quick bite to eat.

I love Standard Grill! Their menu is varied and offers several tasty options for vegetarians (as well as omnivores, obviously). I love the VGBG burger, which has an amazing texture and is topped with delicious gruyere cheese, bbq sauce and buttermilk garlic sauce. The sweet potato fries make an excellent accompaniment- they are thick and lightly salted, served with a yummy honey mustard dipping sauce.

The service here is always friendly and helpful and they are really good at refilling your drink and even offering a refill to go, which is a nice touch! The little cookie bar samples after the meal don't hurt, either.

Like the store, the Grill be $$$. And frankly, for what I paid for a Buddha Bowl with tuna, I would have done better to get some sushi (at a sushi place). It just wasn't great. The seating area is nice, though; makes you mostly forget that you're in a grocery store. And the service checks up on you, so even though you order at a counter it feels more like a restaurant in that sense as well. The menu is big, and I have eaten at the location in Westmont with varied success before, so I'd be willing to give it another shot since it's convenient to me, but know that you're paying for a "real" meal in a place that is still after all attached to a supermarket.

Stopped in to Standard Market Grill the other night to grab some grub with friends. I ended up getting the Roadside burger with sweet potato fries. The burger came out cooked to perfection and it was delicious!!!! The fries were even better. They were the thickest sweet potato fries I've ever had!!!! They are served with a delicious honey mustard sauce that is a pairing I wasn't expecting, but completely loved!!!
When you are done with your meal, the table busser brings you little warm pieces of chocolate chip cookie....that is the best!!!
I will be back to try more of the menu.
A double bonus is they are open on sat and sun mornings for breakfast!!!!

Love this place!  We first ate here right when it opened, and there were some growing pains.  Now this is one of our first places to eat.  Bar seating is great, with personalized service.  Great turkey burger and thin-crust pizzas.  Don't miss the chocolate cookie for dessert.

This is not a super market, it is a market. It is a market with a grill/restaurant attached.   A very very high priced market, actually overpriced in many areas.  But it has some interesting options.  The "dinner for two" appears to be a good deal coming in at around $18.00, including a salad, entree, vegetable/starch and dessert.  everything I put my hands on was expensive to me... unnecessarily so in many instances.  I think the market caters to a different kind of ego that could care less about how much something costs.  That's okay, just turns me off. Obviously the meat counter is phenomenal, but I can do better at Caputo's. The cheese and wine selection is large and varied, top of the line.  The Grill is a nice option for lunch.  It has an attractive bar, replete with a lot of craft beers.  They make a good steak sandwich, and the fries are great.  That's all I had so far along with an excellent craft beer.  They try to take very very good care of you but customer service is sketchy, which is surprising.  It's a nice experience, and I will go back just out of curiosity, or to pick up dinner for two.  I would definitely do lunch at the Grill again.  Not much more to say, but I will probably do another review at a later date...maybe my opinion will change.  Do they have a Red Box?

Where to begin. I've been to the Grill several times for a lunch and I absolutely love when I dine in. The food is amazing. I've always had a burger and haven't gone wrong yet. The music is great - like they are playing my favorite Pandora station. They also have an amazing water bar. And to top things off the server brings over a warm cookie bar. I love this place. The only downside is, every time I order my food to go it is never quite as good as when I dine in. 
One major thing - please bring back the original kale topping on the burgers. It was fantastic. The most recent burger I had, had a different topping (not as great).

I've eaten here a couple times, and they've always done a good job. The gluten free pizza is great, and decently priced too! I figure, coming out under $10 for a meal that feeds both me and my toddler is a win. 

Service is pretty good too. My only complaint would be that the lighting at night is pretty dim. 

Overall a nice place to grab lunch (especially when shopping next door takes too long!).

I come here quite often with my dad and the food is always excellent but the service is usually hit or miss. This past time we went we just happened to have sat in and area where we received amazing service. Our servers name was Kent and he was marvelous. When I asked for extra napkins he was back in two seconds. When we asked for boxes, same thing. And it was pretty packed. My dad and I felt as if we were his first priority at all times. He was fantastic. After leaving him a tip for his excellence, we went on to tell him and his manager how great he was. Every time we go back we will ask where Kent's section is:)

This is an upscale market with a wide selection of vegetables, grains, meats, cheeses, and wine! They even have their own bakery with pastries, cakes, and gelato. They also have a fresh juice bar for those of you who are looking for a fresh healthy juice. If only this place wasn't so expensive!!!

Can't wait to get back - amazing cafe (awesome coffee and good management) and surprisingly good restaurant - needless to mention a good grocery store.

We had rice bowl - veggie, a steak dinner and both were fresh and good.

Basically a huge fan of the coffee bar which is the reason I keep going there.  Will provide a bigger review once I get back.  

Hoping the experience is the same.
Prices are kind of high but so worth it. The food is great- love their salads and burgers! Cocktails are yummy too. Portions are huge so you get your money's worth!
Oh my freaking God!!!!!! This place is the bomb freaking digity. I ordered some sort of salad with salmon. The salmon tasted like butter, and the salad was very fresh.

Besides the fact that it's pricey (which was expected) this place is awesome. They have unique everything and it's all delicious. The restaurant or "Grill" has a herb chicken dinner my boyfriend and I had for dinner and it was to die for.

Naperville has needed a place like this for a long time. Great food, great bar, great service. I had ordered online for takeout and my order was ready 10 minutes later when I arrived but I decided to eat at the bar anyway. Im glad I did because the bartender was very friendly, very knowledgeable and overall seemed like he knew wtf he was doing. My food itself needs no hyperbole or explanation. When I got up to leave he even gave me a chocolate chip cookie, compliments of the house. Like I said, great food, great bar, great service.

Really great food. We enjoyed the the salad and the burgers. The dining room was lovely.  They really paid attention to the details. Loved the free flavored water. The prices were just a little high. The store was lovely.

Polite, clean and a nice selection for lunch.  A tad pricey but taking a look at the decor and amount of staff on hand explains it.  Everything was tasty but there was too much dressing on my salad and not enough toppings.  Overall the service kept me from giving them a "Meh."

Was in the area and decided last minute to check out this place! We were pleasantly surprised at the price and the quality of food! I ordered the cuban chicken sandwich and the green envy juice which were both so delicious and they make sure to stuff the sandwich with lots of meat! My boyfriend got the tuna sandwich and his brother ordered the chicken/tofu buddha bowl! Both were very fresh and flavorful! If I went back I would definitely order the buddha bowl.
This is the new hidden gem in Naperville. Outstanding service and food. Great menu along with friendly service make this place truly enjoyable. I highly recommend you give it a shot!

I have been to this store four times now so I thought a review was in order.  Very nice store, clean and well organized, amazing meat counter.  Those are the only positives I can comment on.  My main issue with this store is the employees.  They are not helpful or attentive.  They do not smile.  They do not speak.  I would even go so far as to say they act like they do not want to be there, period.  Speaking from someone who has 17 years of retail under their belt, customer service should be their #1 priority.  After my 4th trip there and another negative experience, I will not be returning.  I was so excited for the opening of this store too.  I will continue to shop at my favorite store on the corner of 75th and 59 where the employees are knowledgeable and welcoming.

Food was great, service was too.

I got the stuffed chicken breast which was perfect, and my date got a chicken ceaser. The shooms are a MUST and the tomatoes bisque was tasty as well.

If managers are reading this, our waiter was tyler, and he was very kind and kept our drinks full all night. A+

This place is top notch! I had lunch at a different Houlihan's and was amazed at the quality of food. So I insisted my partner and I go here for dinner recently. 

He was skeptical about this place because of the fact that it's a chain restaurant. The first night we ate here, it was dead quiet and empty. We were thinking about ordering some of the small app's for $3 (I think) when a neighboring couple said they were REALLY small. So we skipped it.

I almost always order the buffalo blue chicken salad. The chicken is crispy and awesome tasting. I accidentally got the bigger portion with soup and was sad it didn't have a roll (like I got with lunch). On a second visit, I got the smaller portion and it came with bread.

The salad is huge and the ingredients are really fresh and tasting. I love the tomato soup with the two cheesy fritter things. It's just out of this world. I usually can tell you what my partner ordered and what he liked, but I was too busy enjoying my yummy salad.

The service was good, the tables clean, the food was outstanding. My only problem is that Houlihan's isn't closer to home. Should I sell my house? Probably not. But it was worth the extra drive and considering it takes 20 minutes to get here, it was strange that we would come back within a week.

So, I would definitely recommend. Skip Applebee's and the those crappy chains. Houlihan's is the only chain worth eating at in my opinion!!!!

From the moment we sat at our table, our server Samantha, made sure we felt like we were the only table she was serving. Her level of attentiveness and desire to make our visit a personalized experience was remarkable and worthy of commendation. As soon as we sat down, she introduced herself with a smile on her face and, without us asking, brought our two kids plates of carrots and ranch to keep them occupied till our dishes arrived. The remainder of our stay was highly enjoyable and all of the staff seemed to consistently smile and have a very positive demeanor. Even little things like stowing a small step stool under the sink in the men's bathroom so that my son can reach the sink to wash his hands just made all the difference in our experience. The first I saw the manager on duty, Jen, was when she was cleaning plates off tables to make room for her guests. Not something you normally see a manager doing, but just goes to show how humbly she handles her position of authority. From my perspective it seemed that Jen knew how to make her guests and employees happy.   Taking time out of my day to write a novel about my restaurant experience in not something I normally do.

Ask for Samantha. She was great. I ordered a long island iced tea, and she got me the best deal there right away! Larger than the size of my head for only $1 dollar more and terrific! She also suggested appetizers to help cheer me and my daughter up after a long, hard day! Will definitely be back to try the entrees. Great value for a jumbo long island iced tea.

Another great experience here. Great prices and one can choose from a variety of sides for no extra charge. I love the fact that the manager always asks how everything is. Wait staff is wonderful. Wonderful wine list.

Normally, I have good experiences here. The first bad experience was in Indy a few years ago. The most recent was at #165 on 4/16/16. First, the Long Islands are aweful. Both my friend and I didn't like them having tried different flavors. She ordered pot roast, her favorite and disliked it. My srooms were good as usual, but I noticed how small they've gotten. 
The next day, I noticed a discrepancy in my accout & realized they doupled charged me. I've spoken to Kelly, Sue and Maxine. They said it takes 10 days to repost. REALLY? It only took a few minutes to take my money but over a week to return it? I'm done.

I wish I could give them 4  1/2 stars instead of only 4. The dinning event started a little slow, waited nearly 15 minutes for wait staff to notice us, and it wasn't very busy, but once they did notice us the service and food were outstanding. 

We arrived before 7 pm on Monday and were able to take advantage of the drink and appetizer specials. $2 off select draft & bottled beer $3 off Blue Taboo & Raspberry Peach Sangria. 

The waiter went out of his way to make sure we got a sampling of everything we asked for, which included Left Hand Milk Stout, served at the correct temperature and a sampling of the Sriracha Thai peanut sauce from the Sriracha salad. 

Glad we went for a full order of GOAT CHEESE AND ARTICHOKE POPPERS. Amazing! We nearly licked the plate. 

We enjoyed the BUFFALO BLEU SALAD with a 20 oz glass of Allagash White on draft and the STEAK & WEDGE SALAD with RASPBERRY PEACH SANGRIA. 

Don't be fooled, the Steak & Wedge Salad was more like a petit cut steak dinner. The steak was cooked to order and served on the side, along with asparagus and the lettuce wedge with just enough dressing. We asked for the roasted pecans to be served on the side as well, which we were glad we did. The pecans had a chili flavor to them. 

The Raspberry Peach Sangria was a great compliment to the Steak "Salad".  It was served as a fully poured wine glass with an added small decanter, enough for a second glass. 

We know we have been to Houlihan's before, but can't say why we hadn't been there in a while. However, we do know we will be visiting again really soon to enjoy a full glass of that Stout, some of poppers, and steak salad.
Great place. Great atmosphere. Food always comes out amazing and haven't had any issues. Props to the cooks and servers. Keep up the great work.

While the food is fine here, keep an eye on your property because there's a thief on their staff. My group went here tonight and sat outside for dinner. As soon as I sat down, I laid down my $20 reading glasses and my $140 Ray-Ban sunglasses. After we finished eating, we went inside to the bar. After about 20 minutes, I realized that I didn't have my glasses or sunglasses. I spoke with the waiter and he indicated that the table had been cleared, but we could look in lost and found. Interestingly enough, my $20 readers were there, but no sign of my $140 sunglasses. Thieves.

The service here was not good at all. I came in on Saturday night with 2 of my girl friends and we sat on the patio, our server was Joan. She never rang in the fries I ordered and my friend didn't like her drink and didn't have an opportunity to tell her because she never came outside. I ordered the egg roll appetizer which was pretty good! And the manager even came outside to check on us and he was very nice! He took care of the issue with my friends drink. At the end of our visit, we asked for separate checks and she just split everything down the middle when the checks weren't even close to the same price. Then we waited for a very long time to get our checks after that. I would recommend this place for their food but that's all
Stopped here for lunch with my sister, great food & great service! The patio is perfect for happy hour when the weather permits.

Thoroughly enjoyed my meal here. Had the 1/2 french dip and baked potato soup, loved everything about it. My mom raves about the ahi tuna salad. Dad had pot roast and it looked delicious. My daughter had grilled cheese and fruit and was very happy with it also. I love that the kids menu has so many selections. Water was always full and service was quick and friendly. Previously I've only been here for drinks and always had great experiences.

I love Houlihan's! We at minimum usually have a 12 person group if not up to 25 they are always able to accommodate. The servers are friendly, I just wish it was open until at least 1. We always end up having to go to Another bar after because we're not done catching up.

Honestly wish I could rate 5 star bc waitstaff was amazing every time I have been in - until an employee named Crystal began threatening me for absolutely no reason. (To clarify she belittled the bar tender by accusing us of paying a 2 penny tip, when we gave her a generous tip)  "let's take it outside" is actually what she said as I walked out of the bathroom, asking if I was talking shit when my cousin stated exactly what crystal said. Then telling my family and friends to "mind they fucking business" after they told asked her what was going on. She then ended with "next time I see you you'll be on the fucking ground" - then the management approached me to apologize for this employee. This was a beyond ridiculous experience - manger handled it very well but, cannot understand how or why this happened & still cannot believe the type of employees would approach a customer like that. Will not be back. Not professional, let alone acceptable for a type of behavior like that.

I just came here for lunch after going to the restaurant next door.  When I went there I sat at the bar for 15 minutes while the bartender played with her phone under the bar trying to hide it.  I got up and came here.  Front door was opened for me I was instantly helped when I sat at the bar.  KC burger was outstanding.  I also was checked on by 2 other workers to make sure everything was great.  I will be back next time through.  Great Job!

Went here for a relatives birthday last Saturday . The place was nice , can't really comment on the food because they forgot to bring mine out! Everybody was almost done eating so I told the waitress not to even bother bringing mine out, I mean the point was to eat with everyone else. I won't be returning here!

Haven't been here in a while but, came here about a week ago with my family the service was AWESOME the Manger came by  talking to us and the waiter forget his name was A1 ALSO very nice. Food was top notch too hot fast and DELICIOUS will be back

Have eaten here lots of times and have been fairly happy. Last Saturday was a disaster. My friend ordered a red wine but was brought red instead. Not a big deal because mistakes happen. At ordering time, my friend ordered a salad and specifically asked for no bacon. I ordered the stuffed chicken. When the food came, my friend began eating her salad and immediately bit into bacon which she had asked to have excluded from the salad. Ok, we were at this point running late for a movie so she picked out the bacon and kept eating, but after the wine mistake we began to wonder if it was the server or the cook. Well, I was happily digging into my chicken. I got about halfway through it, and I kept waiting for the cream cheesy stuffing to flow out. When it never did, I opened up the chicken, which was basically 2 breasts cooked together, and there was no filling.....at all! What? I still don't know who was running the show and making the mistakes but since the quality of the chicken was good and we were only getting later for our movie, I didn't want to deal right then with anyone offering to bring something else or correct the error(s). Just wanted to finish and get going. Doubt I'll be back. Too bad cuz I love their stuffed mushrooms!

I have been a long time costumer of Houlihan's. It's a great spot for a girls night and for date night. Food and cocktails are delicious. However, the past 3 times coming here I have been extremely disappointed in the service at the bar. I have been served by two different younger gentleman who are SO socially awkward, they try to remember orders without writing anything down but then have to come back and clarify order or even better just mess it up completely. One of the past three times, my husband and I were wanting to have a couple of drinks, but we left after just one because we were never asked by the guy if we wanted anything else. Really sad because I used to love this place. Poor Service is turning me away.
Great outdoor patio.  They recently got a new menu   and no longer have five dollar Long Islands but they still have great food and an amazing patio

We walked in with high expectations for a nice date night. What we got was far from.

The hostesses were lovely and polite. We were seated quickly. We sat... And sat... And sat watching server after server just walk right past or just standing around talking. Thirty minutes later one of the hostesses walked past and I stopped her and told her no one had even taken our drink order. She said she would find our server. About ten minutes later a server came over and said she didn't know we were her table. She took our order and she seemed truly apologetic. It took about 20 minutes for our food. My boyfriend's burger was overcooked and part of my flatbread was touching the server's hand and then the table. I ate my flatbread and was less than impressed. I'm not ready to say we'll never go back because I believe in second chances but it won't be any time soon.
We love their food. great wait staff. tomato soup is to die for.
Highly recommend this place. Thai chicken is amazing and so is the grilled chicken and avocado egg rolls.

We have never been to a Houlihan's before but ate at this one last Saturday. The place was full but we had the option to be immediately seated in the bar area, which a lot of times we prefer. From our table, we could see through the glass wall that they have a nice outside eating area with a fire pit. The flame was on in the pit and the area was somewhat busy. It was about 7:30 p.m and  I thought just a little cool out. Overall we thought the place had a nice casual atmosphere.

Through the whole night our server was really busy but yet fairly prompt. We didn't order anything unique. The French Dip with fries was good and so was their Black Angus Burger with the extras.  They were nice size sandwiches and served hot. With the burger I had the House Bleu  cheese salad. I liked the way they cut/shredded the lettuce, it was a little different.

I thought it was all good at a reasonable price for the area. Would go again.

Really pretty good food for a chain. The portions are on the small side. But the quality is better than average. The stuffed mushrooms are great. The steak and chicken Parmesan is decent. The salads are pretty good. I have eaten a great portion of the menu so I can safely say that all I had I enjoyed. Pretty good choice for the cost in the area.

This is an old stand-bye and it always delivers. We came here for the Happy Hour delights. The drinks are specials only. So the Georgia Peach was a full 9 bucks for 1/2 a gallon. Rude! I went thru the menu and just started rattling off stuff. The lettuce wrap was nice as you get to make it yourself with the shell of an iceburg. The thai wings and buffalo wings were right on. Flavorful and juicy. The sliders were a bit disappointing. Pork was lacking flavor and the roast had an onion ring on top that just couldn't save the day. They both came with thick cut fries that had a dusting of seasoning. They would have been fine on their own. That just made them a bit salty. The server was attentive and friendly. She made the experience more enjoyable.

Food portions are extremely small. Had the cream cheese stuffed chicke brrast.  It tasted like a frozen chicken kiev.  For the price i expected a bigger portion than about 3 oz of chicken and sides were equally as small.  The potatoes have skins in them which his nasty and proatoes were exrtremely starchy and lacking flavor.  Service was beyond slow and we rarely saw our waitress.  Skip this place.  Not worth the price.

Went there for my free birthday birthday entree. I couldn't decide what I wanted to order because they had so many options but I decided on a Long Island iced tea, which was great in flavor and presentation as well. I ordered the stuffed chicken which was amazing. I really enjoyed the garlic herb cream cheese that was stuffed in the breaded chicken breast. The potatoes were really good as well. I really like how they have food specials for happy hour and everyday drink specials. Can't wait to check out the patio!! The bartender (Jenn I believe was her name) was great. Was willing to help me make my decision and checked on me even though she was doing other work to set up the bar! I will definitely be back and recommend others to check it out, especially the patio!

Ordered French onion soup, the soup still had dehydrated onion that was still crunchy. Can't say for sure but it definitely seems like they used French onion soup mix. French onion soup is easy enough to make, not sure why shortcuts had to be made. Their sirloin steak was ok, definitely nothing special.

Meh. Service is mediocre, food isn't anything spectacular. I had a chicken wrap that came with chips and salsa. The portion was on the small side... Better suited for a lunch meal rather than my dinner. The portion of chips was tiny and they clearly used the crumbs at the bottom of the bag. I don't recall seeing our server more than once after she took our order.

I received a coupon for a free entree for my birthday since I was signed up for their email list. I hadn't been in a while but a few friends and I thought we might as well try it out. They made my birthday so special! First of all, our waitress (Jessica) was AWESOME and so nice! The bday coupon was a great touch, too. The food was very good (I had the fish tacos), and the drinks there are awesome. The prices there are really reasonable too! I will definitely be going back soon.

I've been here so many times already and I just have to make another review...

FISH TACOS!!!! They're so good. The server says that it is the one thing on the menu that no one (employees of Houlihans) ever get sick of. I'm sure they're good grilled too. I'll try it next time. Service was superb.

This place is a joke and a waste of time!

I went here with my family and it took about ten mins to get seated when the place was dead on a Saturday night. When we did get seated it was right behind the hostess booth with a bunch of high school age workers chatting and hanging out. About another 15 mins go by and the waiter finally comes with no waters, etc ( mind you there was maybe four other tables there). I swear we almost went through the whole beer list and they were out of everything, even your basic domestics.

 The waiter had to go and check after everyone we tried to order too (half the time we saw him go back and play on his phone or chat for a bit before returning). We finally decided with some wines and ordered food. Again, this place was dead and we were waiting another 30 mins for our food. We asked to talk to the manager and told her that the wait times and beer issue was ridiculous. I can see being a out of a few, but everything you try to order? They should of used a company card and hit binnys or something to cover till they restocked the next day. She apologized with the usual responses as we continued to wait. Another 10-15 mins go by and we asked for her again. 

 We told her that it was almost an hour without any food ( no appetizers served yet either) and we were leaving. Magically the food starts to come out and more apologies.  We said we didn't care even though she offered to give us food for free. and were leaving on the principle of the whole situation. She gave us some $25 vouchers which I gave to a homeless guy the next day.

 You couldn't pay me to go back here. When a place is practically empty it shouldn't take long for anything. Just the waiters attitude was aggravating too.Like it was comical that they didn't have anything and how long it was taking. After an hour of wasting our time we ended up just cooking at home, which we should of done in the first place......


Unacceptable to run a business like this. I wish I could comment on the food but I never got to taste it. The manager needs to actually manage and not be chatty Kathy with the staff. Also, when almost all your beer is out and you say a service company is coming tomorrow, go buy some and get reimbursed later or something.

Went out with a friend to celebrate two birthdays, it was midweek so they were not real busy. Our sitting down was prompt and service arrived very quickly. Our food was very good as usual and the waiter's service was prompt and professional. He was a new waiter, so I was very surprised, I was initially worried because after ordering he returned to confirm our order. It was a very pleasant night with a friend and good food.

I love Houlihan's! The food and service is always great and I've been here 30 million times. If I don't know what I'm hungry for, or we can't agree on where to go....we go to Houlihan's. I've had a lot of things on their menu; my favorites being: Center cut filet mignon, fish tacos, seared rare tuna wontons, stuffed shrooms, parm fries, spinach salad, and the soups. I love their mashed potatoes!

This location is my absolute favorite. Follow their facebook/text messages for all their Wednesday deals. The best is when they offer free soup or salad AND dessert with every entree. 

Drinks are all good.The Long Island iced teas are half price Sunday-Thursday!

The staff was very friendly and helpful.  I like how you can make reservations on line and the food is delicious with just the right portion.  I would go again if I was in the area and looking for a place to eat.

It's kind of strange, the first time I came here, it was relatively decent. The fried calamari was pretty good and I had a mushroom Burger with horseradish (don't recall the name) that was also good. However, the next three times that I've been here the food was bad, service was bad, and I will not go back.

Houlihan's is one of the best restaurants in the South Suburban area. I have never had a bad experience here. The food is always good and well seasoned. The prices are very reasonable. The ambience is wonderful and very swanky. It's a perfect place for a date or girls night out. The wait staffs are attentive and polite. I definitely recommend this place.

I've never been in here to eat, considering I felt like my business wasn't wanted. I went in to reserve tables for a coworkers going away celebration with 15 people, and the manager promptly told me since it was a Friday at 6:30(which was a 3 day notice) that "they don't reserve tables for groups on weekends" then tried to get us to come in when it was more convenient for them. I went to their competitor Champps, and they were more than happy to work with us. So we went there with our group and happily spent $687.74 cents. With how accommodating Champps was, we'll be taking our business there from now on. As someone who deals with customer service everyday, I can say yours was lacking, and a horrible first impression to a potential new customer

The waitress was amazing. The fact that they ran out of clean glasses on a Saturday night was unfortunate. Our apps came out before our drinks so that was different. The general manager walking around and looking at our drinks in to-go cups on the table could've at least said something but the strange look he gave us was interesting.

Seriously. The nicest Houli-scams I've ever been to. This is a newer location and that place is pretty nice on the insides. I'm used to grabbing a drink at the Wacker and Michigan location here in the city that's, well, a bit more seasoned. 

A good option if you're in the area. Price points seemed a little high for Houlihans but possibly, eh, it's not going to break the bank.
Over priced and too dark. The staff can be friendlier and its always packed

The prices seem to be the best thing about this place. The food looks good, but doesn't really taste half as good as it looks. Granted we came in late on a Saturday night, but we still expected hot, tasty food. When my friend and I checked in on Foursquare or Yelp (can't remember which) we got a free order of Frites (fries) which I figured oughtta be good. The fries came and they weren't really hot. They tasted alright. I got a salad, and my friends got meals. One got the chicken alfredo and the other got a sandwich I think. They didn't seem impressed. Not sure why the food wasn't all that, the place wasn't crowded, maybe the kitchen staff was tired because it was the end of the night.... If I decide to come back here, I
l'll come earlier, and won't order what my friends ordered.

I am a huge fan of Houlihan's. For me, it's all about Happy Hour here Sunday-Thursday. In my opinion, it's the only way to go.

I wouldn't go here for an actual dinner or meal in general. Where Houlihan's really wins out is with a group of friends for Happy Hour drinks. Me and my coworkers frequent this place and always have a great time. The service has always been friendly and efficient. We all order some Long Island Iced Tea pitchers (Georgia Peach is my favorite!) and a bunch of appetizers (Stuffed Mushrooms, yum!). And you really can't beat the price during happy hour... 1/2 off 1 liter pitchers anyone?! And definitely get a seat on the patio when it's nice out! 

Definitely recommend Houlihan's with a group of friends to have a good time in the early evening!

Today was my first time coming here and it'll probably be the last time too. First off its so DARK! Outside and in! Lightning needs to be changed. Second the food was bland, temperature of food was too cold for my preference. We ordered the chicken avocado egg rolls, and chicken nachos both disappointment. Chicken is dark meat which I'm not a fan of. For the main entrees which came after 45 minutes! Crazy we were about to get up and leave, even crazier the place wasn't busy! Anyway I got the fish tacos after reading reviews on yelp.. They weren't as expected. So normal nothing special about them. My kids got: BBQ chicken flat bread very cold, tasteless, bread was stale. Chicken tenders, sirloin 4 oz w/ order of fries and mashed potatoes, chicken Parmesan , and husband got the salmon between sourdough bread. All disappointments, all cold, all bland . Save ur money go somewhere else! You waiting for cold bland tasteless food it's not worth it! I'd give it only 1/2 a star but guess that's not an option. I have it one star just cause waiter was nice.
Long Island me please!!! But it seems like you guys are putting less alcohol and putting more juice no ice. It shouldn't depend on the bartender... But I love the chicken nachos
Best chicken Caesar salad ever! Service, food, price and wait time is always an A+, love coming here :)

Out of all the restaurants in Orland, this is by far one of my top go to choices. I come here pretty often, and always leave satisfied. Everything is always consistent, service is on point, and I always have a reason to come back. Out of all the times I've been here, I've only had one not so great experience, but it happens. They're steaks are great, loaded potato soup is amazing, and everything else is really worth trying. Plus they bring the kid's carrots and ranch to keep them busy while they wait for their meal. The servers are attentive, managers go around to ensure you're having a good meal, and you always see the hosts smiling and opening doors. I would definetely recommend this place if you're in the area!

We had the opportunity to celebrate a birthday yesterday at this restaurant. We have been here many times before and enjoyed the ambiance and the food. It is industrial, nice lighting, the bar with high tops and TV's for the games. This is definitely not a sports bar. The bar  is separate from the dining area. The whole area of t he restaurant is tidy and so are the restrooms. Outside seating is available during the summer months, with it being 26 degrees outdoors who wants to sit out? We have visited in the afternoon and evenings. This place is really busy during the evening hours. Now about the staff, we had Michelle as our server yesterday and what a nice person she was. Michelle made sure that she visited the table often for refills etc. She was able to accommodate a special request for my husband. The food was delish, as always, I had the filet with smashed potatoes, French Onion soup and a garden salad. The birthday boy had the Thai Chicken, pineapple rice and the Tomato Bisque. We also ordered the Buffalo wings, brought those home for later. The salad that I had was enough for a meal in itself. Dessert was the ice cream brownie sundae,  what a brownie, deep dark chocolate, this was okay except for the whipped cream. Enjoyed the meal, the service and the fact that the manager also asked how the meal was. Keep in mind that if you register for your birthday, the meal that you have is free. The bar area started to get busy as we waddled out to our car after a very nice meal. This is not a sports bar but I am sure that on Sunday's, it must be busy just for the wings and a cold beer at the bar.

Was here last night ave the food was horrible. The strip steak was med well, dry and unseasoned. They were out of every potatoe product. The drinks were ok, good chicken tenders and atmosphere. This is a drinks and appetizer spot...

Orland Park has many dining options available and unfortunately Houlihan's is just another dime a dozen. It's your standard american pub fare. If you are just meeting for drinks, it's probably ok. But, with so many other options available around town i'm just not sure why i would go back. My burger was so, so and the price for dinner was $11 for a burger. In the end i just didn't feel i got value.

Food menu items are sooo appealing. But what you expected from reading isn't what you get. The prices are obviously low. Service you have to wait so long before you get your order placed. Food comes out nice but not flavorful.

Houlihan's - 3 Stars: another nice find in Orland Park. This noisy, boisterous restaurant has a great feel to it ... youngish crowd and an excellent selection of food. We like the small plates that allow one to get a taste of more than one item. Good beer selection also. Recommended for all family groups.

Houlihan's is good, not great. I do come here often enough that I have tried a wide variety of items on the menu. Most are as you would expect, nothing stands out as a "must try". If you're looking for a restaurant that is going to deliver on it's promises but really don't expect to be socks-blown off wowed, then Houlihan's is a fine place to go. The service is always spectacular, and the turn-around time from ordering to having the food at the table is typically pretty short.

Also, they do cook up a pretty mean steak. (good thing!)

We have been to Houlihan's several times and we are never disappointed. The service is excellent and the food is always good! Our server, Kevin was very attentive and made sure we were well taken care of. The manager Chris stopped by just to make sure everything was to our satisfaction and gave us our dessert on the house!! I highly recommend this restaurant! You will not be disappointed!!
Full bar and a good place to have a beer. The food is mediocre at best. Great sports bar but save dinner for a different restaurant.

I don't like BLT's so tonight when my wife said, BLT's or take Houlihan's up on this 15% off coupon they emailed me?  I replied, Put your coat on.  Since it's about 90 degrees out we didn't even have to do that.

We shared their Asian ribs which are spicy and good.  I had the NY strip special which I found to be very good.  I like steak, what can I say.  For dessert, the donut dessert and coffee.  Left very satisfied and only slightly worried that we will probably have the BLT's tomorrow.

Delicious food, great service. In town for work purpose;. I stopped by worried about how my experience would be considering some of the yelp reviews I had read. I didn't find that the negative reviews held any weight. My server, Brittany, was lovely, as were the support crew around her. I will come back next time I am in town.

I have never had a bad experience at Houlihan's. The service is always good, they have the best chocolate martini's around. 

I highly recommend either the meatloaf or the pot roast.

I had been here a few times before and I never had a problem, however this last time was terrible experience. 

1. Ordered a soup for myself and salad for my wife for starter.  Her salad was forgotten and finally given to us after 10 minutes after receiving my soup. 

2. Ordered a refill, when it came the waitress took it upon herself to grab my straw and move it to the new cup. Now I'm not saying she's dirty, but I don't know anything about her. Very unsanitary thing to do. 

3. 20 minutes after waiting they came to tell me they ran out of meatloaf. It took them 20 minutes after I ordered to realize they ran out? 

4. I changed my order to a chicken sandwich after they ran out of meatloaf, and they still had the nerve to charge me for the meatloaf! It wasn't that big of a difference, but you would figure after they ran out of the food and made me change my order they would make sure to charge me correctly. Nope. 

5.  On top of all this my waitress seemed to have ignored me most of the night.
Pleasantly surprised.  Seared tuna, fantabulous.  mini martinis, YUM!  Definitely the place for happy hour or after set.
Buffalo Chicken fingers are the best you can find!! Wish they'd bring back the fried goat cheese, it was sooo good.

Went with my coworker and boss yesterday this is one of her favorite restaurants and I had high expectations. I only eat fish and ordered the Atlantic salmon and it was just okay I wish they would have had a tasty sauce to go along. They enjoyed their meals though.

I have never had a bad experience at this location.  The staff is always very friendly without checking on you every five minutes.  The drinks are good and I've liked every chicken entree I've tried!  I would suggest signing up for their e-mails because you always get a coupon or special for that Wednesdays and an AMAZING birthday discount!

First off, outrageously, amazing, satisfying, real customer service. Our food took maybe an hour to come out, I didn't care at all because I was with my family enjoying the time together. I really didn't notice it was that long. Our waitress, the kitchen manager, and the general manager came to our table and apologized for the long wait (not all at once). We didn't care and said it was okay and not a big deal. They decided to pay for our appetizers and my steak that apparently came out cold? It really wasn't cold. Then they brought out 3 free desserts (we couldn't finish). All in all they payed $55 of our $140 bill. Houlihans is one of my favorite restaurants in Orland park. I recommend this place. It's fire.

I know, Houlihan's is a chain.

But I have to admit, I just really like it!

We go there a lot and today's visit was a pleasure just like our other ones. 

We got seated right away and had our favorite server, Travis.  He is not only a great server but over the years we have discussed history and politics with him, a bonus!

We had the lettuce wraps to start, which are my favorite lettuce wraps.  For entrees, I had the Parmesan crusted Tilapia with berries and asparagus.  It's a great combination of crunchy, fruity tastes and textures.  It feels healthy so don't tell me if it's not!  My husband had the NY Strip, a little risky in a chain in my opinion but he really liked it.  

I love desserts here because they are not the normal huge serving and stickiness, calories and heart attack a la mode of most chains.  They have small tastes and fun choices.  I had the Snicker one which went great with coffee.

A very satisfying meal with superb service and we got home before the rain turned to snow, great Midwestern Saturday afternoon.  Only thing that could improve a meal here is to come in the nice weather when their patio is divine.
All I can say is, BEST LONG ISLANDS EVER. and half price Sunday-Thursday.

We visited Houlihan's for lunch with a few beers.  

I would have to say, I am pretty impressed with the place! We arrived a little while after they opened, and were seated quickly. The beer selection was decent, with prices being about average for the area. 

The 3 slider combo was awesome! I had one pork bbq, one burger, and one pot roast sandwich. I also had the "parmesan frites" with a trio of sauces.  Unfortunately, ketchup was one of the three sauces?  Still, some pretty great food, and I would not mind returning. 

I know Houlihan's is a chain restaurant, but it's a nice change from the usual places.

Had a large birthday dinner here for my brother. I've never eaten here before but I've heard good things from many people so I booked the reservation. Here's the good and bad...Pros - We were seated right away, waiter was very attentive but wasn't too much, manager came around to check on us, food was hot.
Cons - The food just wasn't anything special at all!!!! Everyone at the table just felt like the food was just ok. My brother had the steak and lobster tail, two of his favorite things on earth and he just said it was fine but he's had better. I had the buffalo  bleu cheese chicken salad, which i was taken aback because the salad dressing it was tossed in wasn't bleu cheese but some sweet type of ranch dressing which i did not like, but once they gave me my bleu cheese it was ok. My bf had the chicken alfredo and he likes olive garden's much better. So none of us were impressed. The atmosphere would be nice for a date night, but i don't think we will be back.

If you are part of their birthday club, you get a free meal on your birthday. I like that. Most places just give you free dessert these days.

There is literally something here for everyone. If you can't find something you like, then you don't like food. The menu is actually more on the overwhelming side, it's so hard to narrow down what I want when I go there! 

They have a good mixed drink menu, but not a good beer menu. So this is great for a girls dinner or night out with friends. 

I got a seared tuna salad there...it tasted great, but could've used more tuna. It was just meh, after that. I wasn't really full. 

The margaritas were great, but I don't think our server understood us EVER. We went for a girlfriend's birthday, and we had to constantly ask him for more drinks. We figured out that we needed to ask him 3 times before ever getting anywhere. It became the big joke of the night, how we had to ask 3 times before getting anything. It eventually became more annoying, though.

All in all, I like Houlihan's, but probably would not go to this location again, based on service alone.

Stuffed chicken was absolutely delicious.  I would definitely order that again!  While it is a chain we certainly are comfortable and satisfied when leaving.  We meet with friends here often and always enjoy the atmosphere, food and drink.

Great friendly staff, amazing spinach artichoke dip, chocolate wine-tini's and mini plates of goodness - How can you go wrong!!?? You Can't. Unless you only stay for 1 drink and leave. But who does that?
I love this place for happy hours with the gal pals. We can enjoy great drinks, awesome food and a good space to chat and giggle. we also don't spend oodles so we can keep coming back.
I used to love houlihan's, until they started hiring people off the streets with no experience in cooking simple American food. It's sad cause they focus more on the quantity rather the quality.

As far as chain restaurants go, Houlihan's is easily my favorite. 

The place is clean with a fun atmosphere. 

Service seems to be top notch as far as chains go too. On our last visit our waitress misunderstood and took my friend's dish rather than boxing it up. They made him a whole new salad to take home. 

The food is good, and I think Houlihan's has  by far the most exciting and creative menu of any chain. I love the small plate menu. The fish tacos are awesome! The smores fondue might be my favorite restaurant dessert ever!

Orland Park is a mecca of chain restaurants, but I think Houlihan's stands above the rest.

We always come here after work for their various drink specials throughout the week. Good drinks for the price and appetizers are great too! If you have the FourSquare app on your phone, make sure to check in here because you get good deals for doing so! Last time I had free fritas for checking, anything free is good! It's a great place for late night drinks if you're just looking to hang out, nothing crazy and nothing fancy.
I have come to this place for years and I always enjoy myself. Good food. Decent service and awesome long island iced tea. If you go on Thursdays they are half price.

Haven't had a poor/bad moment yet. Good service: supportive and customer centric staff. I'm usually seated within minutes of entering and my orders are timely. 

Easy access/ easy exit along La Grange Rd. on Orland Park.

In a sea of chain restaurants that is Orland Park, Houlihan's is my favorite. 

I really like their small plates menu.  It is great to share a bunch of different things and it makes for a much less expensive check.  The Parmesan Frites are great and the three dipping sauces are really what makes it.  For dessert I usually get the s'mores  fondue or the donuts.  Both excellent.  

I also always have great service here and if you call ahead on a Friday or Saturday for a reservation you won't have to wait for a ridiculous amount of time before being seated.

Every time we went there it was terrible....gave it 3 tries and I'm done. The last time we went, my 3 yr old wanted a burger off the kids menu. I made sure to say well done....came pink....sorry not ok for my toddler.

Visited on 05/03/2013.   The liter size Long Island (Raspberry) are great and good value at 7.75, even though it is not actually a liter.   Our Server (Lucia M) did not write down our orders, and delivered wrong salad dressing and wrong side dish.   Salad dressing portion is too small for size of salad.   Both 4oz and 8oz Filet Mignon were smaller than expected.  The side portions are too small.

I have been back over a dozen times since my first experience. I was probably grouchy that night. I love the food, especially the Scallops with asparagus risotto. Staff has always been friendly and fast, we've become regulars.

This is one of my favorite places to eat. The food is amazing, the drinks are great and not as expensive as most other places, but the best part of this restaurant is the service. I have always had great service at this restaurant from walking in to leaving. If you go you have to try the Italian doughnut wholes. They are a little slice of heaven.

Met Patricia K. here for lunch around noon on a Sunday.  I thought this place was closed when I walked in since there were almost no people in the restaurant.  

My veggie sandwich was really good and it comes with a choice of sides including Mediterranean orzo, mashed potatoes, fries, vegetable of the day, rice.  It's kind of nice to have a choice besides french fries.  Everyone's food seemed to be pretty good - but not amazing.  They have a nice kids menu including apple sauce and ice cream.

Service was standard.  Our waiter looked like he just came from the nearby Lifetime Fitness, goes there on his breaks and before and after work too.

I love coming here for drinks and appetizers.  We've had almost everything on the 'small bites' menu and haven't encountered anything bad yet.  We haven't been able to avoid the Parmesan Frites and the pitcher of Sangria; they're very addicting!  (The pitcher is only $12!)

I would suggest signing up for their emails for coupons.  I believe the first one you get may be a free appetizer.  Wednesday must be the slow night because they have a deal via email each week.
Great menu choices and easy to get a table on a weekend. The wait staff was a little questionable but nothing that would ruin your experience. The drink menu is also pretty decent.

I hate, hate, hate chains but I have to admit, if you're going to go to one, this one is absolutely decent and even above-average. I have been to this Houlihan's three times and also to one near Kansas City, where the chain began a long time ago. The service is generally good, but what is nice is the contemporary ambiance, the full bar, and the attention to every table from management. The variety on the menu is really commendable, especially if you are vegetarian or in any way health conscious. I LOVE the white bean salad. The one complaint I have is that they got rid of the Skinny Cutini cocktail. That really was great. The new drink list includes something called a Skinny Raspberry Mojito, which I tried but really didn't like. It kind of tasted artificial. On this last visit, my mother had a Long Island and it was HUGE. She's a petite woman and she wasn't even buzzed, so I have to believe that they skimp on their alcohol pours. Regardless, if you're stuck in strip mall hell in Orland and need a break, Houlihan's is a very suitable oasis in sea of sameness.

Great food, drinks and service! Love their salads! Especially the Chop
Chop Asian Chicken salad!

I mean, can you really not like a place that has 1/2 priced long islands Sunday through Thursday? My friends and I come here for both food and beverages quite a bit. Their appetizers are great and I definitely recommend the fried artichoke and cheese. Easily my favorite entr√©e dish is their scallops and risotto. Service is always friendly and fast and I constantly see a manager walking around making sure everything is running smooth and customers are happy. I highly recommend this place for a cheaper (but still nice) date night if you're on a budget. And I definitely recommend this place if you and a few other people want to unwind with some wonderfully-priced cocktails after work. Fun tip: They always have free coupons in the quarterly Restaurant Directory!

I went here about 2 weeks ago with a friend and it was ok the food was rather generic and mediocre. I didnt like the chicken fettucine alfredo because the chicken kind of tasted burnt and was a bit on the salty side. Dessert was ok nothing to write home about and the service was ok but the patrons in there are kind of snotty like you didnt belong there since Orland comes off to me as one of those upper crust suburbs where if you're not rocking a Blackberry or some expensive smartphone with a Coach or Louis Vuitton handbag you dont fit in. I have had better than Houlihans after eating at this place in two different locations. Plus my friend and I waited for a table for nearly 45 minutes and spent that at the bar having a drink before dinner and I wasnt impressed by the nasty looks some of the customers were giving to me as if they never saw a black person in their entire lives.

We had 8 people with us and later that night and the next day we were all experiencing symptoms of food poisoning. Most of us has chicken based dishes and apps. One had steak and one had a burger. Probably will never go to that location ever again. Positive.. the server (Ashley) was really friendly and did a good job.

WE love this place.  The steak and wedge salad is terrific.  Just a nicely done four ounce steak with a wedge of iceberg, covered with blue cheese dressing and a slice of quality blue cheese.  A few nice touches like the asparagus and light beets with the wedges of hot, fried polenta make this a meal.  

Drink specials are quite worth it, such as the Long-Island specials Mon-Thurs and 6.95 appetizers, such as the Chicken Nachos-huge.

The staff is friendly and we see plenty of regulars, at the same time, same day we visit there.  So that says something about the "Cheers-everybody knows your name atmosphere."  The decor is sophisticated for Orland Park and again, the food is pretty darn great!

I don't want to say they have a perfect steak but they have a really good steak! I've had both the Filet Mignon and their New York Strip . . . both are delicious. My friend always enjoy the mini Filet. The steak is always juice, seasoned and you don't need any time of steak sauce (don't insult the steak that way!). 

I've been here on several occasions now. I thought it was time to give what have become my regular spot a review. While I do enjoy their food and those wonderful Key Lime Pie Martini's (DELICIOUS), their service is sometimes lacking. Friendly but it seems like their wait staff are constantly making mistakes. 

For one instance a waitress brought my salad after I already had my entree and didn't remember I ordered rolls until I told her to cancel that order (what type of mess is that?). She constantly made mistake through out the night. Another waiter refuses to write down your order as if to give off he's a pro at this. Yea, it impressed me the first time I had him until he started forgetting food and getting the wrong order. Bruh, just write it down! Still the waiter was friendly but that waitress was just snotty.

Love this place! Great appetizers (try the mushrooms!)

Probably my favorite place to grab a bite last minute.

Plenty of drink specials and the food is above average for a chain restaurant. Nice outdoor seating area in the spring/summer as well.

I'd recommend the Fish Tacos, & the Filet, both will not disappoint!
MY new go to place.  nice menu, good food. Comfortable bar area.

I stopped by with a small group of friends after shopping at the mall nearby. Even though it was busy, we were seated quickly and the waitress arrived almost instantly with a happy attitude to take our order. Her name was Carli and she gave us great recommendations on what to order. I was not disappointed with my meal, it was hot and tasted good. Not 1 person at our table was upset with the service, which is hard to do sometimes. If I am ever in the area again, I will most likely stop by again.

This was my first time in a Applebee's in quite a while. We brought the family for a weekday dinner. The service was great, but the food was absolutely awful. My husband salmon was grilled so dry that it was crumbling on his plate. My chicken with gravy was fried sodark  brown that it was bitter to eat. I ended up packing it up and throwing it away when I got home. The kids ate their meals and didn't seem to have much of a problem with it but my son didn't touch his pizza bread at all.
It was a very warm day outside and the air conditioner was on so cold in this place that we were all freezing.
I most likely will not return to this establishment because the people in the kitchen apparently don't know how to properly cook food without overdoing it.

Ordered Southwestern salad.  Steak was good.  Should have asked for dressing on the side, surprised that restaurants do not automatically do that, by whatevs.  The waitress was pushing the margaritas.  They actually make the servers carry around a shaker and promote them, which I thought was kind of silly, but hey, that's chain restaurants.  Also, when the margaritas came, they did some half-ass salted rim on the martini glass.  Come on now, you had one job bartender.  The server was very friendly and nice.  Thought about asking her if we could be friends, didn't want to be a weirdo though.

We decided to try Applebee's it's been a while since we've been there , they were not too busy which was good, they have little tablets at the table you can let your kids play games on for an added $2 on your bill, well worth it, you can also call your waiter from it as well as pay your bill, our waiter Derek was by far the best and goes above and beyond for his customers I would recommend asking for him if you go there , the food was very good and just a good visit, we will be back again

We've never been to this Applebee's before nor have we been to one in a very long time. This location is borderline filthy. The tables are sticky, the carpeting is sticky and held together with duct tape in places. The bathrooms are really disgusting. Our order wasn't exactly right, but I'm not sure if it was the fault of the waitress or of the kitchen staff. The staff seems nice, but certainly needs a primer in sanitation.

Horrible! I haven't been here in a while. Music was too loud for dinner. They have a new menu with very few choices. Ordered 2 sirloins on the 2 for $25 menu. With drinks & 1dessert the bill was $54!  Food was mediocre at best.The onion rings tasted like the were battered with flour without any seasoning. The potatoes were overcooked, my date's rice was sticky. My dessert was VERY unsatisfying. Charged us for the trivia game at table we didn't want. (They did remove that charge.) The service was good but not good enough to bring me back.

Excellent visit. Ordered the bone in porkchop over an apple chutney with garlicky green beans and maple sweet potatoes. Both the food and service was excellent. If they can maintain this level of service and quality you will see me here quite often.
The food was "ok" wasn't how I expected very over priced I got the fish and chips the chips were old and dry the fish was okay but is not worth no 14$ bring it down to 7$ would never go back

We always enjoy the food & the service here. If you're a WW member,  this is a wise choice. The Cedar Grilled Lemon Chicken is 16 points, but it's a big meal so I take half home. Never had a bad meal here!

I normally don't go to this Applebees because I've had such bad service in the past.  Tonight I happened to be in the area and decided to stop.  I don't know if I just got lucky but the service tonight was great even though the place was crowded.  I ate at the bar to get free chips and salsa.  The blueberry sangria was very good.  I tried the new crispy chicken dish and that was ok.  Giving it 5 because of the awesome tandem bartenders.

I normally don't review chain restaurants, yet I'll make an exception for this Applebee's. Pretty fun experience while visiting Joliet. I stopped at this location twice and had bar service, and was not disappointed with the two female bartenders. Applebee's is usually very consistent with their food quality, and this location was not different.

I greatly appreciated the staff from going above & beyond to make my experience a good one. I celebrated a birthday while in town for business, and I joked with both bartenders about being here while on the road. They surprised me with having the entire staff as well as cooks come out to sing me happy birthday, which I felt was truly awesome as well as unexpected. And plus, I was given a free birthday brownie, which I felt was kind of cool. I'll never forget it.

Altogether, good food, good service, and good times.

Because I was a server for many years, I have a bad habit of watching the service, management, and dining room. 

We got a gift card for Christmas and decided to come last night. When we got here it wasn't crowded at all. We were seated right away. However, it took us a good 10 minutes to get drinks. The table next to us was getting ready to leave. By the way their table looked, you would think they just got their food. The server closed them out, sat at the bar to count her tips, got her coat and left. We finally got our drinks. 

The food was normal chain food. The onion rings were too crispy and hard to bite into. Nothing spectacular. The table next to us was still dirty and now we are losing room on our table as well with extra cups and dirty plates. 

The manager appeared to like walking around. He was the one to serve our food and kind of dropped our plates down on the table. My husband and I ordered the same thing, but mine didn't come out with everyone else's. He walked away and a couple minutes later came back with my food. He looked at the table next to us, grabbed the booster seats, looked like he was going to clean it, and walked away. 

The dinner rush is starting to come in now and everyone that walked by the dirty table looks at it and leaves. We closed out our bill and getting ready to leave. No one still touched the dirty table. 

I shouldn't let it bother me, but if they're too lazy and unorganized to clean a table, why should I come back? Most likely won't be returning.
Salmon fish and what was everything was good Nick very patient with seniors and disabilities I will return back to this restaurant Nick was good and he has very nice customer service to you.

Place was clean, best I can say about it. It just opened for the day, and not real busy, drink order was messed up, 
Our waiter did not come back, so a different waitress started  taking our order, half way through, waiter showed up, bumped waitress  out of the way, and made us start all over again. Then, after confirming order put it in to kitchen, then had to come back and confirm  it. 
Hope it is just a bad morning for them, but place needs to step it up, or they will be losing my business
So I've been here 2 times this week. An both times I got dirty plates. An they allow minors to handle liquor. Very professional

My family & I went for dinner last weekend only cuz I had a gift card to use but service sucked as usual! Even the location on Jefferson St. Sucked! Waitress had not much knowledge of the menu! I knew more then her! We waited way too long for our soups & salads! Other tables got served before us & they sat down after us! Drinks never got refilled unless we told our waitress! Not cool at all! My son calls it "CrapelBees" not going back! Hopefully I don't get any more gift cards for this place either!

Applebees is Applebees :)

I had a new dish (at least I'd never noticed it before) - Lemon Parmesan Shrimp Fettucine (or something like that...). It was quite yummy, although I was almost too tired to chew.

Our waitress was kind and efficient.

And in case the people my friend gave her beer to (when she was too tired to drink it and only took a few drinks) are Yelpers - Hi!! Glad it didn't go to waste.

Food was okay. My island blast drink was a little off, it wasn't too strong or not strong enough it just tasted way too bitter. There was a problem with our waitress other customer so we had to ask for water about 4 times before we got anything.

It is what it is; pre-cooked frozen processed food served by all chains.  The place was full but very clean.  The layout is open & comfortable.  I don't normally care for food in places like this (if I must eat at a chain, I chose some with better quality items or any Greek diner nearby), but I would go back to try something more that a small item to give it a better review.

Went here last week with my boyfriend. We normally always come here and never have a problem. I believe our waitress was new, she was very polite. they were dead yet it took forever to get drinks and our food.

We started off with the beer pub pretzel which are seriously amazing! And 15 hot wings. Everything was great except for  having to ask for a cup of ranch twice...

Then we ordered the triple bacon burger, I'm not sure why they chose that name because it was literally just a patty with two pieces of bacon. We asked for little pink in our burgers and they came back over cooked and dry.  
Not happy at all.

What really bothered me, was when I had piled all of our dirty plates on top of one another and pushed them to the end of our table for our waitress to pick up, they were just left there. Some guy dropped of our dinner, saw the plates and did nothing. Our waitress came by to check on us and did nothing about the dirty plates and who i believe was a manager came by to check on us look at the pile of dirty plates and walked away. Come on!! 
I was a waitress and that's one of the most important things to do! Learn to pre buss your tables people!! I don't want to eat my dinner looking at dirty plates...
Also don't bother ordering the sweet potato fries, they are dry and tasteless.

Not sure if we'll be back.

The service here is TERRIBLE!  
I've been waiting now for over an hour for my food and no word on when I'll be seeing my order or why it's taking so long. No apology, no manager came around to see how everything was going, nothing. This is utterly rediculas behavior for a restaurant. I'll be asking for my bill on the drinks and heading to McDonald's next door, and you can bet that I will NOT be coming back to this location.

Its been hit or miss at this location. The steak a few weeks ago was terribly chewy (crappy cut of meat in general). Tonight 9/22/2015 just went in for a few drinks with someone (margarita, halloween martini, and my favorite ...beer), but also got the wonton tacos which i would go back for over and over just because of those.

Had the worst experience here! There was a plastic lid in my brother's soup! Did they offer to comp it, absolutely not. In fact, their obnoxious manager, kept coming to our table, apparently to make things better, but would make things worse. She would ask if we needed anything, then would forget within a minute and not bring it out or make sure someone else did. Our drinks were not refilled, our dirty dishes sat at our table the whole time! We had 3 different servers. It was really just terrible service!!!! We went out there for Father's Day and we will not be going back ever. If I could give no stars, I would. We wanted to have a good sit down meal with my dad and all we talked about was how bad the service was. My dad and brother love Applebee's, so this was sad. We usually go to Jefferson St., but opted for this one and will not do that again!

I called and ordered the carside to to option.  My husband had to wait much longer than the given wait time...he said it was for the breadstick that came with my pasta.  Odd, since all of my food was barely warm when it got home after a 3 minute car ride...I went for the spinach/artichoke app since "with our current promotion, it would be almost free!"  Well, you get what you pay for...barely warm, and certainly not at all seasoned.  My entree was a 4 cheese mac and cheese...minus most of the cheese.
They have remodeled and it looks great! we usually sit at the bar and the bartenders are always friendly and the food is always good!

It's the same as all other Applebee's.  They do have good appetizer specials, which is the reason we go.  The bar maid tries to be funny when inter-acting with the customers but to me she comes off as smart-aleck.

Service and food have been hit or miss in the past but after this most recent visit I will never be back. 

My boyfriend and I went here last week and it was a horror from the moment we walked in. They couldn't figure out where to seat us, finally the host comes up and tells the manager to seat us at "35." We were sat for ten minutes before our server Michelle came to even greet us. We order two alcoholic drinks and asked for a few minutes with the menu. 

To cut this review short, basically she never once brought us anything. Our drinks sat at the bar for a long time while she yacked with another server by the computer, I had to flag another server down to get water and then later again to get another round of waters. Our appetizer sampler was missing the spinach dip and we had to ask someone to go grab it for us, the mozzarella sticks were ice cold but she didn't come back to check on us so we couldn't tell her. My burger that was ordered "pink" came out with no pink and she didn't check on us to get this fixed. Finally when she did decide to check on us it was too little too late. I was so annoyed I just wanted to leave. The manager asked me if everything was alright at the end because once again I had to go find my server this time at the host stand chatting to get my check and a box (which once again took forever.) I explained it was a poor experience without getting into it and tried to offer me a coupon to come back. Sorry not happening. Restaurants like Applebee's are a dime a dozen. Off to Chiles it is.

As a franchise you likely already know what to expect of this place before you come in.  Generally I have had pleasant experiences with Applebee restaurants and this was not an exception.

Our party of nine, with five younger children, would probably be enough to make most servers hope you do not sit at their table, but out waitress did a great job.  Everything came as ordered, refills were brought without even asking for one, and the kids were kept happy.  The Blackened Steak Penne plate I ordered was quite good and I did not hear any complaints from anyone else at the table.

Unfortunately they do not really have anywhere to seat a party of this size, but a couple of tables were put together to accommodate us.  The only downside of this was that one side of the table was very tight up against a wall, but we managed well enough.

I recommend giving this place your business if you are in the area.

greasy garbage. since when does a blt get butter on the toast?  turns it into a big greasy pile of crap. The side salad should be called a cheese salad.   by the way American cheese just makes the blt seem cheap, and heavier than it should be. strawberry avocado salad was boring and had no texture. Applebee's and the other chains like it are what's wrong with food in America
Good service and food. No complaints.

Worst service ever! Took 10 minutes to be seated. Finally went to bar because server never showed at table.  Ordered food and drinks, never got a refill on our drinks.
